loans.name: Redelma

texts.en:
Redelma is a local from Iloilo, Philippines. She is 49 years old and married with eleven children. Six of her children are still dependents, ranging in age fomr four to sixteen. 

She has been fishing with her husband for 29 years now. This is their main livelihood in raising their family. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, fishing weights, engine, rope, and nylon. These tools are essential so their fishing is productive, thus maximizing their profit.

In the future, Redelma dreams of expanding her business for sustainability and ensuring that her children can go to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fishing weights, an engine, rope, and nylon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his plantings of oranges.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married 38-year-old woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur, running a vegetable business in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Elma successfully repaid her previous loan and has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Elma has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Elma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 33 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jovita has a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jovita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Jovita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Vergie works hard to support her family. She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from personal products. Vergie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of purified drinking water to sell to customers.

Vergie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Laurencia

texts.en:
Laurencia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Laurencia has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 60 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jessica has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca cuenta con 45 años de edad de los cuales la mayoría los ha utilizado en ganarse la vida ya que desde muy joven ha trabajado actualmente se dedica a la elaboración y venta de platillos típicos en su domicilio, entre los cuales están: pasteles de carne, enchiladas, yuca, nuégados, empanadas, etc. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos, por lo que se siente feliz y satisfecha de poder brindarles un lugar donde vivir. Blanca siempre está buscando lo mejor para su familia, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir la cocina y el lavadero de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca is 45 years old, and she has spent the majority of those years earning a living, since she has worked from the time she was very young. She currently earns a living preparing and selling typical dishes in her home. Among the dishes are: meatloaf, enchiladas, yuca [cassava], pastries, empanadas, etc. 

She lives in her own home with her husband and 2 children, and she feels satisfied and happy to be able to provide them with a place to live. Blanca is always looking for the best for her family, and for this reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build up the kitchen and wash room in her home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build up the kitchen and wash room in her home.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is a married, 51-year-old woman with eight children, two of whom attend school. She lives in Dulag, Leyte. Fedelina engages in the raising and selling of hogs and has done so for ten years. Due to the lack of capital, and to continue her livelihood, Fedelina has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP. This will be used to buy materials to restore the pig pen (wood, nails, nipa (palm) for roofing). This will help Fedelina raise healthy pigs that will be sold in the coming months, thus providing her family with basic needs.

Fedelina's dream is to expand her hog-raising business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials to restore a pig pen.

loans.name: Maria Desideria

texts.es: María de 55 años de edad es una mujer admirada en su cantón por su empeño para sacar adelante a su familia, que es bastante extensa, ya que está compuesta por su esposo, sus hijos de 25, 23, 21, 19, 17, 15 y 13 años de edad y otros mayores de edad que ya tienen sus propios hogares. Ella ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos ya mayores de edad que la apoyan con la economía de su hogar al igual que su esposo. María desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI que le permita invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, postes y un portón, para construir un cerco alrededor de su vivienda que le permita brindar una mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old, and is an admired woman in her village for her determination to move her family forward, which is fairly large. Her family consists of her husband and her children ages 25, 23, 21, 19, 17, 15, 13, and other older children that now have their own homes. She has managed to get her older children ahead, and these now support her in the home expenses just like her husband does.

Maria is requesting a loan from FUSAI to allow her to buy cement, sand, gravel, posts, and a gate to build a fence around her home that will bring greater security to her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, posts, and a gate to build a fence around her home.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy is a 57-year-old woman with five children living in Banteay Meanchey province.  She grows cassava on seven hectares as her single source of income. This is her third cycle with VisionFund, as she has successfully repaid her past loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay school fees for her son, who wants to pursue a B.S. degree in management. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's school fee.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Ou Chrov Dristrict

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en: Due to the hardship of living, Victorina aimed to improve her small retail store in order to increase her income. She is 58 years old and has two adult-age children. She wants to increase her grocery inventory but has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is requesting an additional loan of PHP 10,000.  It will be used to buy more snack foods, assorted candies, canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, seasonings, soft drinks, and beverages. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods, assorted candies, canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, seasonings, soft drinks, and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Zelita

texts.en:
Zelita is married with one child and lives in Oecusse. Her business is computer rental. She lives near many people and had an idea to open a rental business. This way if people want to print a document she will not be far away. She had opened this business in this year, earning a good daily income. This is because many people come to print a document in her rental store, so she is very happy with her business. She requests a $700 loan from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger rental in the future. She will use the loan to buy paper, black and white ink, and other materials.

She started to open a billiard table in 2014 with her own working capital of $300. She hopes with this loan, her business will improve in the future.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink, and other materials.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is 50 years old and married with four children, two of whom are still in school. Librada works very hard to provide for them.

Librada runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock. This includes toothpaste, diapers, sanitary pads, soft-drinks, beer, milk, and seasonings.



Librada has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, diapers, sanitary pads, soft-drinks, beers, milk, seasonings, etc.



In the future, Librada would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, diapers, sanitary pads, soft-drinks, beer, milk, and seasonings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to build a room out of sheeting in his home.

loans.name: Ma. Erna

texts.en:
Ma. Erna is married and works hard to support her family. She has a charcoal business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending and tricycle transportation. Ma. Erna is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more charcoal and firewood to sell.

Ma. Erna has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and, more recently, Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Loleta

texts.en:
Loleta is 34 years old and married with nine children, six of whom are in school. Loleta works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, and eggs. Loleta has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Loleta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, and eggs.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is married and works hard to support her family by running a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.  Lolita has been in this business for 35 years.  Lolita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Epiphrasie

texts.en: Epiphrasie is 34 years old. She is not married. She sells food stuffs and has been operating a business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and for her own welfare.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Marry Lou

texts.en:
Marry Lou is 62 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a charcoal sales business in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Marry Lou has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Marry Lou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Dorilyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Dorilyn works hard to support her family. She has a charcoal business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load). Dorilyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of charcoal.

Dorilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is married and works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.  Marilyn has been in this business for six years now.  In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a married, 44-year-old woman with ten children, six of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Magdalena has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Magdalena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 36 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sure, Philippines. She is married with  two school-aged children. She has a one-hectare rice field and has been in this business for seven years. She requested a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers to increase her harvest of healthy rice. She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Josephine wants her children to finish their studies and have a stable job.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase new furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize flour, cassava flour, beans and ground nuts for sale.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 50 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependents.

Maribeth earns a living raising ducks for 23 years. She earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase 150 ducklings for her existing duck raising business.

Maribeth has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Maribeth hopes to expand her agri-business by adding more ducks in order to have more eggs.

loans.use: to purchase 150 ducklings

loans.name: Normadia

texts.en:
Normadia is married and works hard to support her family by selling wood and nipa roofing in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Normadia has been in this business for six years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Normadia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more wood and nipa roofing stock.

loans.name: Marjoren

texts.en:
Marjoren is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. Marjoren has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Marjoren has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries.

loans.name: Edgarson

texts.en: Edgarson is 46 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with two adult-aged children. He is a farmer for 20 years. He requested a loan for seed bed preparation for the next cropping season. He wishes to double his harvest to sufficiently provide for the needs of his family. He has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Edgarson wants to build a decent home for his family.

loans.use: for seed bed preparation.

loans.name: Bonifride

texts.en: Bonifride is married and 42 years old. She has 2 children who attend school, ages 19 months and 20 years old.  She sells food items and has been working in a business for two years. With the requested loan, she would like to buy sorghum and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy sorghum and beans for sale.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace works hard to support her family. She is married and has a direct selling Avon and personal collection products business in the Philippines.  Mary Grace requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products from Avon and personal collection to sell to her customers.  Mary Grace has been in this business for 12 years now.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more Avon products.

loans.name: Abdalatif

texts.en: Abdalatif is a married man with three children, living in Kasese Uganda. He is a farmer who grows bananas, maize, rice, and cassava to earn a living. He has a dream of completing his family house. However, he is faced with limited capital. Abdalatif needs a loan to buy sand and cement to complete his family house.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement to complete his family house.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 37 years old, married and blessed with three children. She helps her husband in gaining income by managing a small junk shop within their community. She aspires to further improve this business in order to generate sufficient income to sustain their necessities and finance the education of her children. 

Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more stock of scrap materials to resell. Being a kind and diligent mother, she believes that someday, she will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of scrap materials to resell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Rosalie has been in this business for five years. Rosalie earns additional income from goat fattening.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Albertinha

texts.en:
Albertinha lives in Baucau, and she is married and has three children. She has been doing business since 2013 with her own working capital of $400. She is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital to improve her business.

She is taking this loan because she wants to additional supplies to keep in her store, such as potatoes, cooking oils, slippers, sugar, milks, coffee, biscuits,  noodles, toothbrushes, sardines and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

There are five members in the family, including her three children and her husband. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management for her business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, cooking oils, slippers, sugar, milks, coffee, biscuits,  noodles, toothbrushes, sardines and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is 61 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with six adult age children. She has a sari-sari store that sells different kinds of food and has had this business for seven years. She wants to start a new business for more income and she believes that farming is a perfect choice for her. She requested a loan to purchase farm inputs and seedbed preparation to sustain her rice and maintain it so it is healthy. She has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Beatriz hopes that her new business will be a success for their future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pay for seedbed preparation

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a factory worker. She is from Cavite, Philippines and she has two children. She is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Marivic works as a production line leader. She conducts inspections and tests per control plan, work instruction and procedures. She maintains good housekeeping at all time at the respective working area. She is also responsible for the group of operators and carries out manpower utilization effectively to meet shipment.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Marivic is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses, and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Marivic is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. She looks forward for your positive response and any help from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan as a starting capital for her canteen business.

Marivic wants to have a stable source of income so she could meet their daily needs and expense. She wants to give her children a better life and future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to add to her needed capital for starting a canteen business.

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nita is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Nita has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines. Nita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Nita has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Nita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lutgarda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lutgarda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lutgarda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of ingredients like spices, canned goods, fish, etc. for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lutgarda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ingredients like spices, canned goods, fish, etc.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is 44 years old and lives in Tambulig, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells meat and beef and has had this business for 24 years. She requested a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation to engage in a farming activity. She has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Leonida hopes that God will bless her farming activity for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Karen Joy

texts.en:
Karen Joy is 31 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children now at school age. Karen Joy is a plain house wife and receives monthly support from her husband who is a seaman. She earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month as her allotment. 

She has requested a loan to be used in paying the training fees and miscellaneous expenses for her husband’s promotional training. Karen Joy has been a member of PMPC just this year. Karen Joy wants to save more in our cooperative to prepare for and meet her family’s future needs.

loans.use: to pay the training fees and miscellaneous expenses for her husband's promotional training.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and sand to renovate his house on the inside.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, meat, fish, etc for her food vending business.

Leonora has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from selling vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, meat, and fish

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla is 54 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Prescilla has a buy and sell of used clothing business in the Philippines. Prescilla requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell.

Prescilla has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Prescilla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in sheets, wood, nails, and cement to build a kitchen in her house.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда образованная женщина с сельского района Гончи. Она на протяжении более 20 лет работает преподавателем в школе и любит свою профессию. Однако из-за трудностей с финансами она сейчас хочет параллельно начать новый бизнес, чтобы покрывать семейные расходы. Мавлуда имеет во дворе дома сарай и решила использовать его в качестве коровника. Она на свои сбережения запаслась кормом для скотов и планирует начать бизнес по откорму и продаже скотов. Чтобы купить скот, она нуждается в кредите. Мавлуда просит Вас помочь ей начать бизнес и заранее благодарит Вас за поддержку. Благодаря кредиту она сможет открыть стабильный прибыльный бизнес и улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Mavluda is an educated woman from rural Gonchi.  She's worked as a schoolteacher for more than 20 years and loves what she does.  However, because of financial difficulties, she's trying to set up a new business on the side which will help cover her family's expenses.  Mavluda has a barn at home and has decided to use it to keep cows for fattening and resale.  She's already used her savings to lay in stores of cattle feed, and is in need of a loan to buy some cows.  Mavluda is asking for your help, and thanks you in advance for your support.  This loan will allow her to have a stable, profitable business, and improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: buy cattle to set up a new business

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en: Zosima is 59 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 3 school-age children. She has a small eatery and has had this business for 2 years. She helps her husband with farming, which is their source of rice for their daily needs. She has requested a loan for seedbed preparation for the next crop season to sustain the demand of the market. She has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Zosima wants to be engaged in another business for her to earn more to support the needs of her children.

loans.use: to prepare seedbeds for the next crop season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, studs and beams to replace her roof.

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
José tiene 54 años vive en san miguel provincia de bolívar en la comunidad pucara, pertenece a la ventanilla rural la nueva esperanza, el no cuenta con un trabajo estable y tiene que mantener a sus tres hijos, solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agricolas para la simbra de maiz y obtener una buena producción para así solventar los gastos de su familia ya que sus hijos estudian, se dedica tambien a criar animales por que sus hijos ya estan en la universidad y necesitan. Realiza las compras en san pablo cada ocho días su sueño es comprarse un terreno y construir su casa. 
En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar cartas, le gusta el carnaval.
texts.en: José is 54 years old and lives in the community of Pucara in San Miguel de Bolivar province. He belongs to the Nueva Esperanza "ventanilla rural." He doesn't have steady work and must provide for his three children. He is requesting the loan to purchase farming supplies to grow corn and achieve a good yield so as to pay off family expenses since his children are in school. He also makes a living raising animals, because his children are in college and need his support. He makes his purchases in San Pablo every eight days. His dream is to buy a plot of land and build a home. In his free time he likes to play cards, and he enjoys the carnival.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy corn, oil, dressings, cheese, tomatoes, etc. which are ingredients that will help give continuity to her food stall ("pupusería).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood and nails

loans.name: Iris Yoselyn

texts.es: Iris una joven de 19 años que estudia la carrera de enfermería. Hace más de 01 año y medio que viene estudiando dicha carrera  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación le va bien en sus estudios. Actualmente continúa apoyando a sus padres en el hogar. Agradece a  su madre, pues es ella quien le brinda su apoyo. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de implementos y útiles de estudio. El deseo de Iris es de terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera profesional, insertándose al mercado laboral. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyar  a jóvenes como ella.
texts.en: Iris is 19 years old and studying nursing. She started this degree a year and a half ago and, thanks to her efforts and dedication, she is doing well. Iris continues to support her parents at home. She is grateful to her mother as she supports her. This loan will be used to buy study tools. Iris wants to finish her degree and join the labour market. Iris thanks Kiva investors for supporting young people like her.

loans.use: to buy study tools.

loans.name: Loce Laung Group

texts.es: Grupo Loce Laung está formado por tres socios emprendedores de éxito, una de ellas es Flor de 49 años de edad, casada, y se dedica a la venta de plátanos, desde hace diez años, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de matas de plátanos, una carretón para ser vendidos a domicilio, canastos, etc. Compra al por mayor y vende al detalle, y en algunos casos sirve como intermediadora entre el mayorista y el cliente final si desea cantidades de plátanos. Don Carlos tiene 58 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de accesorios del hogar desde hace diez años; Y la tercera socia es Jessenia tiene 30 años de edad y su negocio es la comercialización de cosméticos desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The "Loce Laung" loan group has three successful and enterprising members. One is 49-year-old Flor. She is married and has been making a living selling bananas for ten years. Flor will use this loan to buy banana plants, a cart to sell goods door-to-door, and baskets. Flor buys bananas in bulk and sells them retail. In some cases she acts as an intermediary between wholesalers and the final customer if s/he wants large quantities of bananas.

Carlos is 58 years old and has had a business selling accessories for the home for over ten years.

The third member of the group is Jessenia who is 30 years old and has had a business selling make-up for two years.

loans.use: to buy banana plants, a cart to sell goods door-to-door, and baskets, in order to increase demand.

loans.name: Elsi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elsy, es cosmetóloga, el negocio lo aprendió dentro de su familia, para perfeccionar sus conocimientos ha tomado cursos relacionados con dicha actividad, no cuenta con un horario definido; actualmente vive en una casa familiar, ella es madre soltera, los ingresos que genera con el negocio son utilizados para dar a su hijo lo mejor y apoyar en los gastos familiares.
Necesita mejorar el inventario y equipo de su negocio por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar cosméticos, tintes, tratamientos para el cabello, tijeras, etc., con la inversión realizara mejor su trabajo y atraerá nuevos clientes, espera tener mejores ingresos con los que cumplirá con sus obligaciones. 
Los sueños de Elsy son lograr abrir un salón de belleza de prestigio y dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Elsy is a cosmetologist who learned the business within her family and, to perfect her skills, took related courses.  She does not have a fixed work schedule and lives at home with her family.  As a single mother, her income is used to give her son the best she can and to help cover family expenses.

She is in need of improving the inventory and equipment of her business, and is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics, hair color and treatments, scissors, etc.  The investment will improve her work and attract new customers.  She hopes to improve her income to meet her obligations.  Elsy dreams of opening a prestigious beauty salon and giving her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, hair color, hair treatments, scissors, etc. to improve her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic supplies to fertilize his cocoa crops.

loans.name: Vilma De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Vilma, ha tenido buenos resultados al administrar bien los créditos Kiva que se le otorgan, hoy en día tiene un negocio más estable y amplio, con los nuevos ingresos cubre las necesidades familiares.
Nuevamente hace una solicitud de capital que invertirá en fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas y semilla, estos materiales serán de utilidad para preparar la tierra en la que sembrara maíz y frijol, así mismo evitara problemas de plagas.
texts.en:
Vilma has obtained good results through her management of the Kiva loans received.  Now she has a more stable, expanded business, earning more income to cover family needs.

She is requesting a new loan to buy fertilizers, manures, disease control products and seeds to prepare the land to plant corn and beans.  She also wants to avoid plant disease.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, disease control products and seeds to prepare the land to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 43 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Felicitas has been farming rice for five years, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and rice retailing.

Felicitas is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more sacks of fertilizer. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 52, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ruperto, a mechanical vulcanizer, and has two children, one of whom is in elementary and one who is still in the preparatory level in school. The couple works hard to support their daily needs and to send their kids to school.

Yolanda caters to party needs and also has video/karaoke and DVD rental.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Aside from those businesses, she also has a vulcanizing business, which her husband operates. She earns a minimum of 1,500 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which she will use to pay for party supplies such as souvenirs, tables, balloons, and maintenance of her video/karaoke machine. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Yolanda dreams of growing her business so she can send her children to the best schools. She wants to lead a happy and quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for party supplies and maintenance of her videoke service.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 68 years old and widowed with six children. Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 14,000 PHP loan from NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, such as biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, cooking oil, shampoo, and fabric conditioners.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, such as biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, cooking oil, shampoo, and fabric conditioners

loans.name: Estrella Marie

texts.en:
Estrella Marie is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more quantities of products for her direct-selling business. With her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more goods such as clothing and beauty products from popular direct-selling brands in preparation for Christmas orders. She will also use part of the loan to buy fabrics and thread for her doormat-making business, which is shown in her photo. She knows that more items on hand will result in more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her earnings from her store are a stable source of income to sustain her family's basic needs and to educate her children. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Estrella Marie dreams of expanding her business with other products to sell to increase her income. She aims to give her children the best education to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more items needed in her direct-selling business.

loans.name: Cristobal Augusto

texts.es: Cristobal tiene 27 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura ya que no cuenta con un trabajo estable y tiene que solventar a su familia que consta de sus dos hijos y su mujer. Vive en San Miguel provincia de Bolívar en la comunidad Pucara. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos orgánicos y fertilizantes para empezar a sembrar frejol y obtener una producción buena ya que es la única actividad que realiza porque no estudio y no tiene una profesión pero sale adelante gracias a la agricultura. Realiza las compras en san pablo cada 15 días por que no existe transporte frecuentemente, su sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijos para que lleguen hacer profesionales, le gusta hacer deporte en sus tiempos libres.
texts.en:
Cristobal is 27 years old and devotes himself to agriculture, as he doesn't have a stable job and needs to sustain his family, which consists in his 2 children and his wife.  He lives in San Miguel a province of Bolívar in the community of Pucara.

He is asking for the loan to buy organic compost and fertilizers to start planting beans and obtain a good harvest.  This is the only activity that he undertakes as he doesn't study and he doesn't have a profession but he keeps moving ahead thanks to agriculture.  He makes purchases in San Pablo every 15 days as there isn't frequent transportation.  His dream is to support his children so that they can become professionals.  He likes to do sports in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land to build a house

loans.name: Bebina

texts.en:
Bebina is 56 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is widow with six children. She has been a hardworking farmer since her husband died. 

She requested a loan to pay for labor, and six sacks of fertilizers and pesticides to give her business a big boost. She is the breadwinner of her family and that is why she has to do very well. She has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Bebina wants to buy more hectares of rice fields to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for labor, and six sacks of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es:
Ana, se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito por la facilidad de pago y los buenos resultados que tiene al invertirlos en su negocio, en esta oportunidad comprara gas propano al por mayor, para suplir las demandas de sus clientes, así también seguirá elaborando la venta de pupusas.
Con ayuda del préstamo anterior ha cumplido sus propósitos de tener mejores ingresos, cancelar sus deudas y tener un mejor estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en: Ana has decided to ask for a new loan because of the ease of payment and the great results she has had upon investing the money in her business. This time she will purchase propane gas wholesale in order to satisfy the demands of her clients and therefore continue selling pupusas (grilled, filled corn cakes). With the help from the previous loan she has achieved her aims of increasing her income, paying off her debts and improving her family lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase propane gas wholesale to satisfy the demands of her clients

loans.name: Belkis Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora  Belkis Vanessa  de 28  años de edad, tiene un hijo ella es casada,  vive con su esposo en su casa propia, vive en Nacaome Valle al Sur de Honduras, y se dedica desde hace 2  años  al negocio de venta de comida, frescos, licuados etc.
La señora Belkis es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
La señora Belkis está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de carnes, arroz, frijoles, plátanos, frescos, etc.  y desea reparar el techo de su local donde tiene el negocio. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su local para atender mejor a sus clientes.

San Lorenzo- Honduras- Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Señora Belkis Vanessa is 28 years old. She is married and has a son. She lives with her husband in her own home, in Nacaome, Valle in the south of Honduras. For two years she has made a living selling food, natural soft drinks, licuados (similar to smoothies), etc. 

Señora Belkis is a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead in life. She is asking for a loan in order to buy meat, rice, beans, plantain, natural soft drinks etc. and she also wishes to repair the roof of the premises in which she has her business. 

With the help of this loan she is going to try to improve her income and her quality of life. Her dream is to improve her business and her premises so that she can better attend to her customers. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras. October 2014.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, beans, plantain, natural soft drinks etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires and a radio for his mototaxi

loans.name: Roxana Yaneth

texts.es:
Roxana, vive en casa propia con dos hijas de 12 y 9 años de edad, es casada; se dedica a atender un estudio fotográfico, trabaja de lunes a sábado, es un negocio familiar, de esta manera obtiene ingresos para salir adelante con su familia. La foto fue tomada en su casa.
Invertirá en papel fotográfico, memorias y otros materiales importantes para realizar un trabajo de calidad, su objetivo es tener un buen inventario para seguir prestando sus servicios y teniendo recursos económicos.
Su visión es crecer son su negocio y tener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Roxana lives in her own house with her two daughters, 12 and 9 years old.  She is married and works at a photographic studio from Monday to Saturday.  This is a family business, and is the way she earns income to be able to help her family get ahead.  The photo was taken in her house.   She will invest money in photographic paper, memory books and other materials that are important for carrying out quality work.  Her object is to have a good inventory to continue providing her services and having financial resources.

Her vision is to grow with her business and have better profits.

loans.use: to buy photograph paper, memory books and other important materials to carry out quality work

loans.name: Alyseta

texts.fr:
Mme ALYSETA est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 16ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 02 vont  à l'école. 
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 08ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. 
Elle veut s'acheter 25complets pagnes.
Mme veut agrandir son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Alyseta is married and the mother of four children. Her eldest is 16 and her youngest three, and two of her children are in school.

Alyseta has been selling traditional cloth "pagnes" for eight years. She buys her supplies at the local market.

Alyseta would like to buy 25 "pagne" outfits. She would like to use her profits to expand her business and ensure her children can attend school.

loans.use: to buy 25 traditional cloth "pagne" outfits.

loans.name: La Promesse Group

texts.fr: La cliente Magdal est commerçante, présidente d’un groupe d’affaires «La Promesse», âgée de 50 ans, mariée, mère de 12 enfants dont 6 étudient, 4 n’étudient  pas et 2 sont mariés. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu  de son mari. Son conjoint est chômeur. Il y a 15 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 paniers de tomates, 100 litres des huiles de palme, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Magdal is a trader and head of the La Promesse ("promise") business group. She is 50 years old and married with 12 children. Six of her children go to school, four are not in school, and two are married.

Magdal sells food supplies at the market in town. She started her business with funds received from her husband, who is unemployed. She has been working as a trader for 15 years now.

This loan will help her buy two baskets of tomatoes, 100 litres of palm oil, and other goods. In this way, she hopes to send her children to school and buy them clothes and food.

Magdal would like to thank Hekima for its work to increase the independence of women entrepreneurs who are unable to access banking services.

loans.use: to buy two baskets of tomatoes, 100 litres of palm oil, and other items.

loans.name: Bonheur Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bernadette est commerçante, présidente d’une plateforme  d’affaires «Bonheur», entrepreneur, âgée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants, dont 5 étudient et 1 est déjà marié. La cliente est vendeuse de poissons salés et cliente de l’IMF Hekima. Elle installe sa marchandise dans un  marché de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le capital reçu de son mari qui est un agent de l’Etat. Il y a 14 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 150 poissons. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et  nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Bernadette is a trader and head of the Bonheur ("happiness") business group. She is 52 years old, married and the mother of six children. Five of her children are in school and one is already married.

Bernadette sells salted fish at the town market and is a customer of the Hekima microfinance institution. She began her business 14 years ago with capital from her husband, who is a government official.

This loan will help her buy 150 fish. Through this business, she would like to send her children to school, and buy them clothes and food.

She would like to thank Hekima for helping ensure the independence of women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 150 fish.

loans.name: Grace A Group

texts.fr: Chifundera est commerçante, membre du groupe d’affaires «Grace A», âgée de 32 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de souliers usagés au marché du centre ville depuis 34 ans et après elle sollicita un prêt à l’IMF Hekima. Elle va acheter 50 ballons de souliers pour accroitre son activité. Elle  commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari qui est sans emploi. Dans l’avenir, elle compte renforcer son capital et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Chifundera is a trader and a member of the Grace A business group. She is 32 years old, married and the mother of four children, who are all in school.

Chifundera has been selling used shoes at the town centre market for some years now, and is requesting a loan from the Hekima microfinance institution.

She will buy 50 bundles of shoes to expand her business. She began her business with money from her husband, who is unemployed.

In the future, she hopes to boost her capital and ensure her children can attend school. She would like to thank Hekima for supporting small-scale entrepreneurs who cannot access traditional banking services.

loans.use: to buy 50 bundles of shoes.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
Emiliana es una mujer de 55 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijas de 20 y 25 años, y su negocio es la panadería.
Ella es independiente, constante, responsable, decidida y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la provincia ‘Cercado’ donde se ubica gran parte de la actividad económica del comercio en general y la industria manufacturera. Se encuentra en la zona de los valles, a una altura aproximada de 2500 metros sobre el nivel del mar y tiene una temperatura templada todo el año.
Emiliana es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello corto y un poco gris, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español (de pie a la izquierda, suéter beige). Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica al transporte como taxi, vive con sus hijas que ya son independientes y sus nietos, su casa es propia, construida de ladrillo y cuenta con agua potable y luz eléctrica. Debido a la necesidad de ampliar su negocio formó una banca de personas (antiguas clientes de la empresa) con negocios como; confección de polleras, servicio de transporte, tienda de videos, venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores y servicio de té, para solicitar un préstamo y ayudarse en sus negocios. Su negocio es la panadería tradicional, variedades como; ‘Urpos" (Son guirnaldas de masa de pan de diferentes tamaños), el tradicional pan araneño (horno de barro, en moldes planos y redondos. Se lo prepara con harina integral de trigo), las empanadas de queso (pan relleno de queso), el biscocho (pan dulce), etc. son elaboradas a diario en su antiguo horno industrial en una habitación en el patio de su casa. Su sueño es tener una panadería grande, tener empleados y poder descansar. Ella desea realizar la compra de harina (blanca y de trigo) por mayor, debido a las ventas de fin de año donde escasean los alimentos, perdiendo ventas y clientes. Esta es la quinta secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Emiliana solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina por mayor para no perder ventas ni clientes debido a las ventas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a 55 year old woman, she is married and has 2 children, of 20 and 25 years old and her business is a bakery. She is independent, reliable, responsible, decided and hard-working.  She does her work in the province of Cercado, where a large part of the general commerce and manufacturing economic activity is located, and is located in the zone of the valleys, at an altitude of about 2500 meters above sea level and has a warm climate year-round.  

Emiliana is of dark complexion, of average height, has short, slightly grey hair.  Her mother tongue is Quechua and also speaks Spanish (she is standing on the left, with the beige sweater). She lives with her husband, who works as a taxi driver, and also her two daughters, who are already independent, and also her grandchildren.  She owns her home, which is built of brick and includes drinking water and electricity.

Due to the necessity of growing her business, she formed a communal bank (old clients of her business) with businesses such as; skirt making, transportation services, video shop, dishes sales, cellphone sales, chicken sales, flower sales and tea services, to ask for a loan and help themselves with their businesses.

Her business is a traditional bakery with a variety of products such as: Urpos (strips of dough of different sizes), the traditional Araneño bread (cooked in a clay oven, in flat and round molds, it is prepared with whole wheat flour), cheese empanadas (bread filled with cheese), bizcocho (a sweet bread), etc. are prepared daily in a old industrial oven which is located in a bedroom in the patio of her home. 

Her dream is to have a large bakery, have employees and be able to rest.  She wants to purchase flour (white and whole wheat) in bulk, as end of the year sales generally creates a food shortage, which means she loses sales and clients.  This is the 5th loan sequence with this institution in 10 years which does this activity.  It is for this reason that Emiliana is requesting a loan, to buy flour in bulk to not lose sales or clients due to end of year sales.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk to not lose sales or clients due to end of year sales

loans.name: Grecia Antonella

texts.es:
Grecia Antonella tiene 20 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Grecia Antonella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, cuyes con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Grecia Antonella piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Grecia Antonella is 20 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has a son. She lives with her family in a rural district of Oyotún, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Her community is basically dedicated to agriculture, livestock and commerce.  

Grecia Antonella works raising and selling animals such as ducks, roosters, chickens, and guinea pigs. She has more than 20 years' experience in the business. It is located in her house. She is asking for the loan to buy more animals. Said investment will be used to have more variety and productivity in her animals, with great influence in the business. Grecia Antonella is planning on increasing her animal stock to serve the different needs and tastes of the customers in the area. This will allow her in the short term to improve her income and increase her profits, thereby improving her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals so that she can have more variety and productivity with her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to undertake the process for getting her professional degree.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is 57 years old and lives in Tambulig, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with 3 adult aged children. He has a rice field and has had this business for 14 years. He requested a loan to purchase farming materials and fertilizer to sustain the maintenance of his rice and ensure a greater harvest after 3 months to deliver to the market. He has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Ricardo wants to see his children and their families have a decent standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase farming materials and fertilizer

loans.name: Sovannarith

texts.en: A young man living in Battambang province, Sovannarith is 21 years old and single. For a living, he works in a company as his main source of income. Moreover, he grows rice and corn to earn extra income. This is his first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Sovannarith will spend his entire loan portion to pay his school fees for university. He hopes that he can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay his school fees at university.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 51-year-old mother who owns and manages a small retail store within the rural community. She and her husband work hand and hand to earn sufficient income to sustain their necessities and finance the education of their children. 

She aspires to increase her inventory of grocery items to sell, but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP10,000 to buy the said additional inventory of grocery items, canned goods, soft drinks and vegetables to sell. 

Having this financial assistance, she hopes that someday, she will make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of grocery items, canned goods, soft drinks and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ramona is 46 years old, and has two children who are currently in school.

Ramona has a business selling fabric conditioners in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of fabric conditioners to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ramona has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of fabric conditioners to sell to her customers

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is a merchant living in Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has seven children. Her youngest child is 6 years old. 

She is into a food vending business. She makes and sells fried peanuts to the community by peddling a used bicycle. During her free time, Edita also sells fresh fish to augment her income. Aside from that, she also engages in  rice farming. She grows and sells rice. 

Edita has requested a loan of 22,000 PHP to buy an additional stock of fresh fish, ingredients for the food vending like peanuts, salt, and spices, and to purchase fertilizer and medicine. These tools would definitely help improve the quantity of stock and create a higher yield.
 
Edita  would like to expand her businesses to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of fresh fish, ingredients for the food vending like peanuts, salt, and spices, and to purchase fertilizer and medicine

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This woman's name is Elizabeth. She is 48  and she is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jobico and has six children; one is in High School, two are in the Elementary Level and three are already working. She manages her own household while operating a business. She works hard to provide income for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her children. 

Elizabeth is in the direct selling business. She sells natural organic juice named Jinga juice which is a fusion of two super foods, guyabano (soursop) and wheat grass juice. Filipinos are now more knowledgeable and health conscious. They are learning to take natural juice instead of soda to support their well-being for the love of their family. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help sustain her business, she is requesting an PHP 8,000 loan which she will use to buy natural Jinga juice to meet orders from customers which are her neighbors, relatives, friends and the local community. Aside from her direct selling she also makes bed sheets to fill the orders of friends and neighbors. Part of the loan will be used to buy fabric needed in her sewing of bed sheets. She thanks God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her. It will surely help meet her family's everyday needs and for the education of her children.

Elizabeth aims to grow her business so she can send her children to the best school. She prays they stay strong and healthy and that they always lead a quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for Jinga juice to sell to customers and fabric for making bedsheets.

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en:
Peluce is 50 years old, and married with nine children.  She is living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Peluce operates a retail shop of general merchandise; she has been in that business for 10 years. Peluce dreams of growing her business to wholesale, however, limited capital is her biggest challenge. 

Peluce wants money to buy salt, sugar, cassava flour, soap and other merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, cassava flour, soap and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.en: Cipriano is 66 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with 6 adult aged children. He has a sari-sari store that is managed by his wife while he farms. He requested a loan to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer and pesticides to make his rice healthy and resistant to insects. He has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Cipriano hopes that every season he had a good harvest to sell.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Her name is Myrna, 40; she is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Married to Melvin, a driver, they have five children. One is in high school, two are in the elementary level, one is not of school age yet, and the other one is already working. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs, and to send her children to school. 

Myrna has a small store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. She sells fruits and other household needs. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also sells beauty and bath products and makes doormats upon order.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 800 a day. 

To help her improve her store business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items, such as  sacks of rice, charcoal, condiments,soda and other grocery stuff. Part of the loan she will use to buy personal direct selling products to meet Christmas orders. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings is their source to meet their daily expense and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Myna hopes to maintain and grow her business so they could have a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible, and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items to sell and other direct selling products.

loans.name: Percilliano

texts.en: Percilliano is 51 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with 2 school aged and 2 adult aged children. He has a number of hectares of rice fields and has had this business for 30 years. He requested a loan to pay for labor to harvest the rice and for seedbed preparation for the next crop season. He will use the profit to pay for the school expenses of his children. He has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Percilliano wants to see his children receive their diploma's and have stable jobs.

loans.use: to pay for labor and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
FANNI vive en San Lorenzo con sus 5 hijos – ella es madre soltera y se dedica a la captura de concha en el manglar en su casa tiene un pequeño local en el que vende embutidos, pollo y carnes.
Con el crédito anterior pudo mejorar su casa e iniciar su negocio con la venta de productos ya descritos.
Este nuevo crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su negocio, y ahorrar para el pago de las cuotas de crédito.
Lleva trabajando con el apoyo de FODEMI  3 años y ve a esta institución como “una fuente para que trabaje la gente pobre” porque ella ha logrado construir su casa con la ayuda de su trabajo.
Desea tener 2 congeladores para incrementar su mercadería y poder satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fanni lives in San Lorenzo with her five children. She is a single mother who gathers shells in the mangrove. In her house, Fanny has a small shop where she sells sausages, chicken, and meats. With her previous loan, she was able to start her business of selling the products that were previously mentioned.

Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise for her business. She will also be able to save for her loan payments. Fanni has been working with the support of FODEMI for three years. She views the organization as “a resource for poor working people” because she has been able to build a house as a result of her work.

Fanni would like to have two freezers so that she can increase her merchandise and satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as sausages, chicken, and meats so that she can save for her loan payments.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis de 30 años de edad viven casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace 2 años a realizar viajes en su taxi, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Luis está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is 30 years old and lives in his own home along with his life companion and their three children. He has been providing taxi services for two years. Luis has many customers who prefer to do business with him because he is responsible with his driving. With the income he earns from his work, he is able to cover some of the household expenses.

Luis is requesting a loan in order to buy tires and pay for the maintenance of his vehicle. This is his only source of work, so he will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 55 years old and is married with four adult children. He lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past 10 years, Edgar has raised piglets and he now has five piglets that he will sell in the market after three months. This business is the sole source of his income and he's proud that his children finished their studies with the help of his business. Edgar has been a member of PMPC for four years

Edgar is requesting a loan to renovate his pig cages to make his pigs more comfortable and able to grow faster. In the future, he wants to raise more pigs to save money for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his pig cages

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 37 years old and married. He and his spouse have been blessed with four children and they also support six other family members. For the past seven years, Jackson has sold tree seedlings.

Jackson is requesting a loan to buy more tree seedlings, fertilizer, and polythene bags for planting the seedlings. This will be his second loan from VisonFund Kenya and he successfully repaid his previous loan. Jackson will use the anticipated profit from his loan to educate his children. In the future, he hopes to become a large-scale tree farmer.

loans.use: to buy tree seedlings,fertilizer and polythene bags

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now and she works hard to support her family. 

Norma is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang is 40 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are in school and one who is in university. She lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham province and earns an income growing cassava. This will be Neang’s third loan cycle with the Kiva partner VisonFund and she has successfully repaid her previous loans.

Neang is requesting a loan to pay the tuition fees for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor’s degree in management. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is married and there are eight members in her family, including her husband, who is a carpenter. Since 1005, Cristina has been involved in a furniture shop and she also cultivates animals such as pigs, chickens, buffalo, and cows. Cristina started her business with her own working capital. 

Cristina is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional materials such as beams, boards, varnish, wood glue, key cabinets, sandpaper, nuts, and other products. She is happy because, with her loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business so big in the future and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy beams, boards, varnish, wood glue, key cabinets, sandpaper, nuts, and other products

loans.name: Leydi Marilin

texts.es:
Leydi es una mujer soltera de 25 anos que es muy trabajadora. Hasta ahora no tiene hijos, asi que se enfoque mucho en su negocio, lo cual consiste en la venta de productos de belleza. Ella es profesora y como otro fuente de ingresos, tambien se vende los productos de belleza a sus colegas y amigas en la comunidad. Ella solicita es crédito para poder comprar manualidades como tejido y costura. 
Ella está muy feliz ser cliente de Arariwa y se ha comprometido pagar sus cuotas a tiempo.
texts.en: Leydi is a 25 year old single woman who is very hard-working. She has not had children up to now so she is focused on very business which consists of selling beauty products. She is a school teacher who also sells beauty products to her colleagues and friends in the community. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy crafts like weavings and sewing. She is very content to be a client of Arariwa and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy crafts like weavings and sewing.

loans.name: Teodoro Jose

texts.es: Teodoro es un microempresario emprendedor, tiene la edad de 55 años, acompañado, comercializa productos varios en su Pulpería y tiene el deseo de aumentar sus ventas y tener un alto porcentaje de crecimiento de demanda, esto lo ha motivado para solicitar el crédito e invertir en la compra de queso, crema, pierna de pollo, pechuga especial, pechuga con ala,  granos básicos, jabón de lavar ropa, aceite  etc., de modo que podrá satisfacer a la población con los productos que más demandan y de esta manera mejorara sus ingreso en su hogar.
texts.en: Teodoro is an enterprising entrepreneur. He is 55 years old and in a relationship. He sells a variety of products in his small store. He wants to increase his sales and have a high level of increase in demand. This has motivated him to request a loan to invest in the purchase of cheese, cream, chicken legs, breast, breast with wings, basic grains, soap, oil, etc. In this manner he can satisfy the public with the products they want the most and thus increase the revenues for his household.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, chicken legs, breast, breast with wings, basic grains, soap and oil to satisfy demand.

loans.name: Topi Group

texts.en:
NEEMA, who is in her early 20s, is single.  She has been selling batiks for one year now.  She works from 8 am to 8:30 pm daily and is able to make  a good monthly profit.  

This will be NEEMA's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to make more batiks and has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay rent and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy materials, dye solution and water for making batik clothes to sell. She dreams of increasing her batik business.

NEEMA will share this loan with her loan group "TOPI" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials, dye solution and water for making batik clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bevencia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Bevencia works hard to support her family. She works selling charcoal in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Bevencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She has successfully repaid her previous loans.

Bevencia is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lucyphine

texts.en:
Lucyphine is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. Lucyphine earns a living through her retail sales of dry goods,  generic medicines, and food supplements. 

Lucyphine is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like clothes, slippers, sandals, fashion accessories, and others. Through this, she will be able to augment her stocks which will allow her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Lucyphine has hopes of making her business more stable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like clothes, slippers, sandals, fashion accessories, and others

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 55 years old and is married with five children. She lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past 35 years, Florencia has run a shop where she sells vegetables from her garden. She also manages a rice field with her husband. Florencia has been a member of PMPC for two years.

Florencia is requesting a loan to buy bags of fertilizer and farm inputs to sustain the needs of her family. In the future, she wants to build a boarding house in the city to earn additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Kelly Vanessa

texts.es:
Kelly Vanessa tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa propia, junto a su menor hijo. Es natural de la zona. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, como sustento principal, siembra y cosecha de banano, maíz, fréjol caupí. Etc.
