Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Kelly Vanessa es la crianza de animales (patos, conejos, entre otros) y venta del mismo, además de la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 3 años, con experiencia en el negocio, con muy buenas referencias en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la mejora de vivienda y capital de trabajo para la compra y venta de animales (patos, conejos, entre otros). Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Kelly Vanessa is 28 years old, single, and lives in her own home along with her young child. She is native to the area. Life in her district is peaceful. The residents engage in agriculture and livestock breeding as their main sources of income. They also plant and harvest bananas, corn, black-eyed peas, and other crops. This community is located in the District of Buenos Aires in Morropón Province, which is in the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Kelly Vanessa raises and sells animals such as ducks, rabbits, and other livestock. She also sells beauty products. Kelly has been in business for more than three years and has experience in this type of work. She also has very good references in her area. This loan will be used for the improvement of her home and as operating capital for buying and selling animals (ducks, rabbits, and other livestock). She will be able to increase her earnings, improve her income in the short term, and eventually improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to provide operating capital to her business of buying and selling animals and to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 49 years old and is married with two school-aged children. She lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past 12 years, Emerita has operated a shop where she sells banana cues (deep fried bananas coated in sugar) and she also helps her husband with their farm. She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

Emerita is requesting a loan to pay for labor to help with seedbed preparation for the next planting season to make their harvest double. In the future, she hopes to engage in another business to help others.

loans.use: to pay for labor and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is male and married with five children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda, and has been operating a clothing and textile shop for the past 26 years. Martin used his previous loan to renovate his house and buy baby clothes to sell. 

Martin is requesting a loan to buy baby clothing to sell during the Christmas season. Despite the challenge of limited capital he dreams of growing his business into a wholesale operation.

loans.use: to buy baby clothing to sell during the Christmas season

loans.name: Solidario Trabajando Con Cristo Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO TRABAJANDO CON CRISTO
Doña Margarita, es originaria de la aldea Pacorral  tiene 42 años de edad  bajo su responsabilidad están sus 8 hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la agricultura.
El esposo de ella trabaja como agricultor, sembrando maíz, frijol, arveja china y otros hortalizas y gracias al apoyo de el y el apoyo de su familia ella sigue adelante con su negocio.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en comprar materia prima  para sus tejidos y también compro semillas, fertilizantes y fungicidas para su trabajo en la agricultura.
Ella sueña con ampliar más su negocio, ofrecer mas variedad de tejidos a sus clientes así obtendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor, ya que hoy en dia la educación es muy importante en los jovenes,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos.
texts.en:
The "SOLIDARIO TRABAJANDO CON CRISTO" communal bank. Margarita is a native of the village of Pacorral. She is 42 years old and has 8 minor children under her care. She works making made-made traditional weavings and in agriculture. Her husband works as a farmer planting corn, beans, snow peas and other vegetables. Thanks to his support and the support of her family she can continue progressing with her business.

The loan that she is receiving will be invested in the purchase of raw material for her weaving as well as buying seeds, fertilizer and fungicide for her work in agriculture. She dreams of expanding her business, offering a greater variety of weaving to her clients and make more profit. Then she would be able to send her children to school for a better future, School today is very important for the young. She is requesting this loan to buy raw material to make weavings.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving.

loans.name: Epigenia

texts.en: Epigenia is 64 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married, and has 5 adult children. Epigenia has an eggplant garden in addition to her rice field, and sells directly to her neighbors. She has had this business for 5 years. Epigenia has requested a loan to pay for labor and seedbed preparation for the next growing season, to supply the needs of her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Epigenia hopes that her business will do well for her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Grace B Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mihako est commerçante, membre d’une plateforme d’affaires «Grace B», entrepreneur, âgée de 50 ans,  mariée et mère de 8 enfants, dont 5 étudient et 3 sont déjà mariés. La cliente est vendeuse poissons frais  et cliente de l’IMF Hekima. Elle installe sa marchandise dans un marché de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le capital reçu de son mari qui est un agent de l’Etat. Il y a 34 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 1000 poissons. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison et renforcer son capital. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: The customer, Mihako, is a trader and a member of the "Grace B" business platform. She is a 50-year old entrepreneur who is married and mother to eight children, five of whom are studying and three of whom are already married. The customer sells fish and is a customer of IMF Hekima. She lays out her goods in one of the town's markets. She began her business with capital from her husband who is a civil servant, and has been running it for 34 years. This new loan will be used to buy 1,000 fish, and she would thereby like to be able to build a house and boost her capital. Finally she is extremely grateful to Hekima for giving autonomy to female entrepreneurs who cannot access the classic bank system.

loans.use: to buy 1,000 fish.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 70 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children now with different professions. 

Lilia earns income from her beauty parlor and dress shop business. She’s been engaged in this business for five years already. She earns approximately 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of business activity, in which that amount is so helpful in meeting her needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of hair cream, hair relaxing solution, hair rebonding liquids, hair coloring and hair waving solution. 

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Lilia hopes to expand her beauty parlor and dress shop business to other nearby cities in this province.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of hair cream, hair relaxing solution, hair rebonding liquids, hair coloring and hair waving solution

loans.name: Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
BERENICE vive en una pequeña comunidad de la Provincia de Esmeraldas donde desde muy niña ha tenido el sueño de ser líder de su comunidad.
BERENICE se enteró de los créditos de FODEMI  y formó un grupo de 10 personas quienes tienen ideas de negocios en beneficio de su pueblo.
realizaron el acercamiento con FODEMI para la gestión del crédito y poder trabajar en su propia idea de negocio.
BERENICE tiene 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela de la comunidad y a los que espera apoyar en toda su carrera de formación académica.
ella tiene un pequeño negocio de ventas de productos naturales y reconstituyentes a base de la medicina natural.
desea ampliar este servicio debido a que tiene buena salida en el mercado local.
ella en su tiempo libre, se dedica a la extracción de oro en el rió de la comunidad para poder apoyarse económicamente en los gastos del hogar. 
su esposo no tiene un trabajo estable y se dedica a la agricultura en su pequeño terreno. en este cultiva plátano para el consumo familiar.

BERENICE tiene deseos de crecer en su negocio, por que ve la necesidad de apoyar a sus hijos que están creciendo y ella desea que continúen en la universidad en San Lorenzo o Ibarra.

con este crédito ella comprara mas mercadería natural y ahorrará para el pago de crédito y los gastos de estudios.

es su primer credito y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad de sentirse gerenta en su propio local.
texts.en:
Berenice lives in a small community in Esmeralda Province. From the time she was a young girl, she had always dreamed of becoming a leader in her community. Berenice learned about the loans offered by FODEMI and formed a group of 10 people who have ideas for businesses that would benefit their town. They approached FODEMI in order to apply for a loan so that they could begin working on their business ideas.

Berenice has two children who attend school in the community, so she hopes to help them throughout their entire academic development. She has a small retail business where she sells natural products and natural medicines with restorative properties. Berenice wants to expand this service since it is doing well in the local market.

In her free time, Berenice pans for gold in the community river so that she can provide additional financial support toward the household expenses. Her husband does not have a stable job, but he cultivates a small plot of land. He produces bananas for family consumption. Berenice wants to grow her business because she needs to support her children as they are growing. She wants them to continue so that they can attend a university in San Lorenzo or Ibarra.

With this loan, she will buy more natural products and save for her loan payments and educational expenses. This is her first loan and she is very grateful for this opportunity to become the manager of her own business.

loans.use: to buy natural products to sell to people so that they can improve their health.

loans.name: Maa Jharbahalen Group

texts.en:
Maa Jharbahalen is a Joint Liability Group formed by 10 active women entrepreneurs of Kendupati village of Nuapada district in Odisha, India, to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their businesses. This village is situated in a rural forest area, and cultivation is the main source of income of the people of this village. 

Lata, aged about 36, is a member of this group who is standing third from left with raised hand in the photo. She hails from a Below Poverty Line family and is living with her husband and four children. 

Lata is basically a farmer. She grows paddy, vegetables, green gram and red gram in her field. She and her husband do all things relating to farming. After harvesting, she sells her products to the wholesaler, and from the earnings, manages her family. But as she possesses a big family of six members and income is hand to mouth, she wants to expand her cultivation and wishes to use the field year-round. 

Therefore, she has planned to utilize her present loan of 12,000 INR for purchasing seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides and a small motor pump for the lifting of water from her dug well. She hopes this will help her to utilize her field all around the year and fetch her a good return for the better livelihood of her family. Lata has a dream to construct a house for her family as her children are growing up.

The other nine members of the group are also doing small businesses like vegetable cultivation, ground nut cultivation, milk selling, goat rearing, sheep rearing, etc.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides and a small motor pump for the lifting of water from her dug well.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 51 years old and widowed. She lives in a rural community with her five children. To have an additional source of income, she has engaged in reselling used clothing within their community for almost three years. She aspires to continue and improve this business in order to sustain their necessities and finance the education of her children. Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to obtain an additional of PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of used clothing to resell. Having this financial assistance, she believes that someday she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Marquita

texts.en:
Marquita is 55 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with two school-age and two adult-age children. She has a vulcanizing shop and has had this business for three years. 

Marquita loves her farming activity; she wants to help her husband in doing farming. She requested a loan to pay for labor and seedbed preparation for the next cropping season to sustain the financial needs of her children, especially in their studies. She has been a member of PMPC for five years. 

In the future, Marquita hopes that her children have stable jobs and help others.

loans.use: to pay for labor and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is 34 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 2 school-age children. Her husband is a farmer who manages their rice field. She wants to have her own business. That's why she requested a loan to buy 3 piglets to sell after 3 months for additional income to support the financial needs of her children and also her parents. She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Jenny wants to explore another business for her to earn more.

loans.use: to buy 3 piglets to sell.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 47 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is separated from her husband. She has 2 children now at their adult age.
  
Elenita has been engaged in a hog fattening business for 2 years already. She earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 3 sacks of grower feeds for her existing hog fattening business. 

Elenita has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Elenita hopes to expand her hog fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of grower feeds.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is 56 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 8 children now at their adult age. 

Ella is presently working as a house caretaker. She’s been doing this service for 10 years already. She also receives a monthly pension as the surviving spouse from her late husband. Ella earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. This amount is so helpful to support her needs. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase medicines for her maintenance and to renew her insurances. 

Ella has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Ella hopes to engage in business possibly retailing.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for her maintenance.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is 49 years old and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with 2 adult-age children. His wife manages their sari-sari store and he wants to build a pig pen to raise pigs. He requested a loan to pay for labor in building his pig cage and buy 6 piglets and 1 head pig for a new business. He has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Jose wants to have a business site area in the market to sell the meat of his pigs.

loans.use: to pay for labor, 6 piglets and 1 head pig.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She has children, and she is working in a garment factory. She was employed through the assistance of Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Arlene is a Roving Quality Control Officer. She inspects garments, such as men's denim bottoms, during manufacturing operations to determine the number of defects per worker and reasons for rejects by examiners. She counts the number of pattern parts, layers of cloth prior to cutting, number of stitches per inch during sewing operations and collects other measurement knowledge.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Arlene, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses, and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Arlene is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative, and she had no problem in returning it back since the loan payment is being deducted every payday. She looks forward to your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan for her children’s education.

Arlene dreams of becoming a supervisor. She dreams for her children to be able to complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees of her children.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James sells household goods in Kisumu town and has been running this business for 5 years now. He is 40 years old and married. Together with his spouse, they have been blessed with 4 children. 

He will use this loan to buy more stock of mattresses, basins and water drums to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and repay the loan as well. 

This is his third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and and he paid his previous loans successfully. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mattresses, basins and water drums to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a buy and sell charcoal business. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 34 years old with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc.

Jonalyn has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Jonalyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Secret De La Renaissance Group

texts.fr: Resto est commerçant, homme d’affaires, trésorier  du groupe solidaire «Secret de la Renaissance», client de l’IMF Hekima, célibataire, âgé de 27 ans. Il commença son business avec de fonds reçu après récolte dans le champ dans son village. Il est vendeur des  divers produits manufacturés à son domicile depuis 6 ans. Il va acheter des biscuits, piles, babouches, savon Omo, huiles, sucre, etc. Il souhaite accroitre et devenir grossiste. Au finish, il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Resto is a businessman and treasurer of the "Secret de la Renaissance" group. He is a customer of IMF Hekima, single and 27 years old. He began his business with funds acquired from the harvesting of the field in his village, and he has been selling various manufactured products from his home for the past six years. He is going to buy biscuits, batteries, slippers, Omo soap powder, oil, sugar, etc. He would like to grow his business and become a wholesaler. Finally he is grateful to Hekima for the support it provides to entrepreneurs who cannot get funding from banks.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, batteries, slippers, Omo soap powder, oils, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Denize

texts.en:
Denize is a 30-year-old female who is married with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Denize operates a beauty salon for ladies, and she has managed to build a family house using the proceeds. She has a dream of enlarging her business into a bridal salon, though market competition is her biggest problem.

Denize is requesting a loan to buy weaves and braids for selling during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy weaves and braids for selling during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Chanthoeun

texts.en: Chanthoeun, 41, is a mother of five children living in Kampong Cham province. She struggles for a living via rubbers planting and cassava growing to earn more income to improve her family condition. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to pay a tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue the bachelor degree majoring in Medical. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay a tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue the bachelor degree majoring in Medical.

loans.name: Moisés

texts.es:
Moisés de 48 años de edad, cuenta con cuatro hijos el primero ya es casado y tiene familia independiente y los tres últimos son excelentes estudiante de la escuela de su comunidad, el es un hombre emprendedor que no le importa qué actividad realizar sino lo único que a el le importa es tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia. 

Su actividad productiva la cual le genera ganancia en su sistema económica es la compra y venta de ropa típica en su comunidad ya que es la única forma que el a podido encontrar para poder tener ingresos económicos para su familia, su segunda actividad es servir de jornalero en su comunidad y por medio de esa actividad el puede tener otro ingreso extra para poder mantener a su familia y darles una condición de vida apropiada  para sus hijos y que sean buenos profesionales en el campo laboral de la vida.

El es muy emprendedor en la vida y es por ello que el se decidió a la realización de un préstamo para la compra de mercadería de ropa típica, para tener a la disposición de la clientela más mercadería para su respectiva venta.

La aspiración más importante de el es la construcción de una mejor vivienda y darles un buen estudio a sus hijos par que ellos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Moisés is 48 years old and has 4 children. The first one is married and has his own family and the other three are excellent students in the community school. He is an enterprising man who doesn't care what business he does as long as he has economic revenues to support his family.

The work he does to generate economic income is buying and selling traditional clothing in his community. This is the only way he has discovered to be able to have economic income for his family. His second activity is to work as day labor in his community. Through this activity have a second income to support his family and provide them with appropriate living conditions so that they become good professionals in their work lives.

He is very enterprising in his life and for this reason he has decided to request a loan to buy traditional clothing so that he has more merchandise on hand to sell to his clients. His greatest hopes are to construct a better house and provide his children with quality education so that they become professionals.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: Familia B Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del Estado de México se encuentra ubicada el grupo Familia B, en este lugar las personas son muy trabajadoras, las actividades principales son el comercio, cultivo de nopal y cría de borregos. 

El grupo está conformado por León y Victoria quienes son pareja y padres de cuatro hijos que actualmente ya son independientes. Isabela quien es parte del grupo es hija de dicho matrimonio ella solicita un préstamo para iniciar con un cyber café.

Desde muy pequeño, Don León trabajaba con su papá vendiendo adornos para el cabello y productos de fantasía, pero desde hace 20 años se dedica a comprar y vender trastes, al principio lo hacía con un socio hasta tener la experiencia necesaria y aventurarse a iniciar su propio negocio. Para tener los mejores precios, él viaja a otro país para comprar trastes como cucharas, platos, vasos y vajillas. Debido a que la temporada navideña se acerca y es una buena etapa de ventas, necesita un crédito para surtirse de mercancía. 

Por su parte Doña Victoria siempre quiso tener un negocio así que inicio con la venta de dulces, frituras y antojitos mexicanos que es en donde invertirá su préstamo.

La familia está muy contenta con su préstamo porque les ayudará a sobrepasar la dificultad principal: la falta de inversión para adquirir los productos necesarios y hacer crecer su negocio.

*La foto fue tomada en el negocio de Doña Victoria donde también se pueden observar algunos productos de Don León.
texts.en:
The group named “Familia B” is from a community in the State of México. The people from this area are extremely hardworking. They engage in business activities such as trade, cultivating prickly pears, and raising sheep.

This group includes León and Victoria. They are a couple and the parents of four children who are already independent. Isabela, who is also part of the group, is the daughter of the couple. She is requesting a loan so that she can start a cybercafé.

At a very young age, Don León worked with his father by selling hair accessories and costume jewelry. They also bought and sold dishes for 20 years. At first, he needed a partner in order to gain the necessary experience but then he ventured alone so that he could start his own business. In order to obtain the best prices, León would travel to another country to buy dishware such as spoons, plates, glasses, and place settings. Since the Christmas season is approaching, which happens to be a good time for making sales, he needs a loan in order to stock up on merchandise.

Doña Victoria has always wanted to have her own business, so she began selling sweets, fried foods, and Mexican snacks. She will invest her loan in this business. The family is very pleased with the loan because it will help them overcome their main difficulty, which is the lack of investment capital. As a result, they can obtain the necessary products in order to grow their businesses.

*The photo was taken at Doña Victoria’s business, but some of Don León’s products can also be seen.

loans.use: to buy spoons, plates, glasses, and place settings to sell for the holiday season.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Djiguiya vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Noumou Were de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de calebasse, de grains et de condiment .Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  3eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Wawa  (la 2ere femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de calebasses et des louches  dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de calebasses et des louches à Noumou Were. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Wawa  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 11000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women of the Djiguiya group all live in traditional families. They average 39 years of age with four children each and they all live in the village of Noumou Were in Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other as neighbors and relatives, and through marriage and their income-generating activities in the village. They have small businesses selling gourds, grains and condiments. They decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to expand their businesses, and they are on their third group loan. 

Wawa (who is standing second from the left in the photo) is a significant vendor of gourds and ladles in the village and its surroundings. She is planning to use her loan to buy a significant quantity of gourds and ladles in Noumou Were. She sells her goods for cash, and often on credit, from her home and in the market to a mixed customer base. With this loan Wawa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 11,000FCFA, which will be used for her children's small needs and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy gourds and ladles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to fertilize his corn plants.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra is 42 years old and a mother of three children who are living in Takeo province. Nowadays, she needs to support two schoolchildren. To support her family's condition, she weaves Khmer skirts (Cambodians call them "hul") and grows rice on a 1-hectare area to earn extra income. 

This is her fourth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the tuition fee for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in finance and banking. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in finance and banking.

loans.name: Dima

texts.en:
Dima, age 34 and unmarried, works in an international TV station, where she is responsible for makeup. She has been employed in this work for the past three years. Dima is a hard worker and has a good reputation in her field, but she is bound by her limited salary, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to make necessary dental treatments.

Dima hopes to open her own beauty salon to increase her income and save some profit for her future.

loans.use: to make necessary dental treatments

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Djantoyerela vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Zambougou de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de beurre de karité, d’habillement et de fruits et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Maimouna (la 1ere femme assise de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de beurre de karité dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  une grande quantité de beurre de karité à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Maimouna espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 11 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The five women of the Djantoyerela group all live in nuclear families. They average 33 years of age with four children each and they all live in the village of Zambougou in Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other as neighbors and relatives, and through marriage and their income-generating activities in the village. They have small businesses selling shea butter, clothing, fruit and vegetables. They decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to expand their businesses, and they are on their first group loan. 

Maimouna (who is sitting on the right of the photo) is a significant vendor of shea butter in the village and its surroundings. She is planning to use her loan to buy a significant quantity of shea butter in Ségou. She sells her shea butter for cash, and often on credit, from her home and in the market to a mixed customer base. With this loan Maimouna hopes to make an average monthly profit of 11,000FCFA, which will be used for her children's small needs and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shea butter.

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Bendiya vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 34ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Zambougou de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment, de restauration, de grains et d’habillement. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  3eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Sirantou  (la 1ere femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande restauratrice dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  10 cartons de spaghetti pour en faire des plats alimentaires à Zambougou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Sirantou    espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 26 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Bendiya group are all women living in traditional families. On the average, they are 34 years old, with three children. They all live in the Zambougou village in Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other as neighbors, relatives by blood or marriage, and through their work in the village. They work as vendors selling condiments, cooked dishes, grains and clothing. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan.

Mrs. Sirantou (the first one standing from right to left in the photo) is a well-known vendor of cooked food in her village and nearby. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 boxes of pasta in order to cook dishes for ale in Zambougou. She sells for cash and often on credit out of her home and at the market, to a mixed clientele.

With this loan, Mrs. Sirantou hopes to achieve an average monthly revenue of 26,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover some minor expenses for her children and also build up her working capital.

loans.use: to buy pasta in order to cook it for sale.

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Dème vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Zambougou de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de beurre de karité et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  5eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Kamissa   (la 1ere femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de beurre de karité dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  une grande quantité de beurre de karité à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Kamissa   espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women of the Dème group all live in nuclear families. They average 34 years of age with two children each and they all live in the village of Zambougou in Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other as neighbors and relatives, and through marriage and their income-generating activities in the village. They have small businesses selling shea butter and grains. They decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to expand their businesses, and they are on their fifth group loan.

Kamissa (who is sitting on the far left in the photo) is a significant vendor of shea butter in the village and its surroundings. She is planning to use her loan to buy a significant quantity of shea butter in Ségou. She sells her goods for cash, and often on credit, from her home and in the market to a mixed customer base. With this loan Wawa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000FCFA, which will be used for her children's small needs and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shea butter.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is 41 years old and married. She lives in a rural community and engages in reselling rice and feeds to help her husband in gaining income. She aspires to further improve her business and increase her income to meet the necessities of her family and save some for their future. She wants to acquire more stocks of the said products to resell, but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, Hilda is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more stocks of rice and feeds to resell. Having patience and strong determination, Hilda believes that she will be able to make her business more viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice and feeds to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Leah works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Leah is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy new fishing net for her fishing business.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing net

loans.name: Irene Eufrosina

texts.en:
Irene Eufrosina is 50 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Irene Eufrosina has a general store business in the Philippines. Irene Eufrosina requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like sugar, rice, canned goods and other groceries.

Irene Eufrosina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Irene Eufrosina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, rice, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming and selling vegetables. 

Mary Jane is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to work on it inside her house.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en: Edita is a hard-working, single woman who resides in Dulag, Leyte. She is 54 years old and engages in a buy-and-sell business. In the photo, Edita is standing in front of few sacks of taro (a root crop) that is ready for delivery to her customers. She buys and sells crops, such as taro, sweet potato and corn, as her main source of income. She has been in this kind of business for more than 10 years. Due to her limited amount of capital and in order to earn her daily income, Edita has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase more root crops, such as camote (sweet potato), gabi (taro) and mais (corn). With these vegetables she can provide her customers with a wide variety of crops thus attracting more buyers, leading to a higher yield. Edita would like to expand her buy-and-sell business to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more root crops like camote (sweet potato), gabi (taro) and mais (corn).

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 40 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. Alice works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. Alice has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, noodles, sugar and other groceries. In the future, Alice would like to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Djekadi Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Djekadi vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Zambougou de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de beurre de karité, d’habillement, de condiment et produit. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  3eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djenebou (la 1ere femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de beurre de karité dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  une grande quantité de beurre de karité à Zambougou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Djenebou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 25 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The seven women in the Djekadi group all live in traditional households. They are on average 46 years old and have 5 children. They all live in the village of Zambougou de Ségou (4th largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They met through common links via their neighborhood, families, mariage and commercial activities. They are all involved in the sale of shea butter, clothes, condiments and other products. In order to increase their business assets, the members of the group have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are asking for their third loan.
Mrs Djenebou (seen in the photo standing on the far left) is involved in selling large quantities of shea butter in the village and surrounding environments. She hopes to use her loan to purchase a large quantity of shea butter in Zambougou. She sells the products from her home and at the market, mostly for cash and sometimes for credit, to a mixed customer group. Mrs Djenebou hopes to earn monthly profit of 25 000 FCFA through this loan, which she will use to cover the cost of daily needs for her children, as well as increase her business assets.

loans.use: purchase shea butter

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Djiguitougou vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Zambougou de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment, d’artisanat et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Yayi (debout au milieu dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment de tout genre dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  une grande quantité de condiments à Zambougou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Yayi espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 18 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en: The five women in the Djiguitougou group all live in traditional families. They are, on average, 36 years old and have 4 children. They all live in the Zambougou de Ségou village (4th largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They met through common links of neighborhood, relatives, mariage and their revenue generating activities in the village. They are all involved in the commercial activity related to the sale of condiments, crafts and food. In order to increase their business assets, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, and are asking for their second loan. Mrs Yayi (seen in the photo standing in the middle) is an important seller of condiments of all types in the village and its surrounding environments. She plans to use her loan to purchase a large quantity of condiments from Zambougou. Sales are done in cash and often for credit from her home and her market, to a mixed customer base. Mrs Yayi hopes to earn monthly profits of 18 000 FCFA with this loan, which she will use to take care of the daily needs of her children as well as increase her business assets.

loans.use: purchase condiments

loans.name: Kijweka Youth Farmers Group

texts.en:
Peter is a 33-year-old, married man with two children, who buys beans, maize, and soya beans in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is also in agriculture, growing bananas and millet for many years. Then he started buying and selling produce. His hardship is that the business is seasonal. His vision is to become a market leader of produce and to own a modern food store that caters to increased demand. 

Peter needs the loan to buy beans to sell. He is a member of Kijweka Youth Farmers Group where members guarantee one another to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Dario Michael

texts.es:
Dario es un joven muy alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltero y vive en Huaraz junto a su familia.
Desde que salió del colegio tuvo que buscar un trabajo debido a que su familia contaba con baja economía y no podían apoyarlo con una carrera profesional, es por ello que él no se dio por vencido y actualmente está trabajando como ayudante en la venta de bebidas gaseosas y agua mineral al por mayor en una gran tienda. Su sueño es más adelante poder empezar a estudiar una profesión para crecer profesionalmente.
Debido a los fuertes deseos que tiene Dario de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, piensa utilizar el crédito para poder cubrir algunos gastos personales de su casa como el pago de algunos servicios y compra de algunos enseres. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva por su generosidad, porque así continuará luchando para más adelante abrir su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Dario is a cheerful young man and very eager to get ahead. He is single and lives in Huaraz with his family.
After finishing high school, he had to find a job because his family had scarce resources and wasn’t able to pay for him to get a professional degree. He has not given up, and he is currently working as an assistant in a large store that sells soft drinks and mineral water wholesale. His dream is to earn a professional degree in order to grow professionally.
Because of his strong desire to improve the quality of life for his family, Dario plans to use the loan to cover some personal expenses for his home, such as paying for utilities and buying some necessities. He is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity because he will be able to continue striving to open his own business in the future.

loans.use: to cover some personal expenses for his home,

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 53 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living through her pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed sacks. Susan has been pig-fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed sacks.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 52 years old, married, and has three children.  She sells cereals and firewood, which she has been doing for 12 years. 

Joyce requested her fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy more stock of cereals and firewood to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to be successful and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase cereals and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 52 years old and married with ten children. With two children in school, Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alicia has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ul

texts.en: A father of three children, Ul is 49 years old, living in Kampong Cham province. He earns income to improve his family's condition via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to earn extra income. For Ul, this is his second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and he has fully repaid his past loan wisely, to gradually improve his living conditions. Ul will spend his entire loan to pay school fees for his daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in Rural Development. He hopes that his daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in Rural Development.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Soutoura vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Moussokorobougou de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de grains, de restauration et de grains .Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Baha (la 1ere femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande restauratrice dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de fonio pour en faire des plats alimentaires à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Baha espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 20 000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women of the Soutoura group all live in traditional families. On average they are 36 years old with three children. They all live in Moussokorobougou of Ségou (in the fourth administrative region of Mali Republic).
They met through living in the same neighbourhood, through family and marital associations and through their income generating activities in the village. They deal in grains and catering. Hoping to increase their turnover, the members of the group decided to collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution and this is their first solidarity loan.
Mrs. Baha (the first woman standing on the left in the photo) is a well-known caterer in the village and surrounding area. She plans to use her loan to buy two sacks of fonio to prepare food in Segou. She sells her goods for cash and often for credit from home, and at the market to a mixed clientele.
Mrs. Baha hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20 000FCFA with this loan, that she will use to pay for basic necessities for her children and also to increase her business assets.

loans.use: To buy fonio for catering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the roof and wall of her kitchen

loans.name: Quennie

texts.en: Quennie, a BEED student in the university, wants to improve lives through better education. She used her previous loan to pay tuition fees for the first semester, and she needs to take another loan for the second semester. She is hopeful to continue and find a better job in the future to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the second semester.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 58 years old and married with three children. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nob

texts.en: Nob is 23 years old. He is a second-year student at university and his major is accounting. He is from Kampot province in Cambodia. Due to a lack of finances, he would like to request a loan to pay his tuition fees for a year and a semester. This loan will help him graduate to build a bright future. After graduation, he wants to work as an accountant in an institution or company.

loans.use: pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Leny didn't pursue her education in college. While she took care of her youngest brother, she runs a small retail store within their community to help her parents in generating income. 

Leny dreamed to make her business more viable and profitable but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to access an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy more inventory of grocery items, fruits and vegetables to resell. She believes that someday, she will further improve her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Pilika Pilika Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her early 50s, is a divorcee with six children. Two of them are still in school, and the other four are older.  She has been running a genge [a fruit and vegetable stand] for three years now.  She works from 6 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Amina's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to increase the stock of her genge. She dreams of owning a genge duka [a small store].  

Amina will share this loan with her loan group "Pilika Pilika," which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the stock of her genge.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the roof of his  house

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito raises and sells hogs to defray the family's daily expenses. She is a fifty-year-old married woman residing in Dulag, Leyte. She is a mother of five children. Her youngest child is 19. She has been in this kind of business for two years. Aside from raising hogs, she engages in rice farming. She grows and sells rice. Charito has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy an additional four piglets and pig feed.  

In the coming months, Charito will be able to produce and sell healthy pigs. This will augment her income, and will probably provide her family with healthy diets and better living conditions.

 In the future, Charito will expand both her businesses to attain a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy  additional four piglet and pig feed

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto is 65 years old and live in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married and has 2 adult-age children. He is happy doing his farming activity and he has had this business for 42 years. He is proud that his children finished their studies through his farming. 

Norberto requested a loan to pay for labor and seedbed preparation for the next crop season to sustain the demands of his customers. He has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Norberto hopes to renovate his house for his family.

loans.use: pay for labor and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Devin

texts.en: Devin is a father of two school-age children.  He lives in Disoy, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. Devin manages his food stall with the help of his wife. Since  the location of their food stall is very accessible, the sales are very promising.  Devin is very happy upon joining the Paglaum Cooperatives because of the financial assistance it offers.  He has applied for the amount of 18,000 PHP to purchase additional tables, chairs, and wood tiles so that their food stall can attract more clients.  Devin hopes that in the future his food stall become a restaurant and offer employment.

loans.use: buy tables, chairs & wood tiles

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 53 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married and has 2 adult-age children. He has a shop that sells meat from his piggery. He has had this business for 20 years. 

Rolando requested a loan to purchase 5 pigs, bags of feeds and vitamins to keep his pigs healthy and have delicious meat to sell. In the future, Rolando hopes that his business will grow and well-known so he can have more customers.

loans.use: buy pigs, feed & vitamins

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 51 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Lourdes has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from rice retailing. Lourdes aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Arlinda has been in this business for 4 years and earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: maintain her fishing boat

loans.name: Saron's Group

texts.en:
Saron, a local farmer from Kampong Speu province, is 48 years old and is a windowed mother blessed with six children. To support her family, she grows rice on a two-hectare area as her single source of income. She can earn an income of about 30,000 KHR per day. 

For Saron, this is her fourth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully paid back her past loans wisely to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. In this group of seven, she is a leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's  living and health.

loans.use: buy a latrine

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en: Speciose is 49 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 10 and 25 years, all of them go to school. She has a book shop and has been running this business for 15 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more books and pens to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy books & pens

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago Magdalene started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kabirsang, a remote village in the Nandi hills area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs, tea and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. 

Although she makes profits through milk selling, Magdalene lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through this  loan she will have a better time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Magdalene believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Magdalene waits for your kindness.

loans.use: build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moises  de 68 años de edad quien vive en Solola, casado que tiene 6 hijos. Quien se ha dedicado al trabajo de vendedor de maíz  por muchos años pues es el único oficio que le genera ingresos económicos, los primeros 3 hijos de el ya tienen familias separadas y los 3 últimos son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.

La actividad que realiza el es la venta de maíz en el mercado de su comunidad, el lleva realizando esta actividad por más de 30 años y le genera un buen ingreso económico. La  tierra ha sido bendecida por manos de Moises pues es la segunda actividad que el realiza actividad que el realiza y le gusta  trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de maíz de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación.

El motivo de la realización de su  préstamo es para la compra de cuarenta y cinco quintales de maíz y abono químico para que sus siembras de maíz sea de la mejor este año y así obtener más materia prima para venderlos por los alrededores de su comunidad y en el mercado de la misma.

Las metas de el es pagar sus deudas con que el cuenta y en un futuro comprar más terrenos para la siembra de mas maíz y brindarles educación a sus hijos para que ellos sean bueno profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Moises is 68 years old and lives in Solola. He is married with six children, and has worked as corn merchant for many years as it is the only occupation that will generate income for him. His three older children already have families of their own, and the three younger ones are excellent students at the local school.

He sells corn in the market of this community. He has been engaged in the business for more than 30 years and it provides him with a good income. 

The land has been blessed by the hands of Moises, as farming is the second activity that he does. He likes to work the land and look after it. Farming is an occupation worthy of admiration, one to which men devote years and their whole lives. The land without the labor of farmers devoted to the cultivation of corn would not provide the crops that sustain every generation. 

The purpose of this loan is to buy 45 quintals of corn (a quintal is about 100 lb), as well as chemical fertilizer, so that his corn crop will be of the best this year and so that he can obtain more corn to sell in the area surrounding his community and in the market. His goal is to pay off his debts, and in the future buy more land for growing more corn and for providing an education for his children so that they can be fine professionals someday.

loans.use: To buy 45 quintals of corn (a quintal is about 100 lb), as well as chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. Teresita is a very hardworking woman. To earn an income, she decided to run a small sari-sari or variety store business. Her husband also earns an additional income through farming. 

As of now, Teresita needs more capital for the expansion of her business. She is requesting for a loan to buy more stocks for her store like rice, noodles, canned goods, soda and beverages, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments. This loan will help her improve her inventories thus attracting more buyers in her store.

Teresita hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Imanuel

texts.en:
Imanuel is a 45-year-old man. He has a wife, Yasinta, a 36-year-old woman. Their marriage is blessed with 2 children, namely Cintami, 5, a kindergarten student; and  Anselbi, 1 year 6 months. At the moment, Imanuel is working in the NTT Provincial Agriculture Department as a contract employee. His main task is a driver. Imanuel has run a business as an electrician for years. 

Friends of Imanuel's usually trust him to repair their electricity devices such as radio, TV, and even the electricity installation in their house. Imanuel runs this business after work to support his family needs. A few months ago Imanuel and his little family moved to their own house. They are grateful for living in their new house even though it is just a simple house.  

Imanuel is planning to complete the construction of the roof. Unfortunately he does not have much money to do so. This is the reason for him to apply for an individual loan of IDR 3.000.000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on materials such as cement, sand, timber, and zinc.

loans.use: build the roof for his house

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is from Cavite, Philippines. Jeffrey, her partner, is a landscaper and they have one child.  Julieta has been employed to a garment factory in Cavite for almost six years through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*. Julieta is a production worker. She helps in garment making processes, from cutting to sewing, pressing, packing, tagging and shipping.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Julieta, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, a situation that makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. For this reason, Julieta is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem returning it back since the loan payments area being deducted every pay day.  She looks forward for your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will also use the loan to buy personal needs,  particularly her child's needs like milk, vitamins and medicine. She will also use the loan to pay some of her debt.

Julieta wants to have a stable source of income, it is just that she has no capital yet to start her own business. She meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: pay for personal necessities

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and married with five children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She successfully repaid her latest loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Jocelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, spices, egg, etc for her restaurant business.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 7 years and also earns more income from pig fattening.  Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 51 years old and is a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Erna has a personal products retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.  

Erna requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like perfume, body-lotion, deodorant and shampoo to offer for sale.  In the future, Erna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy personal care products

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a citrus farm business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her citrus farm business.   She has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Violeta successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.  Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Rose does not boast of a university degree or even a certificate from an agricultural institute, but she is an accomplished farmer from the Nandihills area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She is happily married and together with her handsome husband, they are blessed with 4 children. For the past 15 years she has been involved in mixed farming and because of the immense knowledge she has in farming, farmers from their village and neighboring villages troop to her home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques. 

Rose has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices in the recent past have been going up, so Rose, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling her milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also be selling to big dairy processing firms. 

Rose said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural based loans, and their interest rate is low and is on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Rose hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: renovate her house

loans.name: Vout

texts.en:
Vout is 43 years old and is a mother of four dependent children living in Kampong Thom province. Nowadays, she needs to support on three children, two of whom are in school and one is in university. She earns income to support her family via rice farming and watermelon growing.  She also earns extra income via pig raising and fish catching. 

This is the fifth cycles for Vout with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans wisely to improve her living condition at a  gradually pace. Now, she wants to focus on her son education. Therefore, she applied for a new loan in order to pay the tuition fees for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in Veterinary medicine. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: pay her son's college tuition

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Meerim

texts.en:
Meerim is a freshman in AUCA's Business Administration Department and this is her story:

“I am 18 and it’s time when I should start taking care of myself. Up to this day my parents have done a lot for me: bought me clothes and food, sent me to the private school, paid for my entertainment, despite of the difficulties.  I was a diligent student and had 50% discount at school for my excellent performance, and due to my family’s financial difficulties.

I am from ordinary family in Osh. At the present my father is unemployed due to his poor health, my mother is a public officer. I could have a part-time job and help my parents, but it’s hard to find job because of the lack of job places. That’s why I want to change my life and prepare myself for the bright future. I am sure that I can achieve success and be confident of my future with AUCA. AUCA is like a Cambridge in UK or Harvard in USA. Our wonderful professors make us broaden the scope of our consciousness and urge us to stay critical. I would like to thank Kiva lenders for their friendly attitude and look forward to the loan.”

loans.use: pay her university tuition

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella has managed a general store for over twelve years, and she earns well to supplement her husband’s income. She has sustained her business with the support of her entire family. Her previous loan for the business has been repaid successfully. To increase sales, she took a new loan recently to buy additional grocery goods, grains, and plastic wares to sell. In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods, grains, and plastic wares to sell

loans.name: Luz Del Mundo Group

texts.es: Luz del mundo, es un grupo solidario integrado por tres socias exitosas en su vida laboral, lo coordinadora es la señora Concepción, quien tiene la edad de 42 años, acompañada, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos varios desde hace ocho años comercializándolos en su domicilio y comunidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de productos Avon tales como perfumes, vanidades, sombras, marbellines, etc la socio lleva trece ciclos trabajando con los financiamiento de la institución ADIM y ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual en las fechas de pago del crédito.
