El resto de los integrantes son la señora Quira de 29 años de edad y propietaria de una venta de pescado, y la señora Reyna, quien tiene la edad de 31 años y se dedica a la comercialización de ropa desde hace tres años.
texts.en:
"Luz del Mundo" (Light of the World) is a solidarity group that consists of three women who are successful in their work. The group coordinator is Sra. Concepción. She is 42 years old and in a relationship. Concepción has been selling cosmetics and other products for eight years out of her home and in her community. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy Avon products such as perfumes, compacts, eye shadows, mascaras, and other items. Concepción has participated in three loan cycles with ADIM and has demonstrated that she is responsible and punctual with her payments.

The other members are as follows:
• Sra. Quira, age 29, is the owner of a fish shop.
• Sra. Reyna, age 31, has been selling clothes for three years.

loans.use: to buy Avon products such as perfumes, compacts, eye shadows, mascaras, and other items so that she can increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sheeting, wood, nails, brick, cement, sand, and iron, in order to build a kitchen and a covered porch for his home.

loans.name: José Josué

texts.es:
El campo fértil donde alumbra el sol cada mañana donde los trabajadores hacen presencia para otro día de labrar la tierra y provecharlas al máximo, es el trabajo de José soltero de 25 años motivo por el cual el a acudido a otro préstamo para seguir en el cultivo de papas que el ha venido haciendo hace un tiempo atrás para el beneficio de su familia y su comunidad.

Cuando no tenía acceso a los préstamos el no sacaba buena cosecha, pera gracias a los préstamos que el ha venido realizando el a podido tener muy buena cosecha para tener una mejor producción y realizar el cultivo de papas para el beneficio de su comunidad y la de su familia y como una fuente de ingresos económicos.

La inversión que realizara para el nuevo préstamo es para la compra de fertilizantes, ya que es muy importante para la producción de papas y tener  buena cosecha para poner a la disposición de su comunidad y en el mercado de su comunidad y así obtener ingresos económicos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Uno de las aspiraciones de el es llegar a la ampliación de sus siembras y la venta de las mismas y darles un buen servicio para su comunidad.
texts.en: The fertile field lit up by the sun each morning, where workers show up every day to work the land to its maximum advantage, is where Jose works. He is single and 25 years old, and is requesting another loan in order to continue growing potatoes. He has been doing this work for a while, in order to benefit his family and his community. When he did not have access to loans, he did not produce a good harvest, but thanks to his previous loans he has had a good harvest and better production. He was able to grow potatoes for the benefit of his community and of his family, and as a source of income. With this new loan he will buy fertilizer, which is important to his potato production. He wants a good harvest to provide to his community  in the local market, and thereby earn income to improve the living conditions of his family.One of his goals is to increase the amount that he grows and sells, and to provide a good service to his community.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: San Juan Bosco Group

texts.es: San Juan Bosco es integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, que buscan el bienestar de su familia, está coordinado por Lucelia una joven de 22 años de edad y soltera que se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas en el mercado de la municipalidad, este negocio lo impulso hace seis años y ha logrado mantenerlo aun con los alzas de precios que presentan las frutas, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de zapote y limón, ya que esto productos están teniendo demanda por parte de la población. Otra de las integrantes es Ninoska una mujer de 38 años de edad que se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos AVON, Zermat y Arabela desde hace cinco años en su comunidad, y Margina una joven de 22 años y quien se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva desde hace tres años en su comunidad.
texts.en: San Juan Bosco is made up of three entrepreneurial women in search of their families' wellbeing. The group is led by Lucelia, a young 22-year-old single woman who works in the municipal market buying and selling produce. She launched this business six years ago, and has been able to maintain her business despite spikes in the price of fruits. She is requesting this loan to buy sapote (a Central American fruit) and lemons, since those products are in relatively high demand by the local population. Another group member is Ninoska, a 38-year old woman who has worked in her community selling Avon, Zermat and Arabela cosmetics for the last five years. Margina is a young 22-year-old woman who has worked in her community selling new clothes for the last three years.

loans.use: to buy sapote and lemon in order to fulfill demand for these products

loans.name: La Esperanza De Chiquilistagua Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Esperanza de Chiquilistagua está integrado por tres socios emprendedores y trabajadores, donde la coordinadora es la Doña Paubla, soltera, de 49 años de edad, y se dedica a la hecha y venta de nacatamales y venta de ropa usada en su domicilio desde hace veinte y dos años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de materiales para su negocio como hojas de chagüites, mecates, cerdo, pollo, blusas, pantalones, shores, camisetas, etc. La segunda socia es Claudia de 37 años de edad, y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y zapatos desde hace tres años y medio y el tercer socio es Carlos de 35 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería.
texts.en: The Esperanza de Chiquilistagua solidarity group is made up of three hard-working, entrepreneurial members. The group leader is Doña Paubla, who is a 49-year-old single woman who has worked from her home selling nacatamales and used clothing for the last 22 years. She is requesting this loan to buy materials for her business, like banana leaves, rope, pork, chicken, blouses, pants, shorts, t-shirts, etc. The second group member is Claudia, who is 37 years old and has worked selling makeup and shoes for the last three and a half years. The third group member is 35-year-old Carlos, whose business is a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business like banana leaves, rope, pork, chicken, blouses, pants, shorts, t-shirts, etc., with the goal of meeting demand

loans.name: Wassa Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Yiriwa vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Moussokorobougou de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de grains, de restauration et de condiment .Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Matou  (la 1ere femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galette à base de sauce dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 sac de grains de mil à Moussokorobougou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Matou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 8 000 avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The five women of the Yiriwa group all live in traditional families. On average they are 43 years old with three children. They all live in Moussokorobougou of Ségou (in the fourth administrative region of Mali Republic).
They met through living in the same neighbourhood, through family and marital associations and through their income generating activities in the village. They deal in grains and catering and condiments. Hoping to increase their turnover, the members of the group decided to collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution and this is their second solidarity loan.
Mrs. Matou (the first woman standing on the right in the photo) is a well-known millet cake seller in the village and surrounding area. She plans to use her loan to buy one sack of millet grains in Moussokorobougou. She sells her goods for cash and often for credit from home, and at the market to a mixed clientele.
Mrs. Matou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 8 000FCFA with this loan, which she will use to pay for basic necessities for her children and also to increase her business assets.

loans.use: To buy millet to make cakes.

loans.name: Vii

texts.en: Vii is 48 years old and married, and he and his spouse have been blessed with 8 children. He has a butchery business in Makueni town, and it has been profitable. He plans to use this loan to buy more stock of meat for sale. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. This is his third loan from VisionFund Kenya, and he repaid the previous loan well. His future hopes are to grow his business and be successful, make more income, and be able to care for his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a goat for slaughter

loans.name: Mila Luna

texts.en:
Mila Luna is 48 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mila Luna is borrowing PHP 21,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mila Luna has been raising pigs for 16 years and also earns additional income from a personal products retail business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil is a hardworking father who is 29 years old. He and his family earn a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where they sell spare parts for motor vehicles. Ramil is good at repairing vehicles and uses this skill to help sell replacement parts. He joined Paglaum because of the financial assistance, insurance and savings it provides. He is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000, to buy additional spare parts and the latest styles for motor vehicles. Ramil dreams of expanding his store with help from Paglaum and hopes to save money to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motor vehicles.

loans.name: Dúo Dulce Esperanza Group

texts.es:
DUO DULCE ESPERANZA
Doña Selsa es originaria de la aldea Pacorral del municipio de Tecpán, Guatemala  tiene 54 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de animales.
Gracias a Dios y al apoyo de su esposo y el apoyo de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su negocio, ya que ella empezó con un negocio pequeño y gracias a Dios ahora su negocio a crecido.
Con el crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en compra de materia prima para elaborar sus tejidos y así mismo compro otros animalitos para crianza ya que es el medio que tiene para salir adelante.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio ofrecer otros estilos de tejidos a sus clientes ya que así ella tendrá mejores ganancias y así mejorar su calidad de vida. El prestamo lo nececita para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos
texts.en:
Dúo Dulce Esperanza [Sweet Hope Duo]

Doña Selsa is from the village of Pacorral, within the municipality of Tecpán, Guatemala.  She is 54 years old.  She weaves traditional textiles by hand, and she raises animals. 

Thanks to God and the support of her husband and children, she is making progress in her business. She started with a small business, and now, thanks to God, her business has grown.

She invested her loan in the purchase of raw materials for weaving her textiles; and she also purchased small animals to raise, as this is how she gets ahead.

Her dream is to expand her business more, offering other styles of textiles to her customers.  In this way, she will have more earnings and thus improve her quality of life.  

She needs the loan for the purchase of raw materials for weaving textiles.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for weaving textiles.

loans.name: Berlin Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Berlín lo integran tres socios quien lo coordina es el señor José Luis de 38 años de edad, acompañado y padre de un hijo, quien ha sido su mayor motivación para su superación, se dedica a la comercialización de tamales dulce y tamales pisques en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace once años, es el quinto ciclo que solicita el financiamiento de la institución para su negocio, este crédito lo solicita para la compra de quintal de maíz, flete de leña, hojas de chagüite, atado de dulce y compra de utensilio que le ayudaran a mejorar la calidad de los productos ofrecidos, el socio asegura que los créditos anteriores han sido de mucha ayuda para su superación personal, ya que le ha ayudado a incrementar la clientela que solicitan este producto. Este grupo solidario también lo integran dos socios más que luchan por el bien de su familia, estos son, el señor Julio quien tiene la edad de 28 años y comercializa tamales desde hace cinco años en el mercado de la municipalidad, y la señora Emma de 52 años quien se dedica a la comercialización de derivados del maíz como es tamal, pinol y pinolillo desde hace diecinueve años.
texts.en:
The Berlín group is comprised of three members.  José Luis, age 38, is the coordinator.  He is in a relationship and has one child, who has been his greatest motivation for succeeding.  He has been selling sweet tamales and "pisque" tamales [tamales made with bean filling] at the municipal market for 11 years.  

It is his fifth cycle of requesting a loan from the institution for his business.  He will use the requested loan to buy a ‘quintal’ [about 100 pounds] of corn, a load of firewood, banana leaves, sugar cane, and utensils to help him improve the quality of the products that he sells.

The member attests that the previous loans have been a great help for his personal improvement.  They have helped him increase the clientele that request his products.

This communal bank is comprised of two other members who struggle for their family’s well-being.  Julio, age 28, has been selling tamales at the municipal market for five years.  Emma, age 52, has been selling corn derivatives like tamales and ‘pinol’ and ‘pinolillo’ [corn based drinks] for 19 years.

loans.use: to buy a ‘quintal’ [about 100 pounds] of corn, a load of firewood, banana leaves, sugar cane, and utensils.

loans.name: Jenny Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Jenny Carolina  de  32  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos   hijos que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, no tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 04 años  a la venta de dulces, sandalias, golosinas, frescos, ropa interior, etc.
Doña Jenny Carolina es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de más productos para su negocio como platanos, yuca, papas, queso, frijoles, arroz, etc. ya que desea surtirlo porque la demanda es bastante fuerte para esta época de navidad.  Con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida, su sueño es tener su propia casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Jenny Carolina, age 32, lives with her husband and their two children, who are dependent upon her.  She lives in a community in San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras.  She does not have her own house.

She has been selling sweets, sandals, candy, soft drinks, and underwear, etc. for four years.  Jenny Carolina is a hard-working woman with the desire to get ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy more products for her business.  She will buy things like bananas, yucca, potatoes, cheese, beans, and rice, etc.  She wishes to stock her business because the demand is pretty strong during this Christmas season.  With the support of the loan she hopes to improve her business, and as a result she will improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to have her own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – October, 2014

loans.use: to buy bananas, yucca, potatoes, cheese, beans, and rice, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wiring, light switches, electrical outlets, and a thermal breaker box, and pay the fees for installing electricity in her home.

loans.name: Duwer

texts.es:
Duwer tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Saña; él goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Duwer se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales como pavos, patos y cuyes, desde hace más de 5 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Él solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento para los mismos. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Duwer is 29 years old, married and lives with his wife and son. They have their own home in a large community in the urban area of Saña. 

Duwer gets good personal and work references from his neighbours. His community is mostly engaged in agriculture, livestock and trade. It is located in the Saña district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.

Duwer has been raising and selling animals such as turkeys, ducks and guinea pigs for more than 5 years, from his own home. He is asking for a loan to buy animals and food for them. This is how he will grow his business, allowing him to improve his short term revenue, increase profits and thus improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy animals and food for them

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking mother who owns and manages a small retail store within the local community. She is 40 years old and blessed with six children. She aspires to make her business more profitable in order to meet the necessities of her family. 

Due to capital insufficiency, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock of groceries, rice, fruits and vegetables to sell in her community. Being a patient and industrious mother, she believes that someday she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries, rice, fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 55 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rebecca has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Rebecca has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Al-Asdika Al- Awfia Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Asdika Al-Awfia. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They took a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Iman is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She lives with her family in their own house in Sana'a, Yemen. She is the leader of the group. Iman's husband is an employee in a private sector, and he is the sole breadwinner of the family. Iman studied through elementary school. She couldn't complete her study, but she is a very dynamic and active woman. 

Iman has a lot of housework. Her house lacks of many standard home appliances such as a washing machine and other appliances. Iman is always washing more of the family's clothes with her hands. This work makes her very tired, a condition she can't afford. For this reason, Iman applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a washing machine to help her wash the clothes.

loans.use: To buy a washing machine to help her in washing her family's clothes.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 52-year-old Palestinian refugee and a married father of six children, who has been working as a baker for 11 years. He is a hard worker and well-known in his region, with his good reputation and special products served.

Khaled learned baking steps from his mother, who used to bake the family their own homemade bread, which Khaled believes is the best. Khaled specializes in making 'manakish' and special pastries requested by most of his customers. 

He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to develop his business by increasing his raw materials, with special discount prices that will help to increase his family's income.

He has a strong talent in his domain, but the camp he is living and working in with his family has limited, set prices which he can't increase because of limited customers and wide competition. That's why he is working hard, so that, one day, he can move it outside the camp and attract more customers. 

This is Khaled's fifth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Develoment borrower, with a remarkable repayment history. His previous loans helped him a lot in developing his family's living, especially through helping his children make an improvement in their own living.

Khaled hopes to stay in good health to remain capable of supporting his family as best he can.

loans.use: to develop his bakery business by increasing his raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making cakes

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Daisy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from buying and selling rice and fruit. Daisy is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries for her general store business to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell in her business.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 51 years old, married, and has 9 children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Marjorie has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 14 years. Marjorie has successfully borrowed and repaid 20 times now from NWTF and, more recently, Kiva lenders to help sustain her business.

Marjorie is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Baskallia

texts.en:
Baskallia has one child and lives in Nandihills, a remote town in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past five years of her life farming. She sells milk, poultry, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in personal business to make ends meet.

Baskallia is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutritional value. She is so keen and close to her cows that she has given them names. 

Dairy farming being a very profitable business venture, Baskallia wants to take full advantage of her opportunities, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital. That is why she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. Baskallia has planted Napier grass, so feeding the cows will never be a challenge. She also owns an expansive piece of land, and the excess space will be productively used once she acquires the additional dairy cow. The cow she will buy will produce between 10 and 15 litres of milk per day, which will translate to more income and profits. The profits from milk selling will allow Baskallia to grow her business further, by starting to package milk and by processing it into other dairy products, such as cream, yoghurt, and cheese. In addition, she will benefit from the organic manure from the cow. She projects that she will be able to start a biogas plant at her farm, which will save her money in fuel costs.

With your loan, all that Baskallia dreams of is a secure future for her children.

loans.use: To buy an exotic, high-quality dairy cow

loans.name: Baraka Office Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyasisi est commerçante, membre d’un collectif  d’affaires «Baraka Office», âgée de 58 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants tous étudient.  La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale sa marchandise à son domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son beau père. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Il y a 20 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 sacs braises, 2 sacs d’haricots, sucre, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
This client, Nyasisi, is a merchant and a member of the business collective “Baraka Office”. She is 58 years old and a married mother of four children, all provided with education. This client is a vendor of grocery items. She displays her merchandise in her home on a busy avenue in town. She began her business with funds from her father-in-law. Her husband is unemployed. 

Nyasisi has been in this business for twenty years. This new loan will be used to purchase 3 sacks of charcoal, 2 sacks of beans, sugar, etc. Thus, she would like to educated her children and provide food and clothing for them. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of charcoal, 2 sacks of beans, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Susima

texts.en:
Susima is a 31-year-old married woman with 3 children. She makes her living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Susima is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation so she can buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Though she also earns additional income from buying and selling fish, Susima has been raising pigs for 9 years now.

Susima works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sheila May

texts.en:
Sheila May is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sheila May is 38 years old, and all of her children are in school.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Sheila May has been in this business for three years.

Sheila May requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Yiriwa vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Moussokorobougou de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de grains, de restauration et de condiment .Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Siata (debout au milieu dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de grains d’arachide dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de grains d’arachide à Moussokorobougou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Siata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 7 500FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Yiriwa all live in traditional families, and they average 43 years of age and three children each, all living in the village of Moussokorobougou in Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the village. They have small-scale businesses involving grains and condiments, and they work in food service. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Siata (standing in the middle in the photo) is a major vendor of peanuts in and around the village. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 sacks of peanuts in Moussokorobougou. He sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often credit at the house and at the market. 

With this loan, Ms. Siata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 7,500 francs CFA that will be used to meet the children’s sundry needs and also to increase her capital.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. Due to her husband's low financial situation, she decided two years ago to start baking to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Raeda is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand her business through buying necessary baking tools and materials. This loan will help Raeda provide her customers with better and quicker service, as she would be able to bake different kinds of bread.

Raeda hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary baking tools and materials

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is a married man who lives in a small community of Battambang Province. He has three children in total; one is farmer and two are students. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates rice farming business in a farmland which is located near his house. He has been involving with this business since 2004. His is able to earn a daily income of USD 5, on average.

Ny wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system.  Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. 

After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV, and radio. He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. 

He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, balconies and doors to install in her home.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by selling ready-to-wear items in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 26,000 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for three years, repaid a previous loan and now is requesting a new loan to further build up her businesses. She supplements her income by various other activities, including raising hogs and buying and selling rice. Her goal is to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ready-to-wear items to sell.

loans.name: Florivic

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Florivic works hard to support her family.

She has a farming citrus business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Florivic is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her farming citrus business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 48 years old, and a married woman with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mildred has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Mildred has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Gieralyn

texts.en:
Gieralyn is 32 years old. She is married with one child.

Gieralyn earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation so she can purchase additional sacks of feed.

Gieralyn has been in the business of pig fattening for 6 years now. However, she also earns additional income from food vending.

Gieralyn is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a 41-year-old married woman who operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items such as noodles, sugar, eggs, spices, soap, soft drinks, coffee, and biscuits. 

Arlyn hails from Dulag, Leyte in the Philippines. She has 3 children, aged 10, 15, and 17 years old. 

Due to the lack of capital, Arlyn has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP in order to buy a variety of goods to sell in her sari-sari store, like rice, beverages, toiletries, and seasonings. This will help Arlyn offer a greater assortment of goods and satisfy more customers. 

For a brighter future, Arlyn would like to expand her business, which would not only let her provide better living conditions but also finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods like rice, beverages, toiletries, and seasonings to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
Aggrey is 52 years old, married and together with his spouse, has been blessed with three children. He has a pool table business and also sells music and movie compact disks. 

He plans to use this loan to buy more stock of music and movies compact disks to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to venture into the property business and to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy music and movie compact disks.

loans.name: Guzman

texts.es:
Guzman vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su cónyuge y tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 15, 12, 4 de los cuales el mayor se encuentra cursando estudios superiores, el de 15 cursando estudios secundarios, el de 12 años estudios primarios en colegio nacional en el distrito de Pomahuaca y el de 04 en el pronohi del distrito. Guzman tiene 35 años radicando en la zona, tiene muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad. Su comunidad está ubica en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Guzman es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de cacao, ubicado en el caserío San Martín del distrito de Pomahuaca, con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años, el préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarias, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para deshierbo de sus parcelas del cultivo de cacao. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.
texts.en:
Guzman lives with his spouse in the home they own, which is built out of rustic materials. They have four children, ages nineteen, fifteen, twelve, and four. The oldest is in college, the fifteen-year-old is in high school, the twelve-year-old is in primary school attending the public school in Pomahuaca district, and the four-year-old goes to the district preschool. Guzman is 35 years old and lives in the area. He has very good personal and employment references in his community. His community is located in Pomahuaca district, in the province of Jaén, which is in the region of Cajamarca, in Peru's northern mountains.

Guzman works as a farmer, specifically growing cacao in the community of San Martin, within the district of Pomahuaca. He has fifteen years of experience in this field. He will use this loan to help with his farming, to buy supplies, phytosanitary products, and fertilizers. He will also use it to pay for labor to help weed his cacao fields. This will help him improve the physiology, morphology, and productivity of his crops so that his harvest is ready on time, and yields more and better quality product. This will allow him to have no problems selling his product.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc for her restaurant business.

Maribel has been in this business for 18 years and earns more income from pig fattening.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, fish, and spices

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
A young mother of young kid living in Kampong Speu province, Sokhorn is 18 years old. She does rice as her main source of income to support her family's condition. Her husband can earn extra income by car driving. Her family’s daily income is approximately 15,000 KHR per day. 

For Sokhorn, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of nine members to get new loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to use, as other families.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 33 years old and lives in Kapsabei, a remote village in the Nandihills area of Kenya which has good weather that favors crop and animal farming. She is a single mother who has two beautiful children. Eunice has been actively involved in mixed farming for the past six years and sells milk, eggs and various varieties of food crops at a local market and to her neighbors. She passionately loves poultry farming. The biggest challenge she is currently facing is the lack of breeds of poultry that are disease resistant and grow well. To solve this problem she is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to buy additional poultry that will grow well. Having additional poultry will provide her with practical benefits since she will be able to increase her egg production and also sell good-quality poultry meat. Through this loan, she will increase her profit margins and bring better living conditions to her family. Eunice believes that proper feeding of her poultry with high-quality feed will allow it to grow even better. Other than profits from poultry, she will benefit from chicken manure, which contains higher amounts of nitrogen than other forms of livestock manure. Eunice is comfortable with the repayment period and monthly installments and promises to make payments throughout the repayment cycle.

loans.use: to buy better breeds of chicken for her farm

loans.name: Leonidas Group

texts.es: Leonidas es un grupo solidario integrado por tres socios esforzados, es coordinado por Fátima una mujer emprendedora de 35 años de edad, acompañada, dedicada a la comercialización de frutas y verduras en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace tres años, por medio de un préstamo que le hizo a su hermana, este crédito lo solicita para la compra de plátano, tomate, chiltoma, zanahoria, chayote, yuca, e impulsar la venta de lácteos como es queso, crema y la venta de carne de pollo. El resto de los integrantes son la señora Narcisa de 49 años de edad, quien realiza y vende nacatamales en su domicilio desde hace veinticinco años, además vende por encargo en la capital, y el joven Mercedes Antonio de 28 años propietario de una mini pulpería en su domicilio desde hace un años.
texts.en:
Leonidas is a solidarity group made up of three hard-working partners. It is coordinated by Fatima, an enterprising 35-year-old woman who is married and sells fruit and vegetables from home. She started her business three years ago through a loan from her sister.

She is asking for this loan to buy bananas, tomatoes, bell peppers, carrots, chayote and yuca, and to start selling both dairy products - such as cheese and cream - and chicken meat. 

The other members are Narcisa, who is 49 years old and has been making and selling tamales at home for twenty years, as well as selling  by order in the capital, and the 28-year-old Mercedes Antonio, a young man who has run a mini grocery store from his home for the past year.

loans.use: to buy bananas, tomatoes, bell peppers, carrots, chayote and yuca, and to buy cheese and cream in order to start selling dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pork, chicken barbecue, hot dogs, liver and seasonings

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Ann is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Hoeun's Group

texts.en: Hoeun, 30, lives with her family in a rural village of the Kampong Speu province and is the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She grows rice as her sole source of income, and earns about 24,000 KHR per day. Hoeun is the leader of a five-person loan group, and is requesting her first loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She will use the money to buy a water filter so that her family can have enough clean water to drink.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Souheir

texts.en:
Souheir is a 40-year-old married mother of two children, and a Palestinian refugee who lives and works in a Palestinian camp. 

Two years ago, she started her clothes selling business to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.  Today, Souheir is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a special new winter collection to satisfy her customers. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business, to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special new winter collection.

loans.name: Esery

texts.en:
Esery has a mobile money transfer business in the town of Kitengela. She has been running this business for 5 years and it has been profitable. She is 27 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with 1 child. 

She will use this loan to add more money float to her mobile money transfer business so she can serve more customers and make more income. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya.  In the future, her hopes are to be successful in her business, improve the living standards of her family and educate her children to a higher level such as university.

loans.use: to add more money float to her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP  through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

Carmen has been in this business for eight years and she earns more income from food vending.

Carmen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 52 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Josefina has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Josefina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 50-year-old father of four from Mundri County in South Sudan. He operates his own business. Emmanuel buys and sells general items such as sugar, cloth, soap, stationery, candles, flour, milk, salt,  etc. 

Emmanuel is requesting a loan from WOYE MFI so that he can expand his business. He will be able to increase his stock and boost his sales. He hopes that after one year, his own shop in the community will be able to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Wilmar

texts.en:
Wilmar is a 32-year-old production worker in a garment factory in Cavite, Philippines. He already has one child and is married to Cherry Lou, who is also a factory worker. They are both beneficiaries of the employment services under the supervision of the Center for Community Transformation Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

In the garment factory, Wilmar works as a Clothing Presser. He both under-presses fabrics during their production and presses garments in a garment-finishing department during their final stages of production.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Wilmar is the improper balance of salaries and family expenses. As as result, there is little access to either savings or credit. This situation can make such employees heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. For this reason, Wilmar is asking for your assistance in preventing him from exposure to loan sharks. 

Wilmar has previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative which he had no problem repaying, since the loan payments were deducted with each payday. He looks forward to your positive response, as any amount will surely be of great help. Wilmar plans to use the loan to pay the balance he owes for his motorcycle.

Wilmar dreams of one day becoming a successful and wealthy businessman. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers

loans.use: to pay the balance owed for his motorcyle.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Risper a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman who hails from Nandihills area of Kenya, an area that is near the famous Rift valley. She is 27 years of age and has been farming for the past 8 years.  Through those years, she has gathered so much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, tea, crops and some small businesses that she does so that she can make ends meet. Risper is very passionate about farming and she loves cultivating her farm. That is why every day she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough. 

Although Risper makes profits through farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income through the selling of cereals. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy cereals. The Nandihills area is one of the regions that is populated and has a high demand for cereals. That means that Risper will make more profits and be able to satisfy the demand that is there. 

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Risper, but she feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Risper believes that this loan will be of much help and she will be able to satisfy the demand that is there for cereals and she believes that the extra income will allow permanent change to her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Risper to repay back the loan and secure the future of her school going children.

loans.use: to purchase cereals to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase electrical appliances to furnish her home.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is borrowing 5,500 PHP to pay for the tuition of her child for the 2nd semester of the school year 2013-14. Lilibeth supports her family through her carinderia (local eatery) business in the Philippines.

Pia Trisha is 17 years old and is the first of 2 children in the family. Pia Trisha is studying toward a Bachelor of Science degree in Civil Engineering and is currently on her 2 of this 5-year course.

When she graduates, Pia Trisha plans to be gainfully employed so that she can help improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition of her child

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 55 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emelita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emelita has been raising pigs for three years and also earns income from tricycle passengers.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mango Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her early 30s, is a married mother of three children, two of whom are in school. Amina has operated a genge for three years now, working from 5 am to 8 pm daily. She is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Amina's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to restock items in her genge. She dreams of building her own house. 

Amina will share this loan with her loan group "Mango", which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock items in her genge.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
El señor Denis  es un hombre trabajador y dedicado al negocio propio que es venta de leche y venta de ganado, actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años, este trabajo lo realiza todos los días de la semana, el vende su producto a sus vecinos y amigos de la comunidad donde vive.
Don Denis esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de vacas para engordarlas y después venderlo a un mejor precio para obtener un mejor margen de ganancia y a su vez mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia, su sueño es que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando.


Danlí, Honduras – Octubre  2014
texts.en:
Denis is a hard working man and has his own business of selling milk and cows. He has been doing this for six years and works every day of the week. He sells his produce to his neighbours and friends in his community. Denis is asking for this loan so that he can buy cows to fatten up so that he can sell them for a better price and improve his profit margin while at the same time improving his quality of life a little bit as well as that of his family. His dream is for his children to be able to continue studying. 

Danlí, Honduras – October  2014

loans.use: to buy cows for his business.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila, who is single, has been operating a general store business in the Philippines for six years now. She has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, candies, etc. to sell.

In the future, Nila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Maria Flordelis

texts.en:
A married parent of three children, Maria Flordelis works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Maria Flordelis has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en el ciclo 21, es un grupo muy unido y luchador, es por ello que ya llevan varios ciclos unidas. Se puede comentar la vida de la señora Emilce ella se dedica a la limpieza, trabaja en una empresa, ella es el soporte de su familia y del comité. 
Ella también tiene una despensa bien surtida que con trabajo y esfuerzo pudo montar y que también da ingresos para su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para la venta como ser verduras, arroz, fideos, carne, bebidas y demás.
texts.en:
The present committee is in its 21st loan cycle. It is a very close and hardworking group and that is why they have been together through various loan.  It can be said, regarding the life of Emilce, that she makes a living providing cleaning services working at a company. She is the supporter of her family and of the committee.

She also has a well supplied store that she was able to start with work and effort. It too provides income for her family. She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of various supplies to sell, such as vegetables, rice, noodles, meat, beverages, and such.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, rice, noodles, meat, beverages, and more.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 25-year-old married mother of three children. ages one, five and six. Josephine and her husband have been engaged in fishing since they got married. Their income supports the children's needs for food, school fees, etc. 

Josephine is requesting a loan of 25000 PHP to buy adhesive, nails, crab traps, ropes, an engine, plywood and paints. These purchases will definitely help her and her husband improve their earnings and their fishing business.

Josephine is optimistic that someday her family will have an improved life.

loans.use: to buy adhesive, nails, crab traps, ropes, an engine, plywood and paints

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 21 years old and is studying, toward a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education. She is currently on her fourth of this 4-year course.

Vilma needs PHP 4,500 to pay the tuition of her child for the second semester of the School Year 2013-14. When she graduates, Mary Grace plans to be gainfully employed. This will enable her to help improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to pay the tuition of her child, who is pursuing a degree in Elementary Education

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 30 years old and married; she has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etcetera. Letecia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years, and she earns additional income by selling fish.

She aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Hermenia works hard to support her family.

Hermenia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from operating a general store.  Hermenia is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Hermenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement, iron, zinc metal purlins and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Reyna Guadalupe

texts.es: Reyna de 46 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos una niña de 7 años y un varón de 17 años de edad. Ella demuestra sus ganas de salir adelante, ya que todos los días prepara desde muy temprano los ingredientes para elaborar diferentes platillos típicos que vende de forma ambulante por las calles del municipio. Reyna ha observado  que cada día son más las personas que demandan sus productos, por lo que ella desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: pan, maíz, repollo, yuca, lechuga, tomate, carne, etc. Para preparar platillos como: pasteles de carne, hamburguesas, hot dog, quesadillas, etc. Y lograr así cubrir la demanda de productos que le solicitan.
texts.en:
Reyna, age 46, lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children.  They have a 7 year old girl and a 17 year old boy.  She shows her desire to get ahead because every day, starting very early, she prepares the ingredients to make the different typical dishes that she sells in an itinerant manner on the streets of the municipality.

Reyna has observed that more people demand her products every day.  That is why she wishes to get a loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to buy bread, corn, cabbage, yucca, lettuce, tomatoes, and meat, etc.  She will use the ingredients to prepare dishes like meat pies, hamburgers, hot dogs, and quesadillas, etc.  She will manage to cover the demand for the products that are requested of her.

loans.use: to buy bread, corn, cabbage, yucca, lettuce, tomatoes, and meat, etc

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Marites has been engaged in selling taho (snack foods) within the local community, to help her husband in gaining income. She is 41 years old and has four, schooling children.

She aims to cook and sell more snack recipes to sell, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional PHP 7,000. She will use the loan to buy the needed plastic cups, sago, caramel, sugar, straws, and other supplies. Being a kind and hard-working mother, she believes that she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the needed plastic cups, sago, caramel, sugar, straws, and other supplies.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a 57 year old married woman and and a mother of six grown children from Leyte, Philippines. Faustina runs a small sari-sari or retail store in her place. This is the source of her income for the past 30 years. 
Faustina is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. condiments, coffee, sugar and snack foods. With this, she will be able to augment her inventories which will attract more buyers in her store. 
In the future, Faustina hopes to improve the sustainability and profitability of her store.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. condiments, coffee, sugar and snack foods

loans.name: Gaudensia

texts.en:
Gaudensia is 40 years old and married. Together with her spouse they have been blessed with four children. She sells clothes and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more clothes such as shirts and blouses to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her businesses, make more income and be able to buy a land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 49 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from rice retailing and food vending.

Marichu has been running the general store for 12 years. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell, like bread, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc.

Marichu has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan, aiming to further build her businesses.

Marichu aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like bread, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is 57 years old and widowed. She has four children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business, in the Philippines.

Andresa is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 20 years, and she earns additional income from meat vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

Nelly has been in this business for three years. Nelly earns more income from buying and selling Avon and Natashia products.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some new housewares for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two tables, chairs, and a tortilla press.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a single parent of four children, Marites works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Marites is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy spare parts, for motorcycle maintenance for her transport business. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling coconut wine in the Philippines. Aida is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell for her business.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Adelmo Antonio

texts.es: Adelmo, tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, y reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Adelmo desde pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando maíz y frijol. Y hace 5 años que cuenta con su propio cultivo de café. El café es vendido a los intermediarios de la zona y acabado de cortar, también la venta de maíz y frijol le genera otros ingresos. Actualmente solicita un préstamo por 6,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y abonar su parcela de café con el fin de mejorar el cultivo y cosecha. Y tiene como meta sembrar media manzana mas de café.
texts.en:
Adelmo is 24 years old, lives in a common law marriage with his wife, and resides in a small town of the municipality of Gracias, Lempira.  Since he was little, Adelmo worked in agriculture growing corn and beans. For 5 years now he has his own coffee crop. The coffee is sold to the middlemen of the area. The sale of fresh cut corn and beans also generates other income for him.

Currently he is asking for a loan of 6,000 lempiras to buy fertilizers to fertilize his coffee plot with the goal of improving the crop and the harvest. He also has a goal of planting a half of a manzana [approximately .86 acres] more of coffee.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to put in his coffee plot.

loans.name: Santos Isain

texts.es:
Santos, trabaja en el campo cultivando maíz además presta el servicio de albañil, tiene 34 años de edad, su núcleo familiar está formado por su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos; su negocio tiene 10 años de estar funcionando, de su cosecha una parte la utiliza para el consumo familiar y el resto lo comercializa para obtener ingresos para cubrir otras necesidades familiares.
Requiere de ayuda a través de un préstamo para comprarse abono para tener una mejor cosecha de maíz, espera abastecer a su familia de alimento y vender a mejor precio el resto para cubrir sus compromisos.
Santos sueña con mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda de bajareque para que su familia tenga un lugar más seguro en donde vivir.
texts.en:
Santos works in the fields by cultivating corn, but he also offers his services as a bricklayer. He is 34 years old and his family consists of his life companion and their three children. His business has been in operation for 10 years. Part of his harvest is set aside for family consumption and the rest is sold in order to generate income to cover other family needs.

Santos needs the help of a loan in order to buy compost so that he can have a better crop of corn. He hopes to supply his family with food and sell the rest at a better price so that he can fulfill his commitments.

Santos dreams of improving the infrastructure of his mud house so that his family can have a more secure place in which to live.

loans.use: to buy compost in order to have a better crop of corn.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Anita works hard to support her family. She has a business, selling coconut wine, in the Philippines.

Anita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell, for her coconut-wine-vending business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, age 29, is a married woman with four children. All four of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, running a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy more items like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, and other groceries.

In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is married with twelve children. She works hard to support her family. Cristina has a business in the Philippines buying and selling coconut wine.
She is borrowing 8000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase additional coconut wine to sell in her business.

Cristina has sustained her business activities with 4 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en:
Rabab is a 28-year-old, married mother, who began two years ago selling clothes from her house. She works to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Rabab is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. She will use the loan to increase her business merchandise with a more-requested winter clothes collection, to satisfy her customers' needs and attract new ones.

Rabab hopes to open her own clothes shop in the future. Having a shop would increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a winter clothes collection.

loans.name: Procerpina

texts.en: Procerpina is 58 years old and widowed. She buys and resells fruits and vegetables within the local community to generate income. Her goal is to continue this business, and improve it to generate sufficient income. Because she has inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to resell. Procerpina is a kind and diligent mother. She believes that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Reina Angelica

texts.es: Reina de 56 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se esfuerza por sostener la economía de su hogar, y para ello decidió hace 7 años instalar una tienda de productos básicos en su vivienda. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 17 años de edad, por lo que se siente muy feliz y satisfecha de tener un lugar digno donde vivir. Reina siempre está buscando la manera de salir adelante, es por ello que desea invertir en su tienda, ya que sabe que es una gran fuente de ingresos económicos para su hogar, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pan dulce, leche, huevos, café, azúcar, jabón, detergente, etc. Para obtener mejores ganancias de su negocio.
texts.en:
Reina is 56 years old and an enterprising woman who does her best to support her family. This is why she decided seven years ago to set up a small store in here home. She lives in her own home with her husband and their 17-year-old son, so she feels very happy and content to a have a decent place to live. 

Reina is always looking for a way to move forward in life, and that is why she wishes to invest in her store, as she knows that it is a great source of income for her household. Therefore she is applying to FUSAI for a loan in order to invest in sweet bread, milk, eggs, coffee, sugar, soap, detergent, etc. This is so that she can earn more money through her business.

loans.use: To purchase sweet bread, milk, eggs, coffee, sugar, soap, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Having repaid her previous loan, she is now requesting a new one through NWTF for PHP 13000 to buy more dry goods such as toys, school supplies and ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

NWTF is re-listing Analyn's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods such as toys, school supplies and ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria is 62 years old and widowed. She has four children, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Asteria runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, eggs, and so on. She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, and eggs

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 53-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Delia has been selling seafood in the Philippines for two years now. She has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more shrimp, crab, etc. to sell.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, crab, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rotha

texts.en: Rotha is 23 years old. She is a third-year student at a university in a city, majoring in accounting. She is a single daughter from a family in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Because she is short on finances to pay for her tuition fees, she would like to apply for a loan. This loan will help her graduate successfully. Rotha dreams of a good job after graduation with a reasonable salary to help her family.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Annie is 29 years old and has three children who are in school.

Annie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Annie requested a loan of 12000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Annie has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Annie would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a 47-year-old single lady, who has been baking special Saj bread (a very thin traditional Lebanese bread, which is baked on a concave oven top) since 2009. Her mother taught her the basics of baking a delicious Saj bread, and now she is very good at it.

Islam is a hard worker, who puts a lot of effort into developing her business and her social life.
She is acquiring her second loan cycle from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to do maintenance to the roof of her house. This is necessary in order to keep it a healthy place to live, especially before the coming winter season.
Islam is well known in her region for her special and delicious bread, in addition to her competitive prices.
Loyal customers come from far away regions for her bread, so she is working hard to start distributing her product to a wider area.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to the roof of her house, so that it is a healthy place to live

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. Merlinda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Merlinda has been in this business for 9 years now. In the future, Merlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more charcoal to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for 1 year, and also earns an income from a buy-and-sell nipa-roofing business.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Najmiya

texts.en: Najmiya was born in 1996. She is a very smart and clever woman. Najmiya successfully graduated school and has applied to the university. Now, she is a first-year student at Khujand State University. She learns the Russian language and literature. Najmiya studies well and takes part in many university competitions and parties. Najmiya is not married and lives with her parents. Her mother is a nurse; she works in a hospital. Her father is a migrant worker in Russia. Najmiya must pay for her tuition and is asking for a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 44 years old and married with five children. Jessica works very hard to provide for them.

Jessica runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc..

Jessica has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.
