loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 34 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, etc.  She has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, etc

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is a married woman with eight children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Donna is 42 years old.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Donna requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Donna would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en:
Mirvat is a 48-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working as a tailor from her house for the past seventeen years. Mirvat is a hard worker who is putting much effort towards supporting her beloved family. 

Mirvat is trying hard to provide her family with better life; thus she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay her children's school tuition fees.

Mirvat hopes to open her own tailoring shop in the future to achieve her dream and increase her income.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, Arlene is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy fishing net and other materials to use for her fishing business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional equipment like gasoline, bamboo, fishing net, etc. for her fishing business.

Florita has been in this business for 16 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Florita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment like gasoline, bamboo, and fishing net.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Julia, 31 years of age, a very hardworking, progressive and honest farmer from a very remote village in Mosombor in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. This area is very fertile with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities. Julia is happily married and the proud mother of 3 children, and together they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs, milk and a variety of food crops that she grows on her farm. She also works in transportation and does some small business transactions in order to make ends meet. 

Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available. Therefore she is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to buy farm implements like good fertilizer and good quality seeds. Through this loan she will double her production and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming. This loan will help Julia to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Juanita is 50 years old, and has one child in school.

Juanita has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Juanita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional sheep for fattening and resale in order to increase her profits and to be able to pay for her son's higher education.

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.  Rosel has been in this business for 2 years. She earns more income from a barber shop.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 34 years old, married, and together with his spouse has been blessed with three children. He has a charcoal-selling business in Kitengela town and has been running this business for close to two years now. 

He will use this loan to buy charcoal to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of his family. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. In the future, he hopes to have a successful business and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is a flower vendor. She sells flowers like baby's breath, sunflowers and roses. She is 48 years old and has two children aged 17 and 15. Her husband is a farmer. He grows and sells rice. This will help augment the family's income. She has been in this kind of business for more than 10 years.  
 
Alfreda  has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy assorted fresh flowers like baby's breath, and to buy fertilizers. This will help Alfreda sell a variety of fresh flowers and eventually increase the harvest of her field.

Alfreda hopes to have a stable income to help ease their financial situation.

loans.use: to buy assorted fresh flowers like baby's breath and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is from Laguna, Philippines. She is married and has a child. She has been employed in a garment factory in Cavite for two years, through the help of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Covenant Community Service Cooperative.*

Mary Jane works as a sewer. She does the sewing and designing of clothing apparel according to the company's or clients' demands. She sews clothes using a sewing machine or other stitching machines and often does hand-stitching of edges and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Mary Jane, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Mary Jane is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in paying them back since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day.  She looks forward to your positive response and any upcoming amount from you will surely be of great help. She will also use the loan to pay for their housing expense.

Mary Jane hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills and quality jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring, and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, empowering the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for her housing expense.

loans.name: Raineria

texts.en:
Raineria is 44 years old and has five children. Raineria is a married woman.

Raineria is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Raineria has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Raineria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 42 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mercidita is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Mercidita has been doing this work for 10 years now.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина, 33 года, замужем, есть 2 сыновей. У Зарины среднее образование, уже 5 лет она занимается земледелием и животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Зарины есть земельный участок, где она выращивает клевер и есть 2 коровы, 1 бычок и 6 овец. Ежемесячный доход Зарины составляет в среднем 8,000 сомов (KGS). Зарина очень трудолюбива и ответственна, она является одним из трех членов группы "Айнура". Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит корову для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Зарине увеличить ее хозяйство и улучшить материальное состояние семьи.
texts.en:
Zarina is 33 years old, married, and she has two sons.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and has been involved in agriculture and animal husbandry for five years already.  She currently owns a plot of land on which she grows clover.  She also has two cows, one young bull and six sheep.  She makes an average monthly income of 8,000 som (KGS).

Zarina is very hardworking and responsible.  She is a member of the "Ainura" group which consists of a total of three people.  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) and will use this money to buy a cow to increase her cattle headcount.  The earnings from her loan will allow her to expand her farming business and will improve her family's material situation.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to increase her cattle headcount.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn and her husband catch crabs and fish for a living in Carles, Iloilo. This has been their business for 18 years now.  She is 38 years old.

Jenelyn would like to replace her torn fishing nets so that she and her husband can fish and increase their catch. However, she has limited funding. She is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy crabs from other fishermen, fishing nets and a boat engine. The income that they will generate will be used for family consumption and school fees for her seven children, ages three to 17.

Jenelyn dreams of seeing her children finish their studies and having a bright future.

loans.use: to buy crabs, fishing nets and a boat engine.

loans.name: Harlene

texts.en:
Harlene is 39 years old and a mother of four children between the ages of 5 and 19. For two decades, she and her husband have been involved in a fishing business to support their children. She would like to ensure that she can make the most out of her livelihood. Harlene is asking for a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy fishing nets, rope, nylon, nails, plywood, adhesive, and paints, and to pay for engine repair. With these items, she can be assured of continued fishing without delay and an increase in her output. 

Harlene dreams of seeing her children become educated professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, rope, nylon, nails, plywood, adhesive, and paints, and to pay for engine repair

loans.name: Santos Armando

texts.es:
El señor Santos Armando de 41 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposa y sus hijos, se dedica desde hace 9  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería y vive en la ciudad de Nacaome Valle, al sur de Honduras. Sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y también personas de las comunidades vecinas, el ofrece buena atención y buenos productos.
Don Santos Armando es un hombre emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para surtir su negocio de: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, manteca, huevos, pollo, papel higiénico, sardinas, agua en bolsa, etc.  Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y espera que esta inversión le permita lograrlo.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Santos Armando is 41 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and his children. He has been selling groceries for 9 years. He lives in the city of Nacaome Valle, south of Honduras.

His customers are his neighbors and people from the surrounding communities. He offers good customer service and good products.
Santos Armando is an enterprising man, he wishes to get ahead and he struggles every day to improve the quality of his life.

He is requesting the loan to supply his business with: rice, sugar, beans, lard, eggs, chicken, toilet paper, sardines, bottled water, etc.
His dream is to grow with his business to improve their lives. He hopes he can make it with this investment.

San Lorenzo, Honduras-

October 2014

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, lard, eggs, chicken, toilet paper, sardines, bottled water, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo cada quince días  se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 13 De Diciembre, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Teresa, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro mayores y una de 10 años que estudia en escuela,  dos de sus hijos  aun vive con ellos. Su marido es agricultor.
Doña Teresa con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto salir adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo  se dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, tiene un corral donde alimenta sus animalitos, los mismos que compra cuando están pequeños los mantiene por un tiempo y cuando están listos los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa o su hijo los lleva a vender por la ciudad, de esta forma ella se gana algo que les sirve para salir adelante ya que su marido con frecuencia no tiene trabajo.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los chanchos y pollos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le ayudan a salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
In Olmedo canton, the Credit Group "13 De Diciembre" meets each fortnight. The location is known for its beautiful landscapes and its hard-working people engaged in agriculture and raising animals.

Teresa lives here. She is 52 years old and married. She and her husband have five children, four who are grown-up and a 10 year-old daughter who is in school. Two children still live with them. Her husband is a farmer.

In order to earn her own money and get by, since her husband does not earn much by working in the fields, Teresa raises pigs and chickens. She has a pen where she feeds her young animals. She buys these animals when they are small, keeps them for a while and then when they are ready she either sells them to traders who come to her home or her son takes them to sell in the city. By doing this, she earns enough help them get by, since her husband often doesn't have work.

This loan is to buy food and medicine for the pigs and chickens. Teresa has been in the Credit Group from its start and likes it because the loans always help her get by. Her dream is to have good health for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy food and medicine for her pigs and chickens

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like canned goods, eggs, and sugar for her food vending business. Mercidita has been in this business for 3 years. She earns more income from buying and selling cellular phones and accessories.

Mercidita successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mercidita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like canned goods, eggs, and sugar.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Marjorie has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to maintain her fishing boat

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her buy-and-sell business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 30 years. She earns more income from farming vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college  in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Nandalala Group

texts.en:
Sudeshna is an inhabitant of Muniguda village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. The lady standing at third from left with raised hand in the photo is Sudeshna. She is 44 years old and resides with her husband, one son, and three daughters. 

The husband of Sudeshna has been running a bicycle and bicycle-repair shop for the last twelve years. He is a very good businessman. Sudeshna's  family income is about 8,000/- INR monthly. For the development of business, she is in need of financial support with an affordable cost. 

It will be her fourth cycle loan from Mahashakti foundation. The repayment behaviour of Sudeshna and her group is always on time. The other five members of the group are doing their own businesses. The other five members of the group are doing a dry food business, a leaf plate business, a tea stall, and a hotel.

From this loan, Sudeshna will support her husband in purchasing more bicycles as well as spare parts. This loan will definitely fetch more income to her family. Sudeshna’s dream is to provide a better education to her children for their better future.

loans.use: to purchase bicycles and spare parts

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 30-year-old married father of one child.  He has been employed in a special concrete manufacturing company since 2007.  In addition, he is currently managing his own entertainment center, where most of his fellow villagers enjoy visiting and experiencing several entertaining games.

Nabil is a hard worker, who is putting so much effort into developing his own business, so that one day he can quit his current job and work harder on developing his own career.  Today, Nabil is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a special hockey game which will attract more customers and increase his business income.  

As for the future, he is working hard to expand his business widely and to diversify his entertaining games as much as he can.

loans.use: to buy a special hockey game, which will attract more customers and increase his business income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: wheat flour, sugar, milk, eggs, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy works in a garment factory and he is aged 37. He lives in Carmona Cavite, Philippines with his wife and children. He has been in the service for two years through the aid of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Roy is one of the company drivers.  He drives the company vehicle during their shipping schedule over a designated route and ensures the safety and timely delivery of the factory’s output. 

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Roy is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Roy is asking for your assistance to prevent him from being exposed to any loan sharks. He has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and he had no problem in repaying it since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day.  He looks forward for your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. He will use the loan to pay for the educational expenses of his children.

Roy wants his children to complete their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay the school fees of his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy display cases for exhibiting products in her store.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gabriela is 55 years old and three of her children are in school.

Gabriela has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Gabriela requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of clothes, etc. to sell.

Gabriela has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Gabriela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of clothes, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell eggs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Marilou is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional trays of eggs to sell for her buy-and-sell eggs business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy eggs to sell

loans.name: Cerela

texts.en:
Cerela is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a direct-selling beauty products business in the Philippines. Cerela requested a PHP 1,800 loan amount through NWTF to a buy solar lamp.

Cerela has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has a retail shop in Mombasa town and has been running this business for 14 years now. She is 38 years old, married, and together with her spouse has been blessed with 3 children. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of maize flour, cereals and cooking oil for sell. She will be able to serve more customers and make more income which she will use to open a grocery shop. 

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. In future she hopes to open more businesses.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour, cereals, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats to raise and resell.

loans.name: Sabiniana

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sabiniana works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit farming business in the Philippines, and is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her fruit farming business.

Sabiniana has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru: Рузигул проживает на районе Вахш, недалеко от города Курган-Тюбе. Рузигул замужем и мать троих детей. Она живет вместе с мужем, двумя сыновьями, дочкой и невесткой. Рузигул около 7 лет занимается животноводством, куплей и продажей скотов. Ее муж бок в обок с женой трудиться на скотном дворе и зарабатывает на жизнь. Рузигул привыкла к своей работе, и хочет развивать животноводческую деятельность, чтобы привлечь больше дохода в семейный бюджет. Она просит кредит для купли несколько голов скотин, чтобы увеличить их поголовья и в скором времени увеличиться доходность.
texts.en: Ruzigul lives in the Vakhsh district, not far from the town of Kurgan Tube.  She is married and the mother of three children.  She lives with her husband, her two sons, her daughter, and one daughter-in-law.  She has been buying, raising, and selling livestock for almost seven years now.  She and her husband work side-by-side on the farm and they make a living together.  Ruzigul is used to her work and she wants to expand her animal husbandry activity in order to increase her income and the family's budget.  She is taking a loan to buy a few head of livestock and increase her herd and profits.

loans.use: to buy a few head of cattle.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher is a young and industrious man. He is 19 years old. Alisher lives and studies in the capital of Tajikistan. He is a student of the second course in the National University of Tajikistan. 

Alisher is one of the best students. He is always in searching for new information. He usually goes to the library and reads a lot of books. Also he uses the internet to find some books and tasks. 

Alisher is not married and lives with his parents. His parents have no opportunity to pay for his tuition now. So he is asking for a loan to pay tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay university tuition

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Editha has been in the business for more than eight years now. 

She is asking for a loan  to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, coffee, sugar, biscuits, and snack foods. Editha is positive that this loan will help her in improving her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, coffee, sugar, biscuits, and snack foods

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 50-year-old married father of three children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He has worked for thirty years in construction, specializing in cement, to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Due to the low social and financial situations of refugees in Lebanon, especially those who live in a camp, Mohammad is trying desperately to improve his family's living conditions; thus he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate his house by building a necessary cement wall. 

This loan will help him make his house a better and healthier place for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Heremakono Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Heremakono vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 38ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Moussokorobougou de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment, de restauration et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Safiatou (la 3eme femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galette à base de sauce dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de mil à Moussokorobougou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Safiatou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 18 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The seven women who make up the Heremakono group all live in traditional families.  On average, they are 38 years old and have five children each.  They all live in the Moussokorobougou village of the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through family, neighborhood and marriage ties, and also through their income-generating activities in the village.  They sell condiments and grains, and also prepare meals.  In order to increase their businesses, the members of the group have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, and they are now on their second cycle of solidarity loan.

Safiatou (standing third from the right in the photo) is an important seller of "galettes" (flat cakes) served with sauce, in her village and its surroundings.  She is planning to use her loan to buy two bags of millet in Moussokorobougou.  She sells her galettes for cash but also often on credit at home and at the market.  Her customers are both men and women.  Thanks to this loan, Safiatou is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 18,000 CFA francs, which will be used to cover her children's daily needs and also to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy two bags of millet in order to make "galettes".

loans.name: Cherry Ann

texts.en:
Cherry Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her vulcanizing shop business.

Cherry Ann has been in this business for two years. Cherry Ann earns more income from selling pre-paid mobile load.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Cherry Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Agriculture has always played a core role in East Africa. The major type of farming is subsistence farming which is done mainly on a small scale to feed a family. The big problem in Barsombe, a rural village in the North Rift region of Kenya, is that men leave the rural areas in search of better work prospects. This leaves women, like Rael (pictured), with no option but to take over the traditional male roles in farming. 

Rael, a mother of seven, is an active, plump, dark Kalenjin woman who has been running a mixed farm for a decade. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry for milk and eggs. She also grows various crop varieties, including vegetables. She is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow and grow her horticulture business. 

She is going to use your loan not only to purchase a dairy cow that will produce more milk to sell, but also to grow various crops in larger quantities in order to meet the demand in the market. Your loan investment will mean the world to Rael since she is not in a position to raise the money due to her highest monthly expense--farming related costs. Your loan will help Rael to grow her business and afford a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a resident of Muntinlupa, Philippines. She has children, and she is working in a garment factory. She became employed through the assistance of Covenant Community Service Cooperative.*

Gemma is a Roving Quality Control Officer. She inspects garments, such as men's denim bottoms, during manufacturing operations, to determine the number of defects per worker and reasons for rejects by examiners. She counts the number of pattern parts, layers of cloth prior to cutting, stitches per inch during sewing operations, and collects other measurement knowledge.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Gemma, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. Also they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders. Money lenders capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards, as loan collateral.

For this reason, Gemma is asking for your assistance -- to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative, and she had no problem in returning it back since the loan payment is deducted every payday. She looks forward to your positive response, and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay the school fees of her child who is a college student.

Gemma wants her children to finish their schooling. She meets up with her co-fellowship members** every week, to share stories of her work.


*The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force, trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The [CCS] Cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

**CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers, before they start their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay the tuition of her child who is studying in college.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Fe works hard to support her family. She has a business, selling vegetables in the Philippines.

Fe is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase vegetables to sell, for her vegetable-vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a married woman, and she has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 38 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Marina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase fish nets, and other materials to use in her business.

She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marina would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets, and other materials to use in her fishing business.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
At 23 years of age, Jona is used to working hard. She does this for the sake of her three children, ages one to three. She is also committed to helping her husband in their fishing business. She lives in Carles, Iloilo, with her family.

She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fishing nets, floaters, nylon and ropes, which are important in their fishing. They need to replace the old ones, because of wear and tear.

Jona is optimistic about her future. She hope that someday she will be able to send her children to school. She also plans to expand her business, so she will be able to give her family a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, floaters, nylon and ropes.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is 36 years old, married, and, together her spouse, has been blessed with six children. She has a retail business in Mombasa town, and it has been profitable.

She will use this loan to buy more stock, specifically, retail goods such as radios, light torches, shawls, and sewing materials. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more goods to sell, again.

This is her sixth loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and she repaid her previous loans successfully. In future, she hopes to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, such as radios, light torches, shawls, and sewing materials

loans.name: Tuliya Group

texts.fr: Roseline est commerçante, membre d’une banque villageoise «Tuliya», âgée de 29 ans, mariée a un taximan moto, mère de 4 enfants dont 3 étudient et 1 est encore gosse. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale sa marchandise à son domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu  de son mari. Il y a 1 an qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 sacs mais et 2 sacs sorghos. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Roseline is a retailer and a member of the Tuliya village bank.  She is 29 years old, married to a motorcycle taxi driver, and the mother of four children.  Three of her children are in school, the youngest is still very small.  Roseline sells food products.  She displays her goods in front of her home, located on one of the town's busy streets.  She started this business one year ago with some money received from her husband.  This new loan will be used to buy three bags of maize and two bags of sorghum.  Roseline would like to be able to clothe and feed her children, and also pay their school fees.  She is very thankful to Hekima for empowering women entrepreneurs who do not have access to the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy three bags of maize and two bags of sorghum.

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille is 29 years old, and has six children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Cecille runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and shampoo. Cecille has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and shampoo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start building his house with quality materials.

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Babylyn is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Babylyn has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Elida, 40, is in a relationship, has two children, and lives in her own home in a rural area of the Nueva Arica district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Her community depends primarily on farming, ranching, and business.

Elida makes a living raising and selling poultry. She has had this business for 14 years, and it’s located in her home. She’s requesting this loan to gain working capital and to buy goats, ducks, chickens, and turkeys. This loan will help her have a larger investment, with the goal of growing her business and satisfying her customers’ needs. In the short term, this loan will help her to improve her income, increase earnings, and therefore improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to gain working capital and to buy goats, ducks, chickens, and turkeys.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay a degree course that will allow her the opportunity to obtain better income and she will be able to help other people with her knowledge.

loans.name: Turahoja

texts.en: Turahoja is 19 years old and lives with his parents. He is a student at Technology University in Tajikistan. Turahoja is smart and very hardworking. He is learning IT systems at the University and is doing well. Turahoja always helps his friends who need his help, so his friends care for him very much. Turahoja is asking for a loan to pay for his tuition. He believes Kiva lenders are the only option he has for financial assistance. He awaits your help and thanks you in advance for your loan.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Eustiquia

texts.en:
Eustiquia is 64 years old and has three children. She is a married woman.

Eustiquia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eustiquia has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eustiquia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 53 years old. He is married to Jullie, and together they have been blessed with two children. Jullie is a farmer and provides additional income for her family.

Samuel runs a butchery but now has decided to diversify into farming, just like his wife. He has therefore requested his fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan of 50,000 KES to buy tomato seedlings for planting. He will also buy fertilizers and pesticides, as well as pay laborers. He successfully repaid his previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, Samuel will be able to secure enough income and continue to expand his farming business.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to buy a piece of land and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To plant tomatoes and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Elder

texts.es:
Elder tiene 21 años de edad, vive en casa de familia, con padres y dos hermanos menores que él, viven en armonía familiar; vive en casa de material rustico un piso, Elder es nacido en caserío el Pueblo lo Hizo; vive en en comunión con los miembros de su centro poblado menor, vive en la parte rural del centro poblado menor Tambillo Distrito santo Tomas; vive en una comunidad dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua.

La actividad que realiza Elder es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 has. Variedad catimor, plantación tiene tres años de edad, esta en primer y segundo año de producción y para 2015 estará en segundo y tercer año de producción; tiene terreno agrícola propio donde esta parcela de café, actividad la realiza hace 04 años en centro pablado menor Distrito santo Tomas, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café; producto lo vende en distrito santo Tomas a compradores de la zona. Adicionalmente Elder se dedica a la actividad pecuaria cría de ganado vacuno y también al cultivo y productos de pan llevar todo esto lo realiza en terreno en centro poblado menor Tambillo distrito santo Tomas. El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento de 1 has. de café en producción, con ello asegurara mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elder, age 21, lives in the family house with his parents and two younger siblings.  They live in familial harmony in a one story house made from basic materials.  Elder was born in the Pueblo lo Hizo settlement.  He lives in fellowship with the members of his small community.  He lives in the rural part of the small community of Tambillo in the Santo Tomas district.  He lives in a community that devotes itself basically to agriculture and livestock.  His house has water service.

Elder’s business activity is growing coffee.  To date he has one hectare of the Catimor variety that was planted three years ago.  It is in its first and second year of production.  In the year 2015 it will be in its second and third year of production.  He has his agricultural land where his coffee is.  He has been doing this for four years in his community in the Santo Tomas district.  

He has experience in the field of growing coffee.  He sells the product in the Santo Tomas district to buyers in the area.  Additionally, Elder is involved in raising cattle.  He also grows food crops.  He does all of this on land in the small community of Tambillo in the Santo Tomas district.

The loan is for the maintenance of one hectare of coffee in production.  This will assure him of greater and better production during the 2015 season.  He will, therefore, get greater income in order to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on one hectare of coffee in production.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Gemma is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz, una sonriente, inteligente y mucha luchadora mujer de 48 años de edad que se levanta diariamente a atender su negocio de venta de accesorios y productos varios como pañales, artesanías, productos de la canasta familiar etc. Una tienda muy variada que ha ido acoplando de acuerdo a las necesidades de sus clientes y que le ha permitido mantenerse en estos 4 años que lleva de operación.
Es una mujer casada con 3 hijos don de ellos menores de edad y el último mayor de edad. 
Luz buscando ser cada vez más competitiva, mejorar su ventas, incrementar su ganancia para poder pagar la educación universitaria de sus hijos, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda le gustaría pedir un auxilio monetario para la compra de surtido vario entre la variedad de productos anteriormente mencionados.
texts.en:
Luz, a smiling, intelligent, and very tenacious 48 year old woman, gets up every day to tend to her business of selling accessories and various products like diapers, handicrafts, and basic needs items, etc.  It is a store with a lot of variety that has been meeting the needs of her customers.  This has allowed her to keep the business in operation for these four years.

She is married and has three children.  Two of them are minors, and one is an adult.

Luz is looking to be more and more competitive, to improve her sales, and to increase her earnings in order to be able to pay for her children’s university education and to improve the condition of her house. 

She would like to ask for help in order to buy varied stock such as the products mentioned above.

loans.use: to buy women's accessories, diapers, handicrafts, and basic needs items.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She lives with her family in Leyte, Philippines. 

Marina runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her locality. Marina is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice, canned goods, biscuits and snack foods, condiments, soap and detergents, and shampoo and toiletries. 

With this loan, Marina will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to attract more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice, canned goods, biscuits and snack foods, condiments, soap and detergents, and shampoo and toiletries.

loans.name: Ma. Grace

texts.en:
Ma. Grace is 42 years old and hails from Iloilo, Philippines. She is married with four children, ages four to seventeen.

Together with her husband, she has been engaged in fishing for eighteen years now. The income has been instrumental in raising her family. Ma. Grace is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets, an engine, nylon, and ropes. Once this is taken care of, she will be focusing on other means to make their fishing productive.

Ma. Grace hopes to have another income-generating business someday, so her family can live in comfort.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, an engine, nylon, and rope.

loans.name: Julieta Sofia

texts.es:
Julieta Sofia tiene 58 años de edad, es conviviente, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Julieta Sofia se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, cuyes con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para compra de un número mayor de animales, pues desea aumentar y diversificar sus stock de animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Julieta Sofia piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julieta Sofia, 58, is in a relationship, she doesn’t have children, and she lives with her family in a rural area in the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Her community depends primarily on farming, ranching, and business.

Julieta Sofia makes a living raising and selling animals such as ducks, roosters, chickens, and guinea pigs. She has over 20 years of experience in this business, which is located in her home. She is requesting this loan to buy livestock wholesale to increase and diversify her stock of animals. This investment will help her have a better variety and productivity with her animals. Julieta Sofia plans to increase her stock of animals to attend to the diverse preferences and needs of her customers in the area. In the short term, this loan will help her to improve her income, increase earnings, and therefore improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock wholesale to increase and diversify her stock of animals.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 28 years old, married, and has two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Maricel has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 42 years old and has one child who is in school. She is a married woman.

Minda is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Minda has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Minda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of three dependents between the ages of 6 and 17. She and her family reside in Carles, Iloilo.  Herminia has been engaged in fishing and catching crabs for 22 years now. Her husband is also in this business. She is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fishing nets and gill nets. They work hard for the needs of their family. Through this loan, they will be able to enhance their daily catch, giving them more fish and crabs to sell in the market. Herminia dreams of improving their livelihood and saving money for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and gill nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sustain and maintain his cacao plants

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is from Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Marcelo, and they have two children. She has been employed at a garment factory in Cavite for almost two years through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Imelda is a clothing presser. She presses fabrics or garments during the production process (known as under-pressing) as well in the final stages of production (usually in a garment-finishing department). Sometimes, she helps in the sewing process and other production processes if necessary.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Imelda is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses; they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Imelda is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative, and she had no problem in paying them back, since the loan payment is being deducted every payday. She looks forward to your positive response, and any coming amount from you will surely be of great help. She will also use the loan for the payment of formal documentation of their land rights.

Imelda wants to operate her own business in the future. She hopes to give her children the best education possible. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, to cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for formal documentation of land rights.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 54 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loans and now has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Evelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Delfa Piedad

texts.es:
Delfa es una persona humilde que vive en san miguel provincia de bolívar en la comunidad pucara, pertenece a la ventanilla rural la nueva esperanza, ella no cuenta con un trabajo estable y tiene que mantener a su hijo de 10 años, es madre soltera y solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos y abonospara sembrar maíz y frejol  y obtener una buena producción para así solventar los gastos de su familia necesitan para en diario vivir. Realiza las compras en san pablo semana, su sueño es comprarse un terreno para aumentar sus sembrios. 
En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión y atender a sus hijos, le gusta el carnaval y la navidad que son costumbres de su comunidad en donde puede realizar trabajos extras y obtener más dinero para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Delfa is a humble person who lives in San Miguel, Bolívar province, in the Pucara community.  She belongs to the Nueva Esperanza [New Hope] rural bank.  She doesn’t have a stable job and she has to provide for her ten-year-old son.  She is a single mother and is asking for a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers to plant corn and beans and to get a good harvest in order to pay off the daily living expenses of her family.  She makes her purchases in San Pablo each week.

Her dream is to buy a plot of land to increase her plantings.  In her free time she likes to watch television and take care of her children.  She likes Carnaval and Christmas, which are traditional holidays in her community, when she can get extra work and more money for her children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an awning for his vehicle, since it’s the rainy season and he wants to offer the best service possible to his customers.

loans.name: Juana Graciela

texts.es:
Juana Graciela tiene 34 años de edad de estado civil, es Conviviente, vive en Morropón junto a su conyuge y un hijo menor de edad, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios como agua,luz, cable, etc. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Juana Graciela es la venta de animales menores (pollos, patos, cuyes, etc) en su domicilio, además tiene un punto de venta de dulces (bocadillo, alfeñiques, y mieles) y comida los dias sábados y domingo en el mercado de Morropón actividades que realiza hace más de 6 años, contando con clientela fija además de tener ingresos por la venta de comida (tamales y horneado. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en capital de trabajo, pues ella comprará alimento balanceado para pavos, por estar cerca a temporada navideña el cual tendran precio oportuno para fiestas navideñas. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas ya que pobladores de la zona estan trabajando en empresas formales. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Graciela is 34 years old and lives in Morropón with her partner and a son who is a minor. It is a place where the people work in agriculture, livestock raising, and commerce. It has services such as water, electricity, cable TV, etc. This community is located in the district and province of Morropón, in the Piura region on the north coast of Peru.

Juana Graciela's business is selling small animals (chickens, turkeys, guinea pigs, etc.) from her home. In addition, she has a sales location where she sells sweets (snacks, candies, and honeys) and food on Saturdays and Sundays in the Morropón market. She has had these businesses for more than 6 years and has regular customers, in addition to having income from the sale of food (tamales and baked items). The purpose of the loan will be to invest in working capital, since she will buy balanced feed for turkeys, because it is close to the Christmas season, when they will have a favorable price for Christmas celebrations. The market presents good perspectives, since the people of the zone are working in formal businesses. In the short tern, this will allow her to improve her income and increase her earnings, and in the end improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her turkeys

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell for her business.

Gilda has been in this business for 20 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is 37 years old and married with two children; both of them are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Maureen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like condiments, cigarettes and beverages.

Maureen has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like condiments, cigarettes and beverages.

loans.name: Eli Jonatan

texts.es:
Eli, ve que su negocio está mejorando con la inversión del crédito anterior, su negocio ya es más amplio y le genera mejores ingresos, de esta manera su capacidad de pago es mucho mayor y la familia tiene óptimas condiciones de vida.
Requiere un nuevo préstamo, ya que se presenta la oportunidad mejorar su equipo de trabajo, comprara una cámara de filmación con tecnología avanzada, lo que le será de ayuda para hacer más fácil su trabajo y con mejor calidad, espera mantener la continuidad de su progreso.
texts.en:
Eli sees that his business is improving with the investment of his previous loan.  His business is already bigger and generating more income.  In this way his earning capacity is much greater and his family has optimal living conditions.

He needs a new loan because he has been presented with an opportunity to improve his equipment.  He will buy a film camera with advanced technology, which will be a help to him by making his work easier and of higher quality.  He hopes to keep up his progress.

loans.use: to buy a film camera with advanced technology

loans.name: Ashfaq

texts.en:
Ashfaq is a 39-year-old man, residing in Lalamusa, Gujrat, Pakistan. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is a father of three children. He has been doing his own business of cattle farming for many years; he is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family and to manage the household.

Ashfaq wants to purchase animals for his business purposes but due to financial constraints he is unable to purchase these cattle.

Therefore Ashfaq has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business, and this will also be good for him to earn maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance Ashfaq is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cattle for his cattle farming business

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga tiene 62 años de edad, su estado civil es Conviviente, vive en el caserio Zapotal del distrito Morropón junto a su cónyuge y no tenie carga familiar. La comunidad donde viven es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio, cuenta con servicios como agua, luz, cable. Y está ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Dominga es la venta de abarrotes por menor, ella tiene una bodega en su domicilio, además de tener como ingresos adicionalmente su conyuge tiene ingresos por agricultura. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en capital de trabajo comprará arroz, azucar, abarrotes para surtir mejor negocio y asi mejorar sus ventas. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas ya que pobladores de la zona estan trabajando en empresas formales.Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Dominga is 62 years old.  She is in a live-in relationship, living with her partner in the Zapotel neighborhood of the Morropón district.  She doesn’t have other family responsibilities.  The community where she lives is a place where the people work in agriculture, ranching, and trade.  It has utilities such as electricity, water, and cable, and is located in the Morropón district and province in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

Dominga’s job is retail grocery sales.  She has a store in her home.  She also has some additional income from her partner, who is in agriculture.  The plan for her loan is to invest it as working capital in the purchase of rice, sugar, and groceries to better stock her business and thus improve her sales.  Her shop has good potential because the people living in that area work in formal businesses, which allows her to improve her income in a short time, increasing her earnings and, in the end, improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and groceries to better stock her business and, in that way, to improve her sales.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is a 46-year-old married woman from the town of Carles in Iloilo. She is married with four children ages 8-18. For 15 years, she and her husband have relied on fishing and catching crabs to earn a living. This entails hard work and perseverance, specially during seasons when there is a typhoon that will not allow them to fish. Ma. Teresa is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, nylon, ropes, floaters and fishing weights to replace the old ones. 

Ma. Teresa's income will be utilized for food, school fees and savings. In the future, she hope to expand her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, nylon, ropes, floaters and fishing weights

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing net for her fishing business.

Adoracion has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Adoracion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 23 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Michelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages and eggs. She has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages and eggs.

loans.name: Maria Carmen Silvia

texts.es:
Maria se encuentra soltera y tiene 2 hijos a quienes les garantiza una buena calidad de vida gracias a su negocio con el cual generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente para que en su hogar mejoren las condiciones económicas y puedan tener una buena calidad de vida. 

Desde hace más de 10 años comenzó a trabajar vendiendo Libros en su propio almacén y gracias a un gran esfuerzo que hizo logró ubicarse dentro de un local y allí tiene su negocio. 

Debido a que sus clientes están aumentando y cada vez demandan más libros, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de libros.

De esta manera su negocio saldrá adelante y podrá ofrecer en su hogar unos buenos ingresos para que sigan teniendo una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maris is single and has two children, to whom she guarantees a good quality of life thanks to her business, with which she generates income to contribute economically so that the economic conditions in her household will improve and they can have a good quality of life.

She began to work more than 10 years ago, selling books in her own store. Thanks to a great effort that she made, she managed to locate herself inside a building, and there she has her business.

Due to the fact that her customers are increasing and ask for more books every time, Maria is seeking a loan to buy a stock of books.

In this way her business will advance and she will be able to offer some good income to her household so that they can continue having a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a stock of books for her business.

loans.name: Naveed

texts.en:
Naveed is a 36-year-old man residing in Lalamusa, Gujrat, Pakistan. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is a father of three children. He has been doing his own business of rice cultivation for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and supporting the household.

Naveed wants to purchase seeds and other cultivation accessories for his agriculture business, but due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase them. Therefore, Naveed has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy these agricultural goods to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also help him to earn maximum income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance, Naveed is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy seeds and other cultivation goods for his rice cultivation business.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel tiene 53 años de edad, es casado, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Juan Manuel se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 11 años de experiencia, Juan Manuel ofrece sus servicios en su distrito y alrededores, él solicita préstamo para compra de insumos agrícolas y para mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, para poder asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de sus herramientas, además de darle un valor agregado a su servicio, con gran influencia en el negocio; Juan Manuel piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is 53 years old. He is married, without children, and lives with his family in a rural zone of the district of Chiclayo, in the province of Chiclayo and the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru. His community basically works in agriculture, livestock raising, and commerce.

Jual Manuel offers his services as a day worker, with his own tools and more than 11 years of experience. Juan Manuel offers his services in the district and its surroundings. He is applying for a loan to buy agricultural supplies and to maintain his equipment and tools. This investment will serve him to have his equipment and tools in better condition in order to assure the correct functioning of his tools. In addition, it will give an added value to his service, with a great influence on his business. Juan Manuel is thinking of improving the productivity of his services and thus being able to serve the various needs of his customers in the zone.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to maintain his equipment and tools

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Josephine is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials such as a fishing net and gasoline for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as a fishing net and gasoline

loans.name: Yousaf

texts.en:
Yousaf is a 39-year-old man residing in Lalamusa, Gujrat, Pakistan. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is a father of six children. He has been doing his own business of rice cultivation for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and supporting the household.

Yousaf wants to purchase seeds and other cultivation accessories for his agriculture business, but due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Yousaf has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy these agricultural goods to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also help him to earn maximum income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance, Yousaf is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy seeds and other accessories for his rice cultivation business.

loans.name: Rodriga

texts.en:
Rodriga is a 39-year-old married woman residing in Leyte, Philippines. She has one dependent. Rodriga has a small sari-sari or retail store in which she sells different kinds of goods, from food to other items. This is her main means of income. Rodriga is a very hardworking woman. 

As of now, she wants to expand her business. Rodriga is requesting a loan to buy more stock for her store such as noodles, rice, candies, biscuits, chips, canned goods, soap, detergents, shampoo, and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. Rodriga hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store such as noodles, rice, candies, biscuits, chips, canned goods, soap, detergents, shampoo, and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put a new roof on her house

loans.name: Fazliddin

texts.en: Fazliddin was born in 1995. He has dreamed since childhood to be an engineer. He studied in school successfully. Fazliddin, after graduating school, has applied to the National University of Tajikistan. He studies at the Faculty of Management and Economics. He tries to get a high quality education so he can be the best specialist after graduating university. Fazliddin is asking for a loan because he must pay for university tuition. He awaits your mercy and in advance thanks Kiva lenders for mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.en: Musharaf is married and has three children. She always tries to offer them a good quality of life. So, she decided to start a new business buying and selling dried fruits in order to generate an income to contribute to her home’s finances. She took the course "To Get Ahead" from a women's organization and learned new business skills.  Her children will help her with the business. She will buy dried fruits in bulk and sell them in a local market. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy dried fruits for her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits for her new business

loans.name: Saadani Group

texts.en:
Regina, who is in her early 60s, is married with six children; two of them are still in college and the other four are grown-up. She has been running several projects, including selling water, sodas and juice and keeping chickens (layers) for laying eggs. She works from 6am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Regina's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase stock on sodas, water, and juice, and bought chicks and chicken feed. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.
