She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, built her house and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to open a grocery store. She dreams of improving her lifestyle.

Regina will share this loan with her loan group, Saadani, which has a total of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha una panadera, muy batalladora, capaz, sobresaliente que ha desempeñado a lo largo de su vida el papel de madre y padre pues es una Mujer cabeza de familia que ningún reto le ha quedado grande y ahora con su panadería está buscando el equilibrio económico que le permita brindarle un apoyo incondicional a sus hijos para que puedan estudiar y luchar por una mejor vida. 
Es madre de 2 hijos de 4 y 20 años de edad.
Quiere solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de enseres, y activos fijos para mejorar la atención como mesas, sillas y artículos para la elaboración de panes, esperando poder mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, incrementar su utilidad y posicionar su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha is a baker.  She is a feisty and capable person who, most importantly, has served most of her life as both mother and father to her children.  This is because Martha is the head of her household, and no challenge has been too big for her.  Now, with her bakery, she is seeking a financial equilibrium which will allow  her to provide unconditional support to her children so that they can study and strive for a better life.

Martha has 2 children, aged 4 and 20. She wants a loan to invest in the purchase of equipment and fixed assets to improve her service, such as tables, chairs and supplies to make bread.  She is hoping to increase her sales, expand her customer base, increase her profits, and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, a 41-year-old  merchant, engages in operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, beverages, spices and toiletries. 

She is married and has two children, ages 9 and 8 years old, respectively. 

Violeta has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy various stock like canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, toiletries and a new refrigerator. With these, Violeta can now display a variety of goods that would cater to a huge number of consumers. Thus, she could afford to pay for nutritious diets and pay for school fees as well.

Violeta is hoping to expand her business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy various stock like canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, toiletries and a new refrigerator

loans.name: Larasab

texts.en:
Larasab is a 41-year-old man residing in Lalamusa, Gujrat, Pakistan. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is a father of three children. 

He has been doing his own business of cattle farming for many years; he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and managing the household.

Larasab wants to purchase animals for his business purpose, but due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase these cattle. Therefore, Larasab has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business; this will also be good for him to earn maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance, Larasab is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cattle for his cattle farming business.

loans.name: Baber

texts.en:
Baber is a 30-year-old farmer and borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is a father of a son and is the responsible person for managing the entire household. 

Baber has been doing his own cultivation business for many years; he cultivates different kinds of crops and sells his yield to a wholesale dealer.
 
Baber needs to buy different kinds of tools and other agricultural goods for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to buy these accessories. Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, he can purchase his business relevant accessories to fulfill his business needs.

For this financial aid, Baber is very happy and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural goods and other relevant accessories for his agro business purpose.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like wood, bamboo, etc for her fishing business. Lenie has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and has now requested another loan to further build her business.

Lenie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like wood, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani lives with her parents in Armavir town. She has run a flower store for already three years, with the help of her mother. The family also runs a clothing store in the center of city. Generally, Ani's father takes care of the store, but as he has migrated to Russia for a better job, Ani has to take care of two stores. 

The requested loan is very important for Ani to purchase a new conditioning system for the flower store and new supplies of clothing for the clothing store. 

This young lady relies on the lenders' support to gather the needed amount of financial resources and to continue her family's hard work.

loans.use: to pay for a new conditioning system for the flower store and new supplies of clothing for the clothing store

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.es:
Geraldine: Geraldine tiene 23 años y nació en Cali, Valle, población ubicada en el sur-occidente de Colombia. Es la hija mayor de su familia, su hermano menor acaba de terminar su carrera profesional, su madre es ama de casa y su padre trabaja como mecánico industrial. A pesar de las dificultades económicas que tuvieron, Geraldine logró terminar su carrera profesional en Química en la Universidad del Valle, obteniendo el título profesional en Junio del 2013. 
El principal objetivo que tiene Geraldine, es poder realizar un doctorado en Cristalografía en una universidad en el exterior, y para lograrlo necesita solicitar el apoyo de Kiva, puesto que es la única forma para poder cubrir los gastos de exámenes de idioma y aplicación a las universidades. Una vez realice su maestría y regrese a Colombia, Geraldine anhela poder trabajar como docente de universidad y poder trabajar este tema que es tan poco común en el país y seguir aportando a la investigación y a la generación de conocimiento desde la universidad. 
Aquí está su historia: 
La investigación en ciencias básicas y el desarrollo tecnológico es una de las principales estrategias que un país debe implementar en orden de superar sus  índices de pobreza y violencia. Nuestro país actualmente está haciendo un gran esfuerzo por superar estas problemáticas, sin embargo la calidad de su investigación no es comparable con la desarrollada en los países del primer mundo debido a diferentes factores económicos.  Mi objetivo como profesional colombiana es realizar mis estudios postdoctorales en estados unidos  pues este país posee la tecnología más avanzada en el campo en el cual deseo especializarme, el cual es cristalografía de proteínas.
Desde mi pregrado he tenido la oportunidad de trabajar en cristalografía gracias a diferentes convenios que mi tutor tiene con diferentes universidades en Brasil e Inglaterra y que nos permitían medir las  muestras que sintetizábamos en el laboratorio. Ahora que deseo aplicar a un postgrado deseo enfocarme en cristalografía de proteínas la cual es una técnica analítica que permite dar a conocer la estructura química y física de las proteínas. La importancia de esta técnica radica en que es vital conocer la proteínas estructuralmente con el objetivo de entender su funcionamiento y a si prevenir o curar diferentes enfermedades. Lastimosamente  en Colombia esta técnica no está implementada debido a  que el país no cuenta con el difractometro de rayos X y el difractometro de neutrones  que son los equipos que permiten tomar las mediciones. 
A parte de que  un posgrado en el exterior  me permitirá adquirir madurez profesional y personal, esta maestría me brindara la oportunidad de convivir en una cultura diferente a la propia y de compartir con colegas de diferentes partes del globo. Realizar una maestría en una de las mejores universidades del mundo es una experiencia inolvidable y me dará las credenciales necesarias para obtener un trabajo académico en el campo investigativo en mi país, desde donde podré contar con las herramientas y el conocimiento necesario para impulsar la investigación en ciencia básica y especialmente expandir el estudio cristalográfico aquí en Colombia.
El crédito kiva juega un rol importante en el proceso de inscripción a las diferentes  universidades, pues este momento no poseo la solvencia para cubrir todos los gastos económicos que un proceso de este calibre requiere y como todas las universidades tienen un deadline especifico requiero empezar a preparar la aplicación desde ahora para no pasarme de las fechas y tener que aplazar un año más mi maestría.
texts.en:
Geraldine: Geraldine is 23 years old and was born in Cali, Valle, a town located in the southwest of Colombia. She is the oldest daughter of her family. Her younger brother just finished his professional program. Her mother is a housewife, and her father works as an industrial mechanic. In spite of the economic difficulties that they had, Geraldine managed to finish her professional program in chemistry at the University of Valle, obtaining her professional degree in June of 2013. 

Geraldine's principal goal is to be able to complete a doctoral degree in crystallography at a foreign university, and to achieve this, she needs to apply for support from Kiva, since this is the only way she will be able to cover the expenses of the language exams and applications to the universities. Once she completes her training and returns to Colombia, Geraldine dreams of being able to work as a teacher at a university and being able to work in this area, which is so uncommon in the country, and continue supporting research and the generation of knowledge at the university.

Here is her story:

Research in basic sciences and technological development is one of the principal strategies that a country needs to implement in order to improve its indices of poverty and violence. Our country is now making a great effort to overcome these difficulties. Nevertheless, the quality of research is not comparable with that developed in the countries of the first world, due to different economic factors. My goal as a professional Colombian woman is to complete my post-doctoral education in the United States, since this country has the most advanced technology in the field in which I want to specialize, which is the crystallography of proteins.

Since my undergraduate education, I have had the opportunity to work in crystallography, thanks to various agreements that my tutor has with different universities in Brazil and England and that allowed us assess the samples that we were synthesizing in the laboratory. Now that I want to apply for a graduate program, I want to focus on the crystallography of proteins, which is an analytical technique that allows the chemical and physical structure of the proteins to be known. The importance of this technique is rooted in the fact that it is vital to know proteins structurally with the goal of understanding their function and thus how they prevent or cure different diseases. Unfortunately, this technique is not implemented in Colombia due to the fact that the country doesn't have X-ray diffraction and neutron diffraction, which are the tools that allow the measurements to be taken.

Apart from the fact that a graduate degree abroad will allow me to acquire professional and personal maturity, this education will offer me the opportunity to live in a culture different from my own and to share with colleagues from different parts of the globe. To complete a master's in one of the best universities of the world is an unforgettable experience, and it will give me the necessary credentials to obtain an academic job in the research field in my country, where I will be able to have the tools and the knowledge necessary to drive research in basic sciences and especially to expand crystallographic study here in Colombia.

The Kiva loan plays an important role in the process of applying to different universities, since at this time I don't have the solvency to cover all the economic costs that a process of this importance requires. And since all the universities have a specific deadline, I need to begin to prepare the applications starting now, so that the dates don't pass and make me postpone my training for one more year.

loans.use: To apply for a doctoral program in crystallography

loans.name: Javed

texts.en:
Javed is a 37-year-old man residing in Lalamusa, Gujrat, Pakistan. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is a father of five children. He has been doing his own business of milk selling for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and managing the household.

Javed wants to purchase an animal for his business purpose to produce milk, but due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase this cattle.

Therefore, Javed has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy this cattle to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also be good for him to earn maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance, Javed is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for producing milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the floor, door, and windows of his house

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc for her general store business.

Vilma has been in this business for 11 years. Vilma earns more income from pig fattening.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en: Kouser, 54 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store with her son, who is also shown in the photo. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Kouser needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.name: Aftab

texts.en:
Aftab is a 25 year old man, residing in Lalamusa, Gujrat, Pakistan. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He has been doing his own business of dairy farming for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and managing the household.

Aftab wants to purchase an animal for his business but due to financial constraints he is unable to purchase cattle. Therefore Aftab has requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy the cattle to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also enable him to earn the maximum profitable income derived from his business.

Aftab is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy cattle for producing milk to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children, aged one and five. She is from Carles, Iloilo. Jacqueline has been engaged in the fishing business for more than two years now. Her husband works as a fisherman too. Jacqueline is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. It really pays to use new and sturdy nets. It helps to have an increase in their catch. Jacqueline dreams of improving their livelihood and saves money for the schooling of her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more household goods to sell for her general store business.

Rowena has been in this business for 3 years. Rowena earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish and rice retailing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell.

loans.name: Sulman

texts.en:
Sulman is an active borrower of Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. He has been running an egg selling business for many years. He is married and lives in Lalamusa, Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a father of two children. 

Sulman wants to buy eggs in bulk from poultry farms for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to buy the eggs. Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan he will be able to buy the eggs to resell and expand his business. This will allow him to earn maximum profit and make savings to fulfill his business needs in future. 

Sulman is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy eggs from poultry farms to resell.

loans.name: Iftikhar

texts.en:
Iftikhar is a 22 year old man, residing in Lalamusa, Gujrat, Pakistan. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He has been doing his own business of dairy farming for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and managing the household.

Iftikhar wants to purchase cattle for producing milk to sell, but due to financial constraints he is unable to purchase the cattle.
Therefore Iftikhar has requested a Kiva loan from the field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy the cattle to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also enable him to earn the maximum profitable income derived from his business.

Iftikhar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy cattle for producing milk to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe (restaurant/café).

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
Arshad is a 33 year old man, residing in Lalamusa, Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a father of a son. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He has been doing his own business of rice cultivation for many years, he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and for managing the household.

Arshad wants to purchase seeds and other cultivation accessories for his agriculture business but due to financial constraints he is unable to purchase these accessories.

Therefore Arshad has requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy these agricultural goods to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also enable him to earn the maximum profitable income derived from his business.

Arshad is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other cultivation accessories for his business.

loans.name: Antofagasta Group

texts.es:
Nieves es una mujer de 54 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón de 11 años y una hija mujer de 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de frutas.
Ella es emprendedora constante, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ que se caracteriza por ser un área rural y productora de frutas como; Kiwi, peras, cornejo, higos, banano y naranja, entre otros, se encuentra en un valle semi-tropical de clima templado durante todo el año.
Nieves es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español (sentada la primera de la derecha, blusa verde, mandil celeste). Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que trabaja como constructor y sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, la familia vive en una casa de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su deseos de superación la hicieron formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de temporada, tejido a máquina, servicio técnico de equipos, venta de muebles, venta de edredones, confección de carteras de cuero y venta de salteñas, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de fruta producida en el lugar, ella tiene un puesto de venta fijo donde recibe a dueñas de tiendas para venderles fruta por mayor. Su negocio es prospero porque sus clientes son constantes y a fin de año aumentan, mejorando las ventas. Su sueño es seguir aumentando sus ventas, ampliar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Ella desea realizar la compra de fruta por mayor para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes, aprovechar las ventas de la temporada y no perder ingresos. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en ocho años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nieves solicita un préstamo para la compra de fruta por mayor y abastecer la demanda de temporada.
texts.en:
Nieves is a woman of 54. She is married and has an 11-year-old son and a 12-year-old daughter. Her business is selling fruit. She is entrepreneurial, persistent, independent, responsible, and hard-working. She carries out her business in the area of Sacaba, which is known for being a rural area and the producer of fruits such as kiwi, pears, dogwood, figs, bananas, and oranges, among others. It is located in a semi-tropical valley with a warm climate all year.

Nieves has a dark complexion, long, braided black hair, and short stature. She dresses in traditional form (hat, blanket, and skirt). Her maternal tongue is Quechua, and she speaks Spanish. (In the photo, she is the first one on the right, in a green blouse and a light blue apron.) She lives with her husband, who works in construction, and her children, who are in school. The family lives in a house of brick which has potable water and electricity. Her desires to improve herself led her to form a bank with people with businesses such as selling seasonal clothing, machine knitting, technical service for equipment, selling furniture, selling quilts, making leather purses, and selling meat pies so that they could apply for a loan and improve their businesses. 

Her business is selling fruit produced in that area. She has a regular sales stand where she receives store owners to sell them fruit wholesale. Her business is prosperous because her customers are regular and they increase at the end of the year, improving her sales. Her dream is to continue increasing her sales, expand her business, and improve the quality of life of her children. She wants to purchase fruit wholesale to stock up for the demand of her customers, to take advantage of the sales of the season and not lose income. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the eight years that she has had this business.

It is for these reasons that Nieves is applying for a loan to purchase fruit wholesale and stock up for the demand of the season.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale and stock up for the demand of the season

loans.name: Samia

texts.en: Samia is 22-year-old single lady. In order to support her father (also shown in the photo) in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales, generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales, generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam  is a 32 year old, married woman. She runs a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Maryam’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. 

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Maryam  has requested 40,000 PKR  to buy another buffalo to cater to more customers which will provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car for developing her business.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 36-year-old, married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for many years with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. They make balls in different sizes and sell them in their community and in the local market. They earn enough to bear the expenses of her family members. 

Perveen is a motivated mother of 3 children. She is responsible for providing them with good quality food, health and clothing. 

For the improvement of her business, she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay which will ultimately help in generating more cash. 

She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use the part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay

loans.name: Basharat

texts.en:
Basharat is a 42-year-old man residing in Lalamusa, Gujrat, Pakistan. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is a father of four children. He has been doing his own business of cattle farming for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and managing the household.

Basharat wants to purchase an animal for his business purpose, but due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase this cattle. Therefore, Basharat has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy this cattle to fulfill the needs of his business; this will also be good for him to earn maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance, Basharat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cattle for his dairy-farming business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rose Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and general store.  Rose Marie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials  for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rose Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz  is a 51 year old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their 5 children. 

Currently, she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater for the maximum number of customers for generating a healthier source of income. 

She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater for the maximum number of customers for generating a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Rajan

texts.en:
Rajan  is a 55 year old, married woman, who has been running a business selling milk for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 7 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income for providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income for providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.name: Jeena

texts.en:
Jeena, age 51, is a married woman and mother of four children. 

Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market. Which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring material for the shop, including threads, needles, cloth etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Jeena is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needed things with the help of the loan amount. 

Jeena is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and tailoring material for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Sayeda

texts.en:
Sayeda  is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

Sayeda  is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase materials such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to make more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem  is a 52 year old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is Shameem’s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. 

He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Shameem  has applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR, for her son. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Shameem is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 52 years old and married with a ten year old dependent. She lives in Iloilo, Philippines with her family. For thirty years, she and her husband have been engaged in fishing and catching crabs. Merly is asking for a loan to buy rope, nylon and fishing nets. These are necessary so she can replace the old ones that are already defective. 

Merly hopes to improve her catch and experience better business profitability with her new equipment. She is determined to ensure that her child will have a good education.

loans.use: to buy rope, nylon and fishing nets.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.en:
Zebiniso is a kind woman. She was born in the year 1977. Zebiniso is divorced and has 3 children. Her children are not grown up yet. 

Zebiniso is trying to provide them with a better quality of life, that’s why 16 years ago she began own business with sewing women's national dresses. She has a workshop in her house. 

Thanks to the good service she provides, she has managed to gain many customers. Since she’s had her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. She wants to develop her business further but she needs to buy a new sewing machine. She is asking for a loan of to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 26 years old from Carles, Iloilo. She is a mother of a 7-month-old son whom she supports through her fishing business. She works hard in order to provide for her child, especially milk and diapers. She is asking for a loan to buy a new boat and fishing nets. This means a lot to Ma. Teresa so she could expect a better catch daily. 

In the future, she hopes to find another business opportunity for a brighter future with her child.

loans.use: to buy a new boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Rudelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Rudelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and food vending. Rudelyn is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rudelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat  is a 45 year old, married woman doing a business of animal purchases and sales with the help of her husband for many years. 

She is a mother of 2 children, and her business has provided her family with a decent life.  She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. 

She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers.

loans.name: Leyli

texts.en:
Leyli lives in Shenik village in the Armavir region. Her family consists of her husband and two children (ages 6 and 5 years old). Leyli works at a local kindergarten and her husband works in the private sector. 

Unfortunately, with their salaries Leyli and her husband cannot even take care of their family's basic needs. Besides their work, they are also involved in agriculture. They are mainly involved in breeding cattle (cows, calves and a pig). With the help of this loan Leyli asks lenders to support her with the renovation of the barn for cattle. 

She has previously taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back because the family faced difficulties. However, thanks to their recent hard work, Leyli is able to run her agribusiness in a way that ensures that she will be able to cover the monthly payments on this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Lenders will provide great support to Leyli and her family by giving them an opportunity to receive the loan and to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the barn.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena is a 60-year-old married woman. 

For the past 10 years, she has been running a business of animal sales and purchases, along with her husband. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for their feeding, while her husband sells them to different markets. 

Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand their business, Haseena has requested for a loan amount of 40,000 PKR to buy more animals for resale purposes. 

She is hopeful that expanding the business will help her to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more animals for resale purposes.

loans.name: Sugharan

texts.en: Sugharan is a 39-year-old married lady and is running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of items such as threads, buttons and ribbons, etc. at a reasonable price. She has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Sugharan makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR which she will use to buy more spools of thread, ribbon, and lace from the market at lower rates to make more stock available to her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Sugharan wishes to utilize part of her revenues on providing good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, ribbon, and lace from the market at lower rates to make more stock available to her customers.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah applied for a first loan which was given by Kiva lenders. The first loan helped Abdullah very much in improving and enlarging his business. His grocery store became larger and contained a lot of goods, foods, and other items. Unfortunately, after Abdullah's grocery began to flourish, it burnt and the fire damaged all the goods and foods. Abdullah felt very sad but he didn't surrender to that tragedy and he still strives strongly to open another grocery store at the same place. Really, he has a strong determination to start his business again. 

He started his new, small grocery store two months ago. Abdullah finished repayment of all the instalments for the first loan. In order to purchase another amount of foods and other items for his small grocery, Abdullah has applied for a second Youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Abdullah looks forward to providing his new grocery with all sorts of foods and items to attract a lot of customers. In fact, Abdullah is very thankful for Kiva lenders for their first loan.

loans.use: to purchase another amount of foods and items for his small grocery store.

loans.name: Victory Group

texts.en:
This group is ready to begin their ninth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. It is made up of five members and has a representative called Willfred. The businesses belonging to the members of this group include selling electrical parts, second-hand clothing, pedicures and smoked fish. The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro-businesses where Wilfred is a member. 

Willfred currently has a business that sells electrical items. He began this business seven years ago when he acquired some used electrical items that he sold to customers. The loan is for the increase of capital for the wholesale purchase of electrical parts, which he will buy from the market in Accra and later sell in a kiosk at Chorkor. This work allows him to generate as much income as he can for his household, since he is married and has children. 

When he was asked what he likes about ID-Ghana, he responded that he likes the medical consultations and the assistance that the institution offers to them.

loans.use: to purchase electrical parts, which he will buy from the market in Accra and later sell in a kiosk at Chorkor.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Ann, a hardworking, dedicated and honest 30-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of her family with two children, she farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nandi Hills, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. 

For the past 10 years, she has been practicing mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk, egg and tea selling. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming. Ann passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge she faces is feeding her cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. 

She is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter and another quality breed of dairy cow. The chaff cutter will assist Ann in cutting hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forage to feed her cow. Also, it will aid the animal’s digestion and prevent the animals from rejecting any part of their food. Ann also intends to buy not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 15-25 litres of milk a day. The selling price for milk is 40 Kenya shillings per liter and, through this loan, she will be making a cool US $11 per day. 

Before Ann joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance that supports smallholder farmers with technical and financial solutions, she considered dairy farming to be a mediocre fallback occupation that did not have future promise for income generation. After training, Ann now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into if you want a rather less rough way into the millionaires club. With the loan, Ann will increase her income from milk selling and her cows will have more food to eat and never reject food. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows and, through this loan, Ann will achieve this. An increase in income will allow Ann to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Her dream is to continue improving her dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Ann fears that her dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide its reliable market channel, credit facility and services that she requires to grow her dairy enterprise.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nazeer

texts.en: Nazeer is 39 years old; she is a married woman. She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in the Lernagog village of the Armavir region with her husband and three children. Her daughter is a teacher at a local school, and the other members of the family are occupied in agriculture.

Gayane is a hard-working woman who breeds cows, calves and hens and grows peach and apricot trees. The cattle breeding and the horticulture have always been the primary source of the family's income. Because of the family's increasing daily needs, Gayane now wants to improve her farm and to purchase the necessary forage for the livestock. She specifically wants pay for renovation of the barn and forage for feeding the cattle in the winter season. To reach that goal, a loan of $3,000 USD is needed to support to this hard-working woman, Gayane, and her family. 

Gayane has previously taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back because the family faced difficulties. However, thanks to their recent hard work, Gayane is able to run her agribusiness in a way that ensures that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for barn renovation and forage for feeding the cattle in the winter season.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 40-year-old, married woman. Her husband has been buying and selling animals for many years. Safia fully supports and assists her husband with his work. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more animals to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to resell in the market.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 42-year-old married woman. Their family is involved in the business of selling toys. Her son (as shown in the picture) has been selling toys in different cities and at their home for many years. Now they want to increase their business but they have a lack of financial resources. Parveen is a very motivated and hardworking woman who wants to help her family. For this reason she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more toys such as dolls, cars, games, stuffed toys, etc. to generate more sales and cater to more customers.

loans.use: to buy more toys such as dolls, cars, games, stuffed toys, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia has a retail shop in Mombasa town and has been running this business for 15 years. She is 43 years old and widowed with one child.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of goods such as flour, cooking fat, rice, sugar and washing bar soaps and detergents to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is her fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid all her previous loans successfully. In the future she hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Ana Ysabel

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene una familia maravillosa conformada por su esposo y 4 maravillosos hijos y vive en Tinguiña junto a ellos. Por iniciativa propia ha iniciado un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, cada día sale de su casa muy entusiasmada porque está aprendiendo nuevas técnicas de venta que son muy buenas y atrae muchos clientes. Es una persona muy alegre y responsable, siempre esforzándose para sacar adelante a su familia.
Ana está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería de temporada para su negocio, con esto tendrá mayores ventas y así más adelante espera poder brindar una educación superior a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is a woman who is very determined to get ahead.  She has a wonderful family consisting of her husband and four outstanding children who she lives with in Tinguiña.  She began her clothing business on her own initiative and goes out every day with much enthusiasm.  She is learning new sales techniques which are very good and attract many customers.  She is a very cheerful, responsible person who always does her best to provide for her family.

Ana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because with their support she can buy season clothing for her business.  This will increase sales which, in turn, will allow her to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing for her business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 60 años, es soltero, vive en casa propia junto a su hijo y nuera y 01 hija. Su caserío está ubicado en Popan bajo de zaña, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Su familia es muy unida.

Juan se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, carneros y aves de corral y al cultivo de productos de pan llevar. Además, alquila su mototaxi para trabajo. El destino del crédito es para la inversión en compra de carneros y mantenimiento de cultivo. Así, tendrá un ingreso adicional para su unidad familiar lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 60 years old and lives in his own house with his son, daughter-in-law and daughter. The rural community is located in Popan Bajo in Zaña in the district of Cayalti, province of Chiclayo.  It is in the region of Lambayeque along the northern coast of Peru.   The community works basically in agriculture, livestock farming and commerce.  

Juan's family is very close. He works raising and selling pigs, sheep and fowl, and also grows crops.  In addition to this, he rents out his motortaxi.  He will use the loan to buy sheep and provide his crops with maintenance. This will enable to him to earn extra income for the family and give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy sheep and carry out crop maintenance.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 37 años de edad, es soltero. Tiene casa propia, cuenta con servicios públicos agua y luz. Rosa vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú. La comunidad es pequeña los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de animales menores(patos, conejos, pollos, entre otros), y a la agricultura.

La actividad que desarrolla Rosa es la venta de cerveza y piqueos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 6 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio. Rosa cuenta con clientela fija en la zona, conocida con muy buenas referencias personales, laborales y crediticias. El destino del crédito será para compra y venta de cerveza en mayores cantidades, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 37, is single and has her own house with electricity and running water.  She lives in the district of Buenos Aires in the province of Morropón, region of Piura, along the northern coast of Peru.  The community is small and the local people raise small animals (ducks, rabbits, chickens, etc.) and work in agriculture.

Rosa works from home selling beer and snacks and has been in business for six years.  She has fixed clientele in the area and enjoys very good personal, work and credit references.  The loan will be used to buy and sell beer in greater quantities.  This will allow her, in the short term, to improve her income, increase her earnings and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy greater quantities of beer.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
58-year-old Benjamin has been fishing for 40 years. He is married with a young child to support with his fishing business.
Benjamin is motivated to do something to upgrade his equipment. He is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fishing nets, ropes, nylon and lead sinker weights. This will help him to increase his catch.

It is his goal to somehow experience a good life out of the success of his business. Any income generated will be spent on a nutritious food for his family, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, ropes, nylon and lead sinker weights.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Dúo Inspiracion Group

texts.es: Dúo Inspiracion Doña Ana representa, se dedica a la venta de huevos todos los días, venta de lácteos los días sábados, venta de embutidos días martes y jueves, venta y destaza de pollo día domingo, y ahora ha agregado a sus actividades la venta de jabón de ropa, detergentes, y jabón para utensilios de cocina, a Dios gracias doña Ana Sirve a sus comunidad llevándoles hasta la  puerta de sus hogares lo que ellos necesitan, ella esta necesitando de capital para lograr invertir nuevamente en su negocio y siempre brindarles un si a lo que requieran de ella, ella les agradece el apoyo que le han dado en su negocio ya que por medio de Kiva ella a podido salir adelante, esperando que nuevamente le puedan ayudar ya que es una oportunidad mas para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
The Dúo Inspiracion Group is represented by Ana who sells eggs every day.  On Saturday she sells dairy products, on Tuesday and Thursday, sausages and on Domingo, chicken.  Now she has added other items to her business such as detergents and dish soaps.  She serves the community by going door to door offering her products.  She is in need of a loan to invest in her business so she always can offer what her customers request.

She is grateful for the support from Kiva which has allowed her to get ahead.  Her hope is that she will be given a new opportunity to help her family.

loans.use: To buy personal products to sell.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es:
Clarisa tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica al cultivo de caña para comercializarlo a la empresa azucarera de la zona y agricultura, que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo, ubicado en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Clarisa se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, desde hace más de 02 años, siendo muy conocida por zona. Ella necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de mercadería para negocio, ya que clientes le están pidiendo más variedad de productos, lo cual le incrementará sus ventas lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Clarisa is 47 years old and lives with her family in Lagunas district, a community where people farm and grow sugarcane to sell at the area's sugar company.  It belongs to the Chiclayo province, located in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. 

Clarisa has been running a grocery store for two years and is very well-known in the area.  She is in need of a loan to buy merchandise for her business since customers are asking for more product variety.  This will increase sales and allow her, in the short term, to improve her income, increase earnings and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: 9 De Octubre Km 5  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito 9 De Octubre Km 5 se reune cada 15 días en Portoviejo, está formado por 12 señoras que decidieron unirse y formar este grupo con el cual esperan mejorar sus negocios y su calidad de vida, ellas se dedican a diversas actividades como la agricultura, comercio y cría de animales.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Betsy, tiene 31 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 9, 8, 5. 3  y 1 años de edad, los 4 mayores estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es obrero.
Doña Betsy  es una mujer que le gusta trabajar por el bien de su familia, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes y otros productos de primera necesidad,  hace un mes fue que arreglo en su casa este local y poco a poco ha ido surtiendo su tienda, ahora con la ayuda del crédito espera comprar muchos más productos para así brindar un mejor servicio y obtener mejores ingresos que les sirvan para salir adelante,  ya que su marido no gana mucho en su trabajo y los gastos son muchos sobretodo con los gastos de estudios de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir más su tienda. Este es su primer crédito en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.  
La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The "Km 5" loan group meets every fortnight in Portoviejo. The group has 12 members - all women - who decided to join together and create this group, through which they hope to improve their businesses and quality of life. The woman work in various trades, including farming, business and raising animals.

One member of the group is 31-year-old Betsy. She has a partner and five children, ages nine, eight, five, three and one. The four eldest children are in school; Betsy's husband is a labourer.

Betsy likes to work for the good of her family. She has a grocery store in her house where she sells rice, sugar, oil, detergent and other staple goods. She opened this shop a month ago and, gradually, she has stocked it up. Now, with the help of this loan, Betsy hopes to buy many more products in order to offer better service and earn a higher income. A higher income will allow Betsy to move forward as her husband does not earn much in his work and household expenses are high owing to the costs of their children's schooling.

This loan will be used to buy more supplies to stock up Betsy's shop. This is Betsy's first loan with the group and she likes it because it is fast. Betsy's dream is to move forward with her business and for her shop to grow every day.

The small photo is of two members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Jéhovah Jireh D Group

texts.fr: Tulinabo est membre du groupe de crédits Jéhovah Jireh D, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 42 ans, mère de 4 enfants, 3 vont à l’école et 1 est encore gosse. Elle avait commencé son activité avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des souliers depuis 18 ans. Son conjoint est un commerçant aussi. Elle compte acheter 200 paires de souliers. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Tulinabo is a member of the "Jéhovah Jireh D" loan group and a customer of IMF Hekima. She is 42 years old, married and mother to four children, three of whom go to school and the fourth who is still an infant. She began her business with funds from her husband, and she has been selling shoes for the past 18 years. Her husband is a also a trader. She is planning to buy 200 pairs of shoes. She would like to get more loans so she can increase her turnover, educate and feed her children. Finally, she is extremely grateful to Hekima for the support it provides to entrepreneurs who cannot access banks.

loans.use: to buy 200 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Institut Ujumbe Group

texts.fr: Le client Kitsa est un homme d’affaires, membre d’une association de crédits «Institut Ujumbe», âgé de 30 ans, marié à une infirmière. Il est vendeur divers matériels de construction dans le centre commercial de la ville. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Il va acheter divers matériels de construction (tuyaux, vannes, clous, câbles, tôles etc.). Ainsi, Il souhaite construire une maison et renforcer son activité. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien aux petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: The customer, Kitsa, is a businessman and member of the "Institut Ujumbe" loan group. He is 30 years old and married to a nurse. He sells a variety of building materials in the town's shopping center and is requesting a loan from Hekima so he can expand his business. He is going to buy various building materials (pipes, valves, nails, cables, sheet metal, etc.). He would thereby like to be able to build a house and boost his business. He is grateful to Hekima for the support it gives to small entrepreneurs who have no access to the classic bank system.

loans.use: to buy various building materials (pipes, valves, nails, cables, sheet metal, etc.)

loans.name: Progrès Group

texts.fr: Kihese est commerçante, présidente du groupe  d’affaires «Progrès», âgée de 48 ans, mariée a un commerçant,  mère de 3 enfants dont 1 étudie et 2 sont déjà grands. Elle est vendeuse de divers habillements dans un magasin dans le centre ville depuis 15 ans  et après elle sollicita un prêt à l’IMF Hekima. Elle va acheter des habits enfants et adultes, souliers… pour accroitre son activité. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle compte scolariser, nourrir et vêtir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Kihese is a trader and president of the "Progrès" business group. She is 48 years old, married to a trader and mother to three children, one of whom is studying while the other two are already adults. She has been selling a variety of clothing in a shop in the centre of town for the past 15 years and now she has requested a loan from Hekima. She is going to buy clothes for children and adults, as well as shoes, so that she can expand her busines. She began it with funds from her husband. In the future she would like to be able to educate, feed and clothe her children. She is thus extremely grateful to Hekima for its support of small entrepreneurs who cannot access banks.

loans.use: to buy clothes for children and adults, as well as shoes.

loans.name: Lisungi Group

texts.fr: Kahambu est commerçante dynamique de la banque villageoise Lisungi, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un médecin, âgée de 30 ans, mère de 3 enfants dont 2 scolarisés et 1 est gosse. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu  de son mari. Elle est propriétaire d’une alimentation chez elle à la maison depuis 3 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 cartons du lait en poudre, 2 sacs sucre, 2 cartons de vin, 3 cartons de jus, 5 cartons d’eau vive, 20 litres d’huile, biscuits, bombons, riz et lait. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Kahambu is a dynamic trader belonging to the Lisungi Banc Villageois and also a customer of IMF Hekima. She is 30 years old, married to a doctor and mother to three children, two of whom are at school and the third still a young child. She began her business with funds from husband. She has been the owner of a grocery store that she runs from home for the past three years. This new loan will be used to buy two cartons of powdered milk, two sacks of sugar, two cartons of wine, three cartons of juice, five cartons of running water, 20 liters of oil, biscuits, candy, rice and milk. She would like to increase her borrowing and be able to feed her children. Finally, she is grateful to Hekima for the support it gives to entrepreneurs who cannot access banks.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of powdered milk, two sacks of sugar, two cartons of wine, three cartons of juice, five cartons of running water, 20 liters of oil, biscuits, candy, rice and milk.

loans.name: Jéhovah Jireh H Group

texts.fr: Augustin est commerçante, membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Jéhovah Jireh H», âgée de 42 ans, mariée à un commerçant, mère de 2 enfants tous étudient. La cliente est propriétaire d’un Café restaurant dans le centre ville depuis 2 ans. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu  de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter des pommes de terre, haricots, sucre, lait. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une belle maison,  scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Augustin is a trader and member of the "Jéhovah Jireh H" business collective. She is 42 years old, married to a trader and mother to two children, both of whom are studying. The customer has been the owner of a café/restaurant for the past two years and she began her business with funds from her husband. This new loan will be used to buy potatoes, beans, sugar and milk. She would thereby like to be able to build a nice house, as well as to clothe and feed her children. Finally, she is extremely grateful to Hekima for giving autonomy to female entrepreneurs who cannot access bank funding.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, beans, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Geoconda Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo de Crédito Las Mercedes Del Fátima. Este grupo está formado en su mayoría por gente humilde y trabajadora que luchan por sacar adelante a su familia. 
En este lugar vive la señora Geoconda, tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 4  hijos, dos de ellos mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 13 años  que estudian en colegio. Su marido es maestro de construcción.
Doña Geoconda es una mujer  muy trabajadora que siempre le gusto ganar sus propios ingresos para salir adelante, ella vende ropa de Leonisa y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, visita a sus clientes cuando esta desocupada o cuando sus hijos están en el colegio, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva varios años realizando esta actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son seguir  mejorando cada día su negocio.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the loan group Grupo de Crédito Las Mercedes Del Fátima meet in the city of Portoviejo. This group is mainly made up of humble and hard-working people who are striving to help their families' to progress. 

Geoconda is 43 years old and is in a common-law relationship, by which she has four children, two of whom are grown up and the other two are 16 and 13 years old and are in school. Her husband is a construction foreman. 

Geoconda is a hardworking woman that has always liked to make her own income in order to progress. She sells Leonisa clothing and Yanbal products (beauty and cosmetic products, perfumes and women's accessories). She does door-to-door sales, visiting her clients when she is not busy or when her children are at school. She leaves items on credit and charges every eight days. She has now been doing this for several years.

This loan is to purchase clothes, shoes, perfumes, creams and cosmetic products. She has been a member of the loan group since the very start and she likes it because, with the loans, she makes progress. Her dream is to keep on improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes, perfumes, creams and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Maa Charchika Group

texts.en:
Sangita is the leader of a 12-member group that hails from Bhanpur village of the M. Rampur block of Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 26 years. She has a small family comprising four members including one daughter and one son, aged about 4 and 2 years. The member sitting at second from right at the front row with raised hand is Sangita. 

With the help of her husband she has been running a hotel (restaurant) for the last six years. At present her monthly family income is about INR 6,000, and it is not sufficient to lead a better life. For getting more income, the growth of her business is necessary, and for that, some extra funds need to be invested. So Sangita asked Mahashakti foundation for a loan. It is her first loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of her business. 

From this loan she will purchase some chairs, tables, sugar, tea, rice, oil, etc, in a large quantity for the growth of her business. Her future plan is to provide higher education to her children. 

The other 11 members of the group are also doing their own businesses like grocery shop, hotel, saloon and vegetable vending.

loans.use: to purchase some chairs, tables, sugar, tea, rice, oil, etc

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en:
Jenie is a 29-year-old married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She has two children, ages 4 and 12. Jenie and her husband are involved in fishing and farming. They grow rice and watermelons. Aside from this, her husband also works as a carpenter.

Jenie is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, insecticide, watermelon seeds, and rice and to pay for farm labor, fishing nets, and a boat engine. Her income will then be used to pay for school and the family's daily consumption. In the future, Jenie dreams of being successful in giving her children a proper education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, rice, and watermelon seeds and to pay for farm labor,  fishing nets, and a boat engine

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas is a 36-year-old single Palestinian man. Due to the low social and financial situation of Palestinians in Lebanon, he started working three years ago as a car blacksmith to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Firas is trying hard to provide his family with better living conditions. Thus today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate his house to make it a healthier place for his family. Firas hopes to expand his business in the future to save some profits for his life and to improve his family's socioeconomic condition.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Tania Gladys

texts.es: La socia Tania sigue dedicándose a elaborar y vender panes chutas en el distrito de Oropesa.  Con el anterior préstamo la socia logro crecer el capital y la rentabilidad del negocio. La socia solicita el crédito nuevo para comprar insumos como harina, manteca, y azúcar al por mayor. La socia esta agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota de una manera disciplinada.
texts.en: Tania continues to work making and selling chuta bread in the district of Oropesa. With the previous loan, she was able to grow her capital and the business' profitability. She is asking for the new loan to buy ingredients such as flour, lard and sugar wholesale. She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as lard, sugar, and flour wholesale.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is 32 years old and a married woman. She has two children. She is working hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, health and education. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of his family. 

She started her business of stitching to contribute in the family income. She has been in this business for many years. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she has a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

She requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy threads of different colors, buttons, needles etc. 

She hopes that this loan amount will help her to grow her business and that her dream of providing a good and quality education to her children may come true.

loans.use: to buy threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Hudson's Group

texts.en:
Hudson is 60 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Hudson has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to feed his family and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. Hudson also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Hudson's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as to buy two solar lights.

loans.name: Joefre

texts.en:
Joefre is an expert in catching crabs and fishing. He is 40 years old now and has been fishing since he was 15 years old. He is married and has three children ages 10, 12, and 13.

Joefre is asking for a loan to buy a fishing boat, hull, fishing nets, and a boat engine. He hope that the upgrade of his equipment will positively impact his catch and eventually give him a stable income. In the future, Joefre to expand his fishing business and be more successful. Any profit he generates goes toward school fees, healthy meals for his family, and reinvestment in his business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat, hull, fishing nets, and a boat engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a toilet and improve the sanitary conditions of the bathroom in her humble house.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 27-year-old married father of one child. He is a Syrian citizen who has been working in a restaurant in Lebanon since 2009 to support his beloved family living in his home town in Syria.

Alaa is a hardworking man who puts so much effort into developing his career so that one day he can have the chance to open his own restaurant.

His limited income barely covers his living expenses, and that's why he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to send the money for his family in Syria to cover their living expenses during the current critical security situation.

He misses his home town a lot and hopes that one day everything will go on fine and he can establish his own restaurant in a special location attracting future tourists.

loans.use: To send the money for his family in Syria to cover their living expenses during the current critical security situation.

loans.name: Zoila Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo de Crédito Las Mercedes Del Fátima. Este grupo está formado en su mayoría por gente humilde y trabajadora que luchan por sacar adelante a su familia. 
En este lugar vive señora Zoila, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de  9, 7  y 3 años de edad y el menor de apenas un mes de nacido,  los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es maestro constructor.
Doña Zoila con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudarle a su marido en los gastos de sus pequeños hijos  se dedica a la venta de zapatillas y  productos de Yanbal y Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, también vende en su casa, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más 4 años en su negocio y le ha ido muy bien. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar zapatillas, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias al los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños darle lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo the Las Mercedes Del Fátima credit group meets every two weeks. This group is made up of humble and hardworking women who fight to get their families ahead. This is where Zoila lives. She is 26 years old and has four children, aged 9, 7 and 3, and the youngest who is just a month old. The two oldest are in school. Her husband is a master builder.  

In order to have her own income and help her husband with the expenses for their young children, Zoila sells Yanbal and Belcorp products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She works three days a week, usually in the morning because at that time it is easier for her to make her rounds. She also sells in her house. She sells on credit and collects every week. She has had this business for more than 4 years and it is going very well for her.
 
She is going to use this loan to buy slippers, perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics and creams. She has been in the credit group since the beginning and she likes it because thanks to the loans she started her business. Her dream is to give her small children the best.

loans.use: to buy slippers, perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Muema

texts.en:
Muema is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as honest. Muema operates a retail business where he sells shoes and has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with many customers and his primary customers are individuals. 

Muema will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to be a great dealer of shoes within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will open another branch of his store. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. He repaid his previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Afiya

texts.fr: Revendeuse de céréales depuis 1989 à Lomé, madame Afiya se tourne vers WAGES pour la demande un premier crédit afin de s'acheter des marchandises. A l'avenir, elle souhaite devenir une grossiste et aider ses enfants à s'épanouir. Mariée, elle a 05 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Son conjoint est cuisinier. Afiya quant à elle est âgée de 49ans.
texts.en: Madame Afiya has been selling cereals in Lome since 1989. She is now turning to Wages to request a first loan in order to buy merchandise. In the future she would like to become a wholesaler and help her children to thrive. She is married with five children of whom three go to school. Her spouse is a cook. Afiya is 49 years old.

loans.use: to buy cereals, corn, rice...

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a married woman. She has five children, with ages ranging from 12 years to 24 years. She describes herself to be focused.
