She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy market, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials and a sewing machine. 

She hopes that in the future she will educate her children. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem  is a vigorous, 44-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. 

She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  

But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Shameem ’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household.

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She hopes to gain more profits to fulfill her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Deeba

texts.en:
Deeba, 41 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a shop for the last five years. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. Deeba needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customers' demand.

Deeba has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, rice, juices, etc. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, rice, juices, etc.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman. She has three children. Patricia operates a retail business where she sells chicken and she has been involved in this business for  years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as poultry diseases. 

Patricia will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more chicken. Her business goal is to have more chicken within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a farm. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She repaid her previous loan successfully

loans.use: to buy more chicken

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as honest. Mary operates a retail business where she sells cereals and she has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a viable location. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. 

Mary will use this KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank and she repaid her previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as honest. Rogers operates a retail business where he sells cereals and he has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with potential for business growth and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate funds. 

Rogers will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will increase his income. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank and he repaid his previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined and focused. He operates a retail shop where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area with customers, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

 He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to live in a good house. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy locks of hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Alicia Fotunata

texts.es:
Alicia sigue dedicandose al su restaurante donde sirve almuerzos y cenas, la socia trabaja desde las Ella preprara diferentes platos típicos como caldos, y pollo al horno entre otros platos, el sueño de la socia es crecer el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita le credito para comprar productos para su cocina como verduras, carne, pollo, y arroz.

La socia está muy agradecida por ser cliente de Arariwa y se ha comprometido a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota a tiempo.
texts.en:
Alicia continues to work in her restaurant where she serves lunch and dinner. She prepares different traditional dishes such as soups, baked chicken, and others. Her dream is to grow the restaurant business. She is asking for the loan to be able to buy products for her kitchen such as vegetables, meat, chicken and rice. 

She is very grateful to be a client of Arariwa and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, chicken, vegetables, and other products to cook.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
Nodira was born in 1994. She studies at the Slavonic University of Tajikistan. Nodira is a student of the second course. She studies well. After classes, Nodira helps her mother with the house. She is a very hardworking and smart woman. Her parents are proud of her. 

Nodira dreams that after graduating university she will work in a state organization and develop her country. She loves her Tajikistan very much. 

Nodira is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks Kiva lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more timber

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela, an agronomist with 15 years of experience, lives in Aygavan village, Ararat region. She lives there with her daughter, as because of hard financial conditions, her husband had to migrate to a neighboring country to find a well paid job. 

To sustain her family's living, Anzhela runs her farm. She keeps hens, turkey, and also grows peaches, cherries, grapes and apples. 

The only income Anzhela gets is from sales of the gathered harvest of fruit. She takes care of her orchard with great love and care, so is able to gather a good harvest during the season. 

The requested loan is very important for Anzhela's farming business. She asks lenders to support her with purchasing fertilizer, pesticides, new seeds of fruit trees, and wires for the grape orchard.

Anzhela and her daughter will be grateful to the lenders for helping them to collect the loan amount, which will greatly impact their agribusiness and their lives in general.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides, new seeds of fruit trees, and wires for the grape orchard

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman; she has four children. She describes herself to be focused. 

She operates a dairy farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area fit for dairy farming, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough funds. 

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy farm inputs. 

Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She will use the anticipated profits for family development.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por ello es muy constante en su trabajo y por iniciativa propia a iniciado su negocio de venta de golosinas y también se dedica a la crianza y venta de gallinas. Su mayor motivación en la vida son sus hijas, por ellas es que lucha día a día para poder brindarles mejores oportunidades en la vida. su mayor sueño es más adelante poder verlas convertidas en exitosas profesionales ya que ella no pudo estudiar una profesión.
Delia quiere mejorar su negocio es por ello que piensa utilizar el crédito para poder comprar una vitrina y exhibir sus productos, también va a comprar más gallinas para criar y más adelante venderlas. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, porque gracias a esto sus ventas mejorarán y seguirá sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Delia is a person who really wants to get ahead. That is why she is constantly at work and why on her own initiative she started her business selling snacks. She also raises and sells chickens. Her biggest motivation in life are her daughters. She fights for them day to day to be able to offer them the best opportunities in life. Her biggest dream for the future is to see them graduate from college since she was unable to go to college. 

Delia wants to improve her business and that is why she is planning on using the loan to be able to buy a display case and show her products. She also wants to buy more chickens to raise and sell them in the future. She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity, because thanks to them her sales will improve and she will keep getting her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy display cases and snacks for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stylish new clothes and fabrics to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 41-year-old married woman. She does the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Neelam

texts.en:
Neelam is a 49-year-old lady. She has been running a school in her community for many years. She teaches the students of her community and uses the income from this business to support her family. 

In order to provide better teaching facilities for her students, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. With the help of the loan amount she will buy furniture along with a blackboard and stationery items for her school to provide better facilities for students. This will also enable her to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy furniture along with a blackboard and stationery items for her school to provide better facilities for students.

loans.name: Gulzaar

texts.en:
Gulzaar is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their two children. 

She requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to a maximum number of customers for generating a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to a maximum number of customers for generating a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a married man with five children. For the past 12 years, he has operated a retail business where he sells sugar, cereals, flour, soap, and other items. His primary customers are locals. Felix describes himself to be honest. His biggest business challenge is the lack of enough capital. This is Felix’s third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank and he successfully repaid his previous loans. 

Felix is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereals, flour, soap and other items. His business goal is to have more branches within five years and he hopes that, in the future, he will have a better life.

loans.use: buy cereals, flour, soap, and other items

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a 62-year-old entrepreneur from Carles, Iloilo. For five years now, she has been operating a bakery which earns her 26,000 PHP per month. Yolanda makes bread and her bakery is located within her house. 

Yolanda is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy flour, sugar, oil, baking powder, lard, charcoal, and yeast. She plans to introduce more delicious bread in the coming days to attract more customers. In the future, Yolanda plans to make more improvements to expand her bakery and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, baking powder, lard, charcoal and yeast

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more plastic bottles

loans.name: Mayra Johana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo de Crédito Las Mercedes Del Fátima. Este grupo está formado en su mayoría por gente humilde y trabajadora que luchan por sacar adelante a su familia. 
En este lugar vive la señora Mayra, tiene 23 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene una  hija de 2 Años de edad. Su marido trabaja en una farmacia. Ella estudia secretariado ejecutivo en una universidad en la localidad.
Doña Mayra es una joven mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, también vende productos Avon, Yanbal y Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), los mismos que vende en su local o lleva a vender puerta a puerta o en la universidad en la cual estudia ya que tiene muy buenos clientes allí, trabaja todos los  días y su mamá le ayuda cuando ella tiene que ir a realizar los recorridos o a sus estudios, ella lleva más de 5 años dedicada al comercio.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, perfumes, cremas y varios productos que ella vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda.  Sus sueños  son terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
The members of the "Las Mercedes Del Fátima" communal bank meet every fortnight in the city of Portoviejo. This group is made up in it's majority of simple and hard-working people who struggle to get their families ahead.

Mayra lives here. She is 23 years old. is in a common-law relationship and has a two year old daughter from the relationship. Her husband works in a pharmacy. She has been studying to be an Executive Secretary in the local university.

Mayra is a young woman who likes to work to get ahead. She has a small store in her house where she sells all kinds of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, vegetables and fruits. She also sells products from Avon, Yanbal and Belcorp (beauty items, perfume and accessories for women). She sells them at her store and goes out door-to-door or at the university where she studies as she has very good clients there. She works every day and her mother helps her when she has to travel or study. She has been in business for more than 5 years.

She will use this loan to stock her store more. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, perfumes, creams and various products that she sells. She has been a member of the communal bank since it's inception and she likes it as the loan are very useful. her dream is to complete her studies.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, perfumes, creams, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with six children. For the past five years, she has operated an M-pesa business, which is a mobile-phone based money transfer service. Josephine describes herself to be determined. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. Josephine’s biggest business challenge is the lack of funds. This will be her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

Josephine is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to add M-pesa float. Her business goal is to expand within five years. Josephine hopes that, in the future, she will be successful in business.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is a female Kiva borrower. For the past four years, she has operated a tailoring business where she makes clothing. Dorine’s business is located in a good area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes herself to be honest. This will be Dorine’s first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

Dorine is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to open other branches within five years. Dorine hopes that, in the future, she will be able to improve her living standards.

loans.use: buy tailoring materials

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo de Crédito Las Mercedes Del Fátima. Este grupo está formado en su mayoría por gente humilde y trabajadora que luchan por sacar adelante a su familia. 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen ocho hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven con ellos y estudia en colegio. Su esposo es chofer
Doña María para salir adelante y con sus ingresos ayudar con los gastos del hogar hace ya 22 años surtió en su casa una tienda de víveres,  allí venden todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, carne, pescado, artículos de bazar, helados, aguas en bidón entre otros muchos productos, trabaja todos los días y su hijo le ayuda cuando está desocupado, a ella le encanta su negocio ya que así se siente independiente y está al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos cuando así lo necesitaron. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo de Crédito desde el segundo ciclo y le gusta porque los  créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The members of the "Las Mercedes Del Fátima" communal bank meet every fortnight in the city of Portoviejo. The majority of this group are simple and hard-working people who struggle to get their families ahead.

María lives here. She is 58 years old, married and from this relationship has 8 adult children. One of them still lives with her and studies in university. Her husband works as a driver. María in order to get ahead and to help with the household expenses started a store selling food in her house 22 years ago. Here she sells all kinds of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, vegetables and fruit, meat, fish, knick-knacks, ice-cream, water in drums amongst other products. She works every day and her daughter helps her when she is free.

She loves her business as it makes her feel independent and she can keep up with the needs of her children when necessary. She will use this loan to stock her store more. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent amongst other primary use products. She has been a member of the communal bank since it's second loan cycle and she likes it as the loans help her a lot. Her goal is to continue with her business and expand her store each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and other basic need items.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a male Kiva borrower. He operates a business selling clothing and bags and describes himself as experienced. Anthony’s personal challenge is the lack of water storage facilities for his family.

Anthony is requesting a 33,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. This will be his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. Anthony hopes that, in the future, he will be successful in his business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 52 years old and is married with four children. Her youngest child is 18 years old. Rosalie is a resident of Carles, Iloilo. For thirty years now, she has been running a fishing business and she also operates a sari-sari (variety) store. 

Rosalie is requesting a loan to buy plywood, nails, ropes, fishing nets, nylon, canned goods, noodles, eggs, detergent, seasoning, and toiletries. She will use her loan to replenish her inventory on time which will increase her sales and her customers. Rosalie dreams of seeing her youngest child finish school and she will use part of her income for school fees. In the future, she would like to offer more items in her store to gain more loyal customers as well as expand her fishing business.

loans.use: to  buy plywood, nails, ropes, fishing nets, nylon, canned goods, noodles, eggs, detergent, seasoning, and toiletries

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a married woman. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are individuals. 

Patience describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for use in the salon. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a single woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she makes detergents for sale. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a convenient place and her primary customers are regular. 

Patricia describes her biggest business challenge to be expensive ingredients for making detergents. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy ingredients for making detergents for sale. Her business goal is to have her own company for making detergents within five years. 

Patricia hopes that in the future, she will be able to support her family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making detergents

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children. For the past ten years, she has operated a business selling charcoal. Fatuma’s business is located in a convenient place and she has many regular customers. She describes herself to be honest. Fatuma’s biggest business challenge is that during the rainy season it is hard to get charcoal. This will be her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Fatuma successfully repaid her previous loans. 

Fatuma is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to expand to large scale within five years. Fatuma hopes that, in the future, she will be able to support her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Murodgul

texts.ru: Муродгул добрая жительница не большого района Вахш. Ей 41 год. У нее нет мужа, и она одна живет вместе с детьми. Муродгул не считает себя одинокой, ведь у нее прекрасные дети. Она воспитывает двоих сыновей и двоих дочерей. Муродгул зарабатывает на жизнь путем разведением мелко рогатых и крупно рогатых скотин. Данной деятельностью она занята уже 5 лет. Сейчас ней необходимо приобрести большое количество скотов, чтобы увеличить доход, для покрытия растущих семейных расходов. Дети растут и растут их расходы. Муродгул надеется на то, что увеличиться доход от бизнеса и поможет ей улучшить финансовое положения семьи.
texts.en:
Murodgul is a kind woman from the small region of Vakhsh. She is 41 and doesn't have a husband; she lives with her children. She doesn't consider herself lonely; after all, she has wonderful children. She is raising two sons and two daughters. 

Murodgul earns a living raising small and large livestock, a business she has had for five years. She currently needs to acquire a large quantity of livestock in order to increase her income to cover the growing expenses of her family. The children grow and their needs grow as well. She hopes to increase revenue from her business, which will help her improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and increase the head count of her herd

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials as cement, sand, gravel, and iron rods to renovate his house.

loans.name: Atymbu

texts.ru: Атымбу 58 лет, вдова, имеет 2 детей, младшая дочь- студентка. Образование у Атымбу - среднее. С 1990 года стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Бизнес Атымбу начала с покупки 10 овец. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Атымбу развила свое хозяйство до 2 бычков и 3 коров, также на участке мерою 0,30 Га она выращивает кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячная прибыль Атымбу составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). Однако этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи, также нужно платить за обучение дочки. Поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Атымбу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, что позволит ей увеличить доходы семьи.
texts.en:
Atymbu is 58 and widowed with two children. Her youngest daughter is a university student. Atymbu has a high school education and started working in animal husbandry and agriculture in 1990 with the purchase of 10 sheep. Thanks to her hard work and persistent effort, she developed her business and currently has two steers and three cows as well as a 0.3 hectare piece of land where she grows corn for her own use. Her monthly revenue is 7,000 KGS; however, this amount of income is far from enough to cover her family's living expenses, let along to pay for her daughter's education.

Therefore, with the goal of further developing her business, Atymbu has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase sheep. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her head count of livestock as well as increasing her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep in order to increase her family's income

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 1 year to 8 years. She describes herself as God-fearing. She operates a retail business selling washing soap, toothpaste, sugar, flour, detergents and other items. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. 

Serah will use this 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, washing soap, detergents and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her family and improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, washing soap, detergents and other items

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a marrried woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be customer-oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are locals. 

Doreen describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to have a successful business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира, 46 лет, замужем, мать троих детей,образование среднее, она ведет хозяйство в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, стартовав 24 года назад. Благодаря упорному труду Назиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 8 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 2 дойных коров. Доходы от кредита Назира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Nazira is 46 and married with three children. She has a high school education and runs a farm as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 24 years ago. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two dairy cows and eight sheep with a monthly income of 20,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Nazira has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to increase her head count of livestock by purchasing two dairy cows. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her head count of livestock and to save toward home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows in order to increase her head count of livestock

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are of all types. 

Samuel describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 77,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to own a big hotel within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock of meat.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира женщина-скотовод, проживающая в северном районе Спитамен. Она в возрасте 40 лет имеет двоих детей. Муж работает в России в качестве трудового мигранта. Около 5 лет Замира занимается выращиванием мелкорогатых скотин, а именно овец и баранов. От этой деятельности она получает доход, позволяющий содержать семью. Замире и ее детям нравится ухаживать за животными, они считают такую работу не трудоемкой. В связи с тем, что в их хозяйстве осталось всего пару скотин, Замира собирается увеличить их поголовье. Для этой цели она запрашивает кредит. Замира расчитвает на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Zamira lives in the northern region of Spitamen and raises animals. She is 40 and has two children. Her husband is working in Russia as a migrant labourer. For about five years she has been raising small livestock, specifically sheep and rams. She receives an income from this business, which allows her to provide for her family. Zamira and her children like to care for the animals and don't consider this work a burden.

Since they currently have only two animals on the farm, Zamira wants to increase her head count of livestock. With this goal in mind she is requesting a loan. She is depending on your help.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a carpentry shop where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are of all types. 

Peter describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy carpentry materials. His business goal is to own a big carpentry shop within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials for making furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, drinks and other items

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself as generous. She operates a farm, where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Hannah will use this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Gulnarkan

texts.ru: Гулнаркан, 42 года, в разводе. У нее среднее образование, уже 24 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Гулнаркан на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 1 лошадь и 10 овец. В целях увеличения своего бизнеса она обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 овец. Доходы от кредита Гулнаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Gulnarkan is 42 and divorced. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry for 24 years as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has one cow, one horse and 10 sheep.

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulnarkan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 25,000 KGS to purchase three sheep. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her quantity of livestock and to save toward home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase three sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Indira

texts.ru: Индира, 29 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Индиры среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается полеводством и животноводством, около 9 лет назад. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Индиры, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 1,56 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает картофель и пшеницу. Также у Индиры в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы и 10 коз. Ежемесячный доход от реализации сельскохозяйственной экологически чистой продукции и молока оптовым покупателям составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS). Индира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Индира намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи.
texts.en:
Indira is 29 and married with three children. She has a high school education and works in agriculture and animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started about nine years ago. Thanks to her persistence, hard work and purposefulness, she currently has 1.56 hectares of her own land where she grows potatoes and wheat, as well as three cows and 10 goats. Her monthly income from selling organic produce and milk to wholesale buyers is about 8,000 KGS.

Indira has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 KGS to purchase steers. She intends to expand her business, which will help to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy steers in order to develop her business

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as reliable. He operates a transport business; he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a residential area, and his primary customers are of all types. 

Boniface will use this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk [a three-wheel taxi] within five years. He hopes that in the future he will live a comfortable life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with 5 children, and she describes herself as honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells juices, and she has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price inflation.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a freezer for business use. She will use the anticipated profits to build a house.

She hopes that in the future she will live a comfortable life and educate her children. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for business use

loans.name: Gullola

texts.ru:
Гуллоле 41 год. Она замужняя женщина, проживающая с детьми и мужем в районе Спитамен. Дети учатся, муж работает. Сама Гуллола работает в местной школе. Одновременно у нее при дворе дома имеется скотный двор, в котором она занимается животноводством. Эту деятельность Гуллола продолжает уже 8 лет. Она выращивает крупнорогатый скот, а после определенного периода откорма, продает их на скотном рынке. В этом прибыльном бизнесе ей помогает вся семья. За счет суммы кредита Гуллола хочет купить телят и увеличить поголовье скотов. Ваша поддержка ей сейчас важна. 
В будущем она планирует создать большой скотный двор и расширить свой животноводческий бизнес.
texts.en:
Gullola is 41 and married. She lives with her children and husband in the Spitamen region. Her children are in school and her husband has a job. She herself works in the local school and, at the same time, has a home business in animal husbandry, something she has been doing for eight years. She raises livestock, fattens them for a period of time and then resells them at the market. Her whole family helps her with this profitable business.

With the loan funds, Gullola wants to buy calves to increase her head count of livestock. Your support is important to her. In the future she plans to build a big farmyard and to expand her animal husbandry business.

loans.use: to buy calves to increase her head count of livestock

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a married man, and he has three children. He describes himself to be reliable. 

Jackson operates a photography business where he takes photos. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are of all types. Jackson describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of modern equipment. 

Jackson will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a camera. His business goal is to own a photo shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will give his family a comfortable life. 

This is Jackson's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and his previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay for school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a camera

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a married man with 4 children, and he describes himself as honest. 

He operates a farm where he grows crops, and he has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a fertile area. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds, so he will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and his previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a female Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a butchery where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for six years. 

Esther's business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. 

Sabina has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.  Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married woman with one child. She describes herself as being honest. She runs a retail business where she sells potatoes, cereals, and fruits. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with high demand. She describes her biggest business challenge to be perishability of her goods. 

Josphine will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) loan to buy more supplies of cereals, potatoes, and fruits. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more supplies of cereals, potatoes, and fruits

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush is from Artashat town where she lives with her husband, two school-aged children and retired mother-in-law. Siranush's husband is a musician, playing different musical instruments.

Siranush, who is a teacher by profession, works at a local school. After her work in the school, this hardworking woman takes care of the family farm. On the farm she keeps hens, cultivates wheat, tomatoes and peppers. Near the house where they live, Siranush also owns a grape orchard, which is a very important source of her family's income. 

The requested loan is vital for Siranush to invest in her farm and be prepared for the winter. She asks lenders to support her with purchasing wheat seeds (250 kg) and to pay for workers for her grape orchard (holing grapevines, and new wire installation). 

Siranush and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds (250 kg), and to hire workers for her grape orchard (holing grapevines, new wire installation)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman, and she has five children. Esther describes herself to be reliable and intelligent. 

Esther operates an M-Pesa business where she offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals. Esther describes her biggest business challenge to be network interruptions and delays. 

Esther will use the KES 40,000 loan to add an M-Pesa float and open another business branch. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years.

Esther hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. This is Esther's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: to add an M-Pesa float and open another business branch

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 43 года, замужем, мать четверых детей (1сын и 3 дочери). Образование-средне-специальное. Айнура на протяжении 22 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 30 овец. Айнура имеет практический опыт в животноводстве и полеводстве, а также знает теорию по разведению скота в домашних условиях. Благодаря своей трепетной работе и ответственности, Айнура на сегодняшний день имеет хорошее хозяйство: 3 коровы, 2 теленка, 1 лошадь, 10 овец и 80 ящиков пчелосемей, а также обрабатывает 4,0 ГА поливной земли, на которой она ежегодно сажает: люцерну и кукурузу. Ежемесячная прибыль ее семьи составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнура обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en:
Ainura is 43 and married with four children, one son and three daughters. She has a specialist high school education and has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for 22 years, a business she started with 30 sheep. She has practical experience in animal husbandry and agriculture and also knows the theory of raising domestic livestock. Thanks to her hard work and responsible nature, she currently has a good farm: three cows, two calves, one horse, 10 sheep and 80 beehives as well as 4 hectares of irrigated land where she grows lucerne and corn every year. Her family's monthly income is 10,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her farm, Ainura has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase sheep. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her head count of livestock.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep in order to grow her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
HELLO! Meet Margaret, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 37 years of age. She hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, which is home to the best long distance athletes in the world. She is a proud mother of school-going children that she really values and treasures, and she will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. 

Margaret's primary source of income has been selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming; through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been practicing farming for ten years, and through those years she has never regretted venturing into farming. 

Margaret sells her products to the nearby market; that is vegetables, eggs, and milk. She has a challenge of timely delivery of the products and also meeting the demand that exists. She is always forced to walk for long distances to reach the market, and this really affects her. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. Through the loan she will be able to deliver her products faster, and because her products are perishable, they require quick delivery and the motorbike will offer that. 

Margaret's dream is to get out of the poverty level, and she is sure that through this loan she will be able to realize her dream. She would like to empower others economically, and she plans to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farming activities. Through this she will improve her living standards. Through the saving ethos that Margaret has, she believes that she will repay the loan and increase her business of farming.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 26 years old. She is married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with three children who are currently in school.  Rose is a farmer as well as a baker.  She has been in this business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 4,000.

Rose has her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs.15,000, which she will use to buy bales of baking flour, sugar and margarine for baking.

With the anticipated profits, Rose will be able to expand her business even further.  Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be successful in life and always be prosperous in business.

loans.use: to buy bales of baking flour, sugar and margarine for baking

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy additional stock of shoes. 

Her business goal is to own a big business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a supplier of shoes. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Mvita

texts.en: Mvita is a married man. He has four children, with ages ranging from four to 17 years. He describes himself to be God-fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells water. He has been involved in this business for 16 years. His primary customers are loyal. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the shortage of water. He will use the Kes 65,000 loan to buy more water storage facilities to store water to sell. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully

loans.use: buy more water storage facilities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zabel

texts.en:
Zabel lives together with her 27-year-old son in Surenavan village, Ararat region. Her second son is married and lives separately with his family. Zabel is occupied in agribusiness. Specifically, she is specialized in the cultivation of tomatoes. Farming is a very important source of income for her family. Zabel's son helps her sell the gathered harvest in the local market. 

As life is getting more expensive day by day, Zabel needs to expand her agribusiness to be able to meet expenses. A loan of $3,000 will support her greatly, enabling her to cover cultivation costs (watering, planting) and purchase fertilizer for land cultivation. Zabel and her son will be very thankful to all the lenders for helping them collect the needed amount of the loan for sustaining their agribusiness.

loans.use: to cover cultivation costs (watering, planting) and purchase fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 38 years old and has been engaged in fishing for 19 years now. She is married and her husband is also a fisherman. They have seven children; their eldest is nineteen and their youngest is five. 

Wilma hopes to improve their source of income. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing weights and fishing nets. This will help to replace the old ones and will ensure an increase in her future catch.

Wilma hopes that with their hard work, everything will pay off. Her children's education is her priority and her income goes towards paying for their tuition fees. Any additional profit will be for savings and family consumption.

loans.use: to buy fishing weights and fishing nets.

loans.name: Hariom Group

texts.en:
Hari Om Self Help Group was formed by 11 active women entrepreneurs of Khariar town of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. The main objective was to earn some income of their own and be self sufficient through a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

Sumitra is one of the members of this group and is standing in the middle with a raised hand in the standing row of the photograph. She is a very energetic and hardworking lady of 50 years of age and lives with her husband, one son who is a driver, and one daughter who is studying in 10th standard. Sumitra has already completed the marriage of her four elder daughters.

Sumitra is running a pickle and papad business with her own initiative for the last 10 years. She herself makes mango and lemon pickles of different types and papad of different sizes and qualities. She supplies the pickles and papad to the retailers of Khariar town and vendors of nearby villages. 

Sumitra brings the raw materials from the nearest wholesale market, 200 kms away. Her daughter helps her in the preparation of pickles. She herself contacts different traders and customers to make her business more widespread.

Sumitra earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR from her existing business. Sumitra says that from the present income, she is managing her household, but it is very difficult to think of the marriage of her son and daughter from this scanty income. So, she wants to increase the volume of her business for earning some extra income for the future. 

From the present loan amount, Sumitra wants to purchase bulk mango, oil, spices and ascent for pickle preparation, and black gram and black pepper for papad preparation. This will help her to decrease the transporting and raw material cost, as she brings it frequently. She can also manufacture the products for a longer period.  

Sumitra hope to reconstruct her house, as the present one is old, and do the marriages of her son and daughter in a respectable manner. 

The other 10 members of the group are doing small businesses like milk selling, tiffin (light meal) center, fast food center, broom selling, etc.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing mangoes, oil, spices and ascent for pickle preparation and black gram and black pepper for papad preparation.

loans.name: Sala

texts.en:
Sala is a determined student nurse in her final year in one of the country’s private universities. The loan is to help pay her school fees.

Her interest in her profession is as a result of the passion she has for helping people in need. The completion of her studies would give her the needed skills to work as a professional nurse and also help her support her family, community, and self.  She aspires to reach higher in her education, and her family also pushes her towards her dreams through prayers and their encouragement.

She sees herself as a senior nursing officer in the future.  Furthering her education would help her accomplish that.  Denial of this loan would only mean that she has to stay out of school for a while.  That would mean taking a long time towards the realization of her goals.

“My country is peaceful, with hospitable and hard working people” she says.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
Shoghik is an experienced agronomist from the Aygavan village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, parents-in-law, sister-in-law, and three sons.The whole family is occupied in agricultural work. To be able to meet the needs of the family, Shoghik is engaged in keeping hens, and in the cultivation of tomatoes and several fruits (peaches, apricots, nuts, apples and grapes). With the help of her husband, Shoghik  sells the agricultural products in the local market. Farming is a very important source of income for the family. Shoghik currently needs to make some investments in her agribusiness in order for it to function in a more efficient way. A loan of USD 3000 will greatly support her business, enabling her to purchase forage for hens, partially renovate the barn, and cover cultivation costs.

Shoghik and her family will highly appreciate the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for helping her collect the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for forage for hens, partial renovation of the barn, and cultivation costs

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 35 years old and a single mother of 2 children. For the past 7 years, she has been selling potatoes and charcoal in Kitengela. Winfred plans to use this loan to buy more bags of potatoes and charcoal to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is Winfred's first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to expand her businesses, make more income, give her children a good and quality education and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more stock of potatoes and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Joud 2 Group

texts.en:
Samia is the featured borrower of Joud2 group. She got together with the other group members to hold hands and acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they are working hard to develop their businesses and living situation.

Samia is the first lady at the far right side of the picture with a red top. She works as a Touristic guide in a company. At the same time she runs her own accessories sales business from home in order to increase her family's income, especially since she is a 50-year-old divorced mother of two children. She has been working hard for ten years to provide them with the necessary living needs and requests.

Samia's acquired loan will be invested in expanding her accessories collection with specially released Christmas designs that will attract customers attention, and will improve her sales.

As for the other group members, Jannat is the lady at the center, and Rita is the first from the left.

loans.use: To expand her accessories collection with specially released Christmas designs that will attract customers' attention
